Job Description:
Position Summary

Manager of all aspects of Regulatory Affairs and Quality Assurance.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Technical

Interface with European parent organization to obtain necessary information required for FDA and CE compliance.
Familiar with the principles of process and product validations
Compile and/or create information for FDA regulatory submissions and technical files.
Experience in conversion process from MDD to MDR.
Prepare for and participate in FDA facility inspections, ISO audits, and third party audits.
Responsible for oversight regarding complaints and reporting MDRs.
Ensure in house training is completed according to QSR and ISO
Experienced with detailed compliance plans to FDA’s QSR regulation
Prepare and submit periodic reports, annual reports and various responses to the FDA or other regulatory agencies.
Ensure all regulatory requirements under any marketing authorization are met.
Responsible for maintaining Quality System/ISO compliance.
Responsible for coordinating the Company’s ISO audits.
Auditing (internal and external) experience required

Administrative

Develop labeling and ensure labeling updates as well as documentation compliance.
Administration of all company operating procedures, SOPs and document control.
Review and approve Quality documents for compliance to QSR requirements (i.e. DHR, CAPA, NCMR )

Travel

Some overnight travel required, both domestic and international.

Developmental

Responsibilities include participate in interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work

Supervisory

Manages department personnel. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

Job Requirements

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education/Qualifications

Minimum of 10 years experience in medical device products with a Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from a four-year accredited college or university, or fifteen years related Quality Assurance, Regulatory Affairs and compliance experience and/or training with a BA or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Certification of the American Society of Quality (ASQ, CQM) and/or Regulatory Affairs Professional Society (RAPS, RAC-US/US/EU/Canada) and/or Project Management Institute (PMI, PM) preferred.

Experience

Work experience in medical device products environment.

Aptitude

Mathematical skills

Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.

Reasoning Ability

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Ability to gather and interpret subjective and quantitative input in the development of business analysis.

Operational Skills

Language

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals as well as common scientific and technical journals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers.

Technical and Computing

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts and fumes or airborne particles. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Job Title: Sr. Bank Business Systems Analyst Specialist

Job Description:
Our Operations Analyst plays a pivotal role in our organization by overseeing Service and Installation Managers across core divisions, driving cross-functional projects, and maintaining exceptional customer relations. Ideal candidates should bring 5-7 years of relevant experience, possess relevant education, demonstrate technical proficiency, and hold valued certifications.

Leadership and Oversight:

Provide direct leadership to Installation and Service Managers via regular check-in meetings, championing tailored training and certification programs, and offering guidance to address operational challenges and ensure alignment with corporate goals.
Foster a culture of collaboration and open communication among managers to encourage synergy across divisions.

Project Management and Strategic Planning:

Lead cross-functional projects, leveraging expertise from multiple departments to enhance operational efficiencies and integrate new technologies.
Define project scope, establish timelines, allocate resources, and closely monitor project progression to ensure on-time and on-budget deliverables.
Collaborate closely with leadership to develop and execute strategic and operational plans.

KPI Development and Monitoring:

Establish and regularly review KPIs to evaluate operational success, guide strategic decision-making, and identify areas for improvement.
Implement advanced monitoring tools and analytics platforms to collect real-time data, enabling agile responses to evolving business needs.

Customer Relations and Quality Control:

Uphold our company's reputation for rapid and reliable responses, ensuring all customer interactions consistently meet or exceed established service standards.
Develop and maintain CRM systems to streamline communication and enhance customer relationship management.
Create and enforce quality control procedures to ensure the consistent delivery of top-tier services and products.

Skills and Qualifications:

Industry Certifications (Low Voltage, ESA. NICET) are preferred.
Understanding of various project management methodologies such as Waterfall, Agile, and Kanban.

Education and Experience:

5-7 years of professional experience in operations and project management, with a proven track record of successfully overseeing multiple projects completed timely and within budget. Security and Fire Protection experience preferred.
Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Operations Management, Engineering, or a related field preferred.
Relevant certifications, such as Project Management Professional (PMP), PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), or CompTIA Project+, are preferred.

Why Us?

Competitive salary that aligns with experience
Supportive, team-oriented work environment
Generous PTO and paid holidays to encourage a healthy work-life balance
Unrestricted opportunity for professional growth and development
Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, vision, and life insurance.
Breakfast on Fridays, quarterly luncheons, and exciting team building events

This is not a comprehensive list of duties and are subject to change.

Candidates must pass a background check and drug test after accepting offer for employment.

Prologis, Inc. is the global leader in logistics real estate. In partnership with our customers and our communities, we develop modern, high-quality properties that set the standard for innovative building design and sustainability. Prologis owns or has investments in properties and development projects of ~1.2 billion square feet in 19 countries and enables 2.8% of the world’s GDP. We have committed to achieve net zero emissions by 2040. Beyond real estate, our Essentials platform optimizes the company’s global asset portfolio to provide our customers solutions that address today’s warehouse and shipping challenges. Prologis Ventures invests in logistics innovation and technology companies to modernize supply chains worldwide.
Job Title:
Financial Operations Analyst
Company:
Prologis
Prologis is looking for a Financial Operations Analyst/Associate to join our multifaceted Operations team. You will have direct accountability and ownership of budgeting, forecasting, processing, planning, analysis and reporting of multiple financial metrics for a portfolio of assets within assigned markets in our growing East Region. If you're looking to make an impact on a Global level, apply today! This role will be operating locally out of our Buckhead office.
Position Responsibilities:
Budgeting, Forecasting & Reporting
Responsible for the preparation, coordination and review of annual operating budgets, forecasts, reporting and monthly variance analysis of each assigned market.
Coordinate collection of leasing assumptions, operating and capital expenses for budgets and forecasts.
Review budget, forecast and actual results for reasonableness and take appropriate action as necessary. Examples of follow-up actions are giving feedback to the operations teams about their inputs, correcting errors found through in-depth cash flow analysis, and explaining variances between forecasts and actual monthly accounting results.
Participate in the preparation of quarterly budget and forecast presentations to divisional leadership.
Serve as the Operations Finance expert in assigned markets and be a resource to the local team.
Present forecasting, budgeting, and reporting results to Market Officer, with a focus on key performance drivers
Provide guidance to Property Management and Leasing Teams on forecasting, budgeting, and reporting systems and processes.
Act as a liaison between accounting and the local market teams
Support senior management and cross-functional business partners with timely, accurate and actionable analysis.
Track key performance indicators (KPI’s) (i.e., NOI, Same Store Sales, Occupancy, Rent Change, Turnover Costs, Capital Expenditures) and explain main performance drivers and variances.
Provide data stewardship for leasing activity from lease review through data entry, including workflow management between multiple groups to ultimately ensure that reporting captures the transactions’ character. Serve as an expert in the reporting implications of lease transactions.
Essential Skills & Experience:
Undergraduate degree, preferably with a concentration in finance, accounting, real estate, or economics
3+ years related work or related graduate course work experience. Budgeting and forecasting experience is a plus.
Excellent analytical and written communication skills, including the ability to present and engage with regional management team members.
Advanced Excel modeling skills a must
Proficient using Word and PowerPoint
Self-starter – ability to creatively tackle new situations and analyses without heavy direction.
High level of intellectual curiosity with strong desire to continuously learn, improve / automate existing processes and solve problems independently.
Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy
Execute responsibilities with a sense of urgency and follow-through.
Positive and proactive work ethic, with a strong commitment to delivering a high level of customer service.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines with efficiency and accuracy.
Show tact, discretion, confidentiality and good judgement in handling sensitive and confidential matters and documentation.
Hiring Salary Range of: $75,000–$91,000. Salary and whole compensation package (bonus target) to be determined by the candidate’s location, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data.
#LI-AN1
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
As a successful global enterprise, Prologis has never lost sight of what matters most, our strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. And because of that, we provide a generous total rewards package and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. People come first here.
All full-time roles in the US come with a robust benefits package which includes healthcare, dental, and vision insurance for employees and eligible dependents. Prologis also offers several other wellness, financial, and work/lifestyle-specific benefits. Our 401(k) retirement plan has a company match of 50% up to 12% of eligible compensation. We also offer generous PTO with a starting accrual of 22 days a year in addition to paid holidays and volunteer time.
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of drug screen and background verification. Prologis is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religions, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

P&D seeks a Business Tax Analyst to join our corporate team. Reporting to the CFO, this position is responsible for managing business-critical tasks related to sales, use, and other non-income related taxes including the filing of applicable tax returns. This is a role well suited to an ambitious and experienced professional who is self-motivated, works well independently and in a team setting.

Responsibilities

The analyst will work alongside the CFO and Corporate Controller to perform various tax related tasks including (but not limited to):

Prepare/file/process payments for multi-state sales and use tax returns, business licenses, annual reports, and other miscellaneous tax returns
Improve current tax filing processes, research, and respond to inquiries from taxing authorities
Research tax laws related to sales, use, business licensing, and other taxes to ensure compliance with all applicable tax laws based upon the relevant jurisdiction
Gather, prepare, and upload applicable tax related information for customers/vendors into Deltek VantagePoint (ERP)
Collect, analyze, and evaluate tax certificates, W-9 forms, and other relevant tax information for upload into ERP
Assist with technical research supporting tax positions taken in tax filings, including drafting written memorandums
Contact tax agencies to obtain relevant tax information, resolve issues, and reconcile tax notices
Monitor multi-state jurisdiction sales tax legislation, rate changes, pronouncements, and other current developments that impact the taxability of business operations
Effectively communicate with internal staff, taxing authorities, customers, and suppliers on tax matters
Assists with tax audits
Assist management and accounting teams with tasks, as needed

Preferred Skills and Qualifications

We look for team players who are eager to learn, grow and excel. You should be accountable, self-directed, professional, and open to the possibilities that exist for you at P&D. Our firm was built by cultivating long-term relationships based on exemplary service and integrity. Candidates should be like-minded in that regard, willing to go the extra mile to exceed customer expectations. Candidates should have:

Basic accounting/tax rules knowledge
Ability to work independently or as part of a team
Analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Possess a strong work ethic, personal and professional integrity, and a positive attitude
Ability to develop new or enhanced tax reporting processes and procedures to improve efficiencies and mitigate tax risks for the business

This position will require occasional travel (up to 25% of the time). May be asked to work extended hours in order to meet project deadlines. Candidates must pass a background check prior to employment.

P&D is an employee-owned company, where all full-time employees have the opportunity to own stock – and most do. We offer competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package, and the opportunity to learn, grow, and contribute to a vibrant culture that stands the test of time.

GAT Airline Ground Support is seeking a highly motivated individual, a self-starter, and a team player, with a strong drive for results and continual improvement. By joining our team, you will enjoy a competitive salary, great benefits, and a creative and energetic work environment.

Job Summary:
The Resource Planning Analyst role is responsible for labor planning for airport operations through intermediate-level analysis. The role requires generating monthly forecasts in order to make recommendations related to staffing levels at specific stations. The position requires applying and creating staffing models to forecast & analyze labor requirements based on passenger volumes, flight schedules, flight peak changes, and anticipated changes in technology and business processes. The role requires presenting financial analyses and reports to department and station leadership. Additional responsibilities include using variance reports, identifying the financial impact of potential changes to employee labor contracts, labor productivity, and operational performance metrics as well as providing ad-hoc scenario analysis.

As member of the Resource Planning team, the resource planning analyst is assigned a geographic region of stations to support. Applies resource planning tools, staffing standards, volume forecast and labor constraints to develop optimal staffing recommendations for future flight schedules for assigned stations
Reviews recommendations with assigned stations and works with Station GM or their designate to finalize personnel authorization levels for each month
May also gather standard methodology data and may make program/process recommendations to support corporate/division programs and policy updates
May support ongoing or special analyses related to future flight schedules, potential staffing standards changes, pivotal initiatives and potential changes to labor agreements
May be responsible for overseeing low to medium visibility projects within division
Collaborate with all levels of employee groups
Proactively seeks out opportunities on process improvement for department and field organizations
Proactively finds opportunities to reduce service defects and cost to serve
GAT Airline Ground Support values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table.

What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):

Bachelors degree
Proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office
Self-starter, analytical, problem solver, and has proficiency in measurement, assessment, and evaluation
Capacity/staffing modeling experience
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship
Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position
What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):

Bachelors in a quantitative or operations related field (Ex: operations management, engineering, statistics, math, business, economics)
Experience working in or with operations

JOB TITLE: Business Intelligence Analyst

DEPARTMENT: Analytics

JOB LOCATION: Atlanta

STATUS: Exempt

REPORTS TO: Director of Finance & Analytics

LAST REVISION: November 2023

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Walk-On’s Sports Bistreaux was founded in 2003 by two former walk on basketball players for the LSU basketball team. The concept started as a school project where these two walk-ons got a C on the project. The walk on mentality and the dream to open a sports bar that served great Louisiana cuisine near LSU kept the founders busy at work, looking for a location and financing to bring the dream alive. Walk-On’s was voted ESPN’s #1 Sports Bar in North America in 2012, NFL quarterback Drew Brees invested in the company in 2015 and today Walk-On’s owns and franchises 80+ locations. Our Purpose is to bring people together and Vision is to be More Than a Restaurant that inspires a lifestyle that embraces the underdog mindset in all of us. Walk-On’s management team is focused on being the best franchisor in the industry and has hired great talent ahead of the need to achieve this mission.

SUMMARY DESCRIPTION

The Business Intelligence Analyst will report to the Director of Finance & Analytics and will partner cross-functionally with marketing, operations, finance, technology and other key stakeholders within Walk-On’s. The Business Intelligence Analyst will ensure data accuracy and consistent reporting by designing and creating optimal processes and procedures for the analytics function. They will use advanced data modeling, predictive modeling and analytical techniques to interpret key findings from company data and leverage these insights into initiatives that will support business outcomes. The right person for the job will apply their exhaustive knowledge of data analysis to solving real-world problems faced by our company and finding opportunities for improvement across multiple projects, teams and business units.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Strong SQL skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries.
Expertise with Microsoft data and business intelligence tools including Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Stream Analytics, Power Automate, and PowerBi.
Oversee the design and delivery of reports and insights that analyze business functions and key operations and performance metrics.
Ensure accuracy of data and deliverables of reporting employees with comprehensive policies and processes.
Manage and optimize processes for data intake, validation, mining and engineering as well as modeling, visualization and communication deliverables.
Examine, interpret, and report results of analytical initiatives to stakeholders in leadership, technology, sales, marketing and operations teams.
Oversee the data/report requests process: tracking requests submitted, prioritization, approval, etc.
Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology, budget and business within your department and design/implement solutions to meet these needs.
Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective management of analyst and data employees and effective collaboration with stakeholders.
Communicate results and business impacts of insight initiatives to stakeholders within and outside of the company

Qualifications

Working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources.
Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business units.
Experience and knowledge of statistical modeling techniques
Experience using analytics techniques to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes.
Strong ability to plan and manage multi processes, people and projects simultaneously.
Excellent communication, collaboration and delegation skills.
Strong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilities.
Expert Excel modeling skills and experience with Word and PowerPoint.

Education and Experience

4+ years of relevant industry experience in the areas of Strategic Analytics, Business Intelligence, Business Economics, Data Science, or Consulting
Graduate degree, preferably MS in Engineering, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related technical discipline.
Hospitality, Casual Dining, QSR or Fast Casual experience preferred

Travel Requirements

Ability to travel 0-10%.

Job Summary

As a member of the Professional Services team, the Business Analyst (BA) is an external-facing, project-based role, focused on the elicitation of Customer User Stories, their documentation and analysis, and the declarative configuration of the solution that results from this documentation. Note that the BA is the owner of all User Stories for a given implementation, whether the story work is declarative or custom. The Business Analyst collaborates with the Project Manager, Solution Architect & Developer roles, to ensure adherence to contracted scope and budget, and to affirm their solution design and configurations have been optimized for their customer's requirements and business operations. The BA also drives data migration activities, including object mapping and data validation (post migration). Additionally, the BA works closely with their Project Manager, to groom their backlog and validate quality/accuracy of any deliverables. This role is further responsible for documenting a customer's full software configuration/solution, providing demonstrations of configurations/solutions, and for end-User training and supporting the effort through deployment and go live.

Responsibilities

Facilitate customer meetings, either virtually or in person as required by the Project.
Lead requirements elicitation and User Story documentation.
Execute software configurations in alignment with the documentation and contracted scope/budget.
Create a backlog of Stories, by project, for review and collaboration with the Project Manager.
Work with the Solution Architect and Developer roles to document solutions
Develop test scripts and acceptance criteria for the user stories
Prioritize and assign user stories to the development team
Perform configuration of our application, including Salesforce configuration
Validate all customization work and provide Customer-facing demonstrations.
Prepare and analyze data conversion requirements; identify data gaps.
Collaborate with data architects for data migration activities.
Lead User Acceptance Testing, deployment and validation activities.
Complete required project documentation (configuration documentation, User Stories, functional designs, deployment checklists, support documentation, etc.).
Directly and effectively train customer's personnel in the use of the system.
Clearly and effectively communicate with team and with customers regarding status, technical issues, enhancements, and creative solutions
Maintain target billable utilization while providing quality work

Requirements

Minimum 3 years of experience working as an admin/analyst in Salesforce.com environment with external clients/customers
Salesforce admin (ADM201) certification
Knowledge of all aspects of testing end-user products: Functional, Performance, Security, Usability, etc.
Excellent troubleshooting, analysis, and problem-solving skills
Ability to effectively prioritize and escalate issues as required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; adept at presentation to customers and senior management
Experience with Project Management tools such as Jira/Confluence or similar tools
Solid experience with the Microsoft Office Suite and Products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Sharepoint, Teams, Visio)
Ability to work remotely without direct supervision.
Occasional travel may be necessary as required by the customer.

Preferred

Previous experience or knowledge of working on Fonteva product/application
Experience with other CRM/Association Management Systems
Working knowledge of Salesforce.com administration, configuration, customization, and third-party integration or other CRM environment
Prior consulting experience
Additional certifications such as (PAB, DEV 1)

Excited about this role but don't meet every single requirement? Human Resources Manager

First Century Bank has an exciting career opportunity available for a Human Resources Manager to join our team. This position will be a hybrid position working remotely, as well as from the Commerce office and the Roswell office as needed. This individual will contribute to all functions of the Human Resources department including organizational development, policies and programs covering employment, compensation, benefits, performance management, employee relations, recruiting and retention, and compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. Ensures appropriate administration of payroll and its compliance with bank and client policy as well as with state, federal and local regulations.

First Century Bank has specialized in providing financial services through technology channels for our clients. The HR Manager is a career opportunity which would be critical to the growth of the organization and ensuring that the organization maintains its culture and expectations.

Duties will include the following:

1. Administers performance review program to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and equity within organization.

2. Ensures annual reporting requirements are completed accurately and in a timely manner such as the EEO-1 Report, VETS4212 Report, Affirmative Action plan preparation/reporting, 5500 reporting, ACA Reporting, payroll reporting and filing, and other regulatory reporting as may be required.

3. Establishes programs and practices to ensure the effective recruiting and retention of qualified employees. Recruits, interviews, tests, and makes recommendations to fill vacant positions. Assists in drafting and posting of job openings, interviewing, or other tasks necessary to ensure adequate staffing levels are achieved to meet organizational needs. Manage NMLS registration process for new hires, changes, and annual registration efforts for all Loan Originators at Bank.

4. Administers salary administration program to ensure compliance and equity within organization.

5. Maintains current knowledge of legal requirements and government reporting regulations affecting human resources and payroll functions and ensures policies, procedures, and reporting are in compliance. Ensures appropriate review of payroll as needed to maintain compliance and high level of accuracy. Directs Bank compliance with all applicable laws and regulations such as Affirmative Action, Wage and Hour regulations, ADA, OSHA, FMLA, and all other applicable regulations. Identifies areas of the human resource policies and procedures which need to be updated due to changing best practices or state, federal or local regulations.

6. Ensures regular review, redesign, approval, and communication of all benefit programs including major medical, dental vision, 401k, disability, life and other applicable programs. Ensures programs are designed to attract and retain key talent, and is consistent with organizational goals. Directs reporting as necessary consistent with state and federal regulations. Acts as liaison with broker and senior management to ensure viable alternatives are explored and evaluated. Coordinate all open enrollment activities, meetings, new rates/plans, and updated enrollment process.

7. Trains management in interviewing, hiring, terminations, promotions, performance review, safety, and sexual harassment.

8. Facilitates and contributes to appropriate communication to employees regarding organizational policies, procedures and all applicable Human Resource updates.

9. Advises management in cooperation with Human Resource team to ensure appropriate resolution of employee relations issues. Performs initial counseling with supervisors on performance, discipline, hiring, promotional and termination related issues. Conducts all Human Resource related investigations. Seeks out senior management, consultant or legal opinions as needed.

10. Drafts applicable Human Resources communication, policies and procedures as needed, ensures appropriate communication of applicable changes, and responds to inquiries regarding policies, procedures, and programs.

11. Provides assistance on complex issues related to benefit administration, wage and hour requirements, workers compensation claims, and employee relations issues.

12. Directs and participates in wage surveys within labor market to determine competitive wage rate.

13. Manages termination process to ensure compliance with state and federal laws, in addition to reviewing employee separation notices and related documentation, and conducts exit interviews to determine reasons behind separations.

14. Ensures appropriate vendor management including regular review of performance, and review and approval of applicable invoices.

15. Performs such other duties as may be assigned or which inherently or logically belong with the position.

16. Exemplify FCB's values while carrying out its mission and organizational goals and priorities.

Qualified candidates should possess a bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management or Business Management and 5+ years of related experience, or a comparable combination of education and experience. A PHR or SHRM-CP certification is a plus. Individual should be proficient in Microsoft products, critical thinking and problem Solving. Candidates should possess a high level of attention to detail, exceptional communication skills, project management skills and business analysis skills.

Essential Functions:

Provides direction to align technology with County strategies, priorities, and business needs; oversees the evaluation and redesign of business processes to enhance business functionality and efficiency; provides business and technical expertise on trends, external practices, and the application of new and existing technology to business practices; serves as agency’s point of contact to coordinate technology needs and requests; and evaluates, prioritizes, and educates others on the business and technical implications of requested changes and improvements on systems.

Manages business process activities for the systems development life cycle for new and/or existing complex systems; manages the development, implementation, interoperability, and security of systems; determines appropriate system life cycle techniques and methods for implementation; and serves as lead system administrator for multiple complex, inter-departmental systems in multiple environments and on a variety of platforms.

Develops processes to ensure compliance with established rules and regulations, policies and procedures; and identifies and maintains key performance measures for business processes associated with technical systems.

Manages functional testing during solution implementation; ensures solutions function correctly to serve user needs without compromising other system functions; and manages documentation of system requirements, specifications and changes.

Supervises the delivery of training classes to user communities; supervises the creation of user training manuals and lesson plans; selects training times/locations based on users’ needs; and answers questions and provides information during and after training.

Negotiates service contracts; prepares business and technical specifications and requirements; participates in negotiations of scope of services and fees for professional services agreements; makes recommendations regarding selection of vendors and awarding of contrac contracts; and monitors vendor performance and contract fulfillment

Maintains an awareness of new applications, technologies, technical methods, business trends, and advances in the profession; reviews professional publications, technical manuals, and websites to increase knowledge of network operations; and attends conferences, workshops, and training sessions as appropriate.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field required; five years of progressively responsible technical experience in a centralized Information Technology environment, to include lead or supervisory experience, and seven years of experience in the field; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience which provides the requisite knowledge, skills, and abilities for this job.

Specific License or Certification Required: Must possess and maintain a valid Georgia driver’s license; Information Technology Infrastructure Library certification, Six Sigma certification, and Lean Six Sigma certification preferred.

COMPANY OVERVIEW
PlayOn! Sports is the nation's leading high school media and technology company, providing streaming and digital ticketing services to thousands of high schools nationwide. In 2013, PlayOn! Sports and the National Federation of State High School Associations (NFHS) created the NFHS Network, a joint venture that aggregates the sports media and related rights of state high school athletic associations while celebrating the accomplishments of student-athletes, student broadcasters, and high schools across the country. Through the NFHS Network, PlayOn! Sports provides automated production capabilities free of charge to schools which allows them to live-stream via artificial intelligence and automation thus avoiding the need for production personnel.

In 2022, PlayOn! Sports and GoFan (backed by KKR a leading global investment firm), the leading digital ticketing company in the high school sports market, joined forces to create a streamlined customer experience for in-person, live-stream, and on-demand events. There are 19,500 high schools in the NFHS ecosystem and PlayOn! Sports currently works with over 50% of them. Going forward, the company is focused on: 1) continuing to grow the number of schools it works with; 2) continuing to grow the average revenue per school; 3) expanding the products and services it provides to the high school ecosystem beyond streaming; 4) expanding outside of high school sports.

THE ROLE

PlayOn! Sports is looking for a seasoned Technical Business Analyst to become a part of our team. In this role, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions. You will be responsible for analyzing, documenting, and translating complex business requirements into technical specifications. This pivotal role encompasses the management and escalation of bugs and other pertinent issues beyond the capacity of Streaming Support (SST) and Customer Service for our NFHS Network streaming brand.

Additional responsibilities and accountabilities for this role include:

Analyze and categorize technical escalations from SST, ensuring they are well documented and ready for further action. This may involve complex technical logs or working with technical teams to grasp the details of certain issues.
Be the glue between SST, Product, and Customer Service. This means not only engaging in proactive dialogue with other departments to solve issues but also working hand in glove with the customer service team to ensure that the client’s voice is always in the mix.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their objectives, processes, and requirements.
Conduct thorough analysis of business processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
Translate business needs into detailed and comprehensive technical requirements and offering your technical insight to provide a clearer understanding of the platform and products to internal teams.

THE PERSON

3-5 years of experience, preferably in a technical liaison role.
Strong technical aptitude with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
Experience analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to extract valuable insights that inform business decisions.
Experience identifying trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing recommendations for data-driven solutions.
Streaming video background with direct experience operating or supporting a large-scale production video streaming service.
Experience working with CRM software and ticketing systems (Zendesk, Jira).
Bachelor's degree in a related field.


WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING AT PLAYON! SPORTS
PlayOn! Sports is more than just a place to work. It's a place to learn, grow, and thrive as people and professionals. We encourage a healthy work-life balance at PlayOn! Sports through offering flexible working schedules and generous paid time off in the off-season. Come be a part of the team that is changing the landscape of high school sports!

ChartRequest is looking to add to our Product organization with a qualified, self-driven product and design professional who is looking to make a splash with a growing company. As a Product leader at ChartRequest, you will be responsible for owning and crafting both product requirements and design across multiple channels and products including, but not limited to, the ChartRequest Application Suite (ROI, Referral Management, Analytics), the marketing website, global brand campaigns, video content, email content, product content, and various social channels. The goal is product-led growth. You will also work closely with the team to ideate and lead discussions pertaining to the continued development of the ChartRequest product and brand as well as production designers to ensure both consistency and power of messaging/visualization in market for the product and brand.

In addition to developing and maintaining the ChartRequest brand and product, you will work cross-functionally within the ChartRequest team to understand broader product and marketing initiatives and how the brand/design team can have an impact on shared goals and KPIs. This position reports directly into the Management Team at ChartRequest.

Passion for understanding technical concepts and distilling them down to short, compelling narratives (a true storyteller at heart)
Keen ability to write and develop unique and compelling content across both top-of-funnel and mid-funnel
Bring a critical, data-informed eye to existing campaigns and customer adoption journeys

DESCRIPTION

As an IT Business Relationship Management (BRM) Analyst, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between IT and business stakeholders and supporting the IT BRM Managers, reporting into the VP, Transformation & IT BRM. You will work closely with both technical teams and business units to understand their needs, align IT services with business objectives, and ensure the successful delivery of IT solutions. Your primary goal will be to enhance collaboration and communication between IT and the business units & functions, as well as within the IT functions. You will be a strong advocate for the Mativ IT culture in We Partner, We Listen, We Deliver & We Care.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Stakeholder Engagement
Develop and maintain strong relationships with business unit leaders, managers, and key stakeholders.
Act as a point of contact between the IT department and business units.
Requirements Gathering
Partner with BRM Managers to document and facilitate the demand intake process, including the gathering and documentation of IT-related requirements.
Build a systemic process for the IT demand funnel.
IT Service Portfolio Management
Assist in the management of the IT service portfolio, ensuring it meets the evolving needs of the business.
Identify opportunities to enhance existing IT services or introduce new ones.
Alignment with Business Objectives
Work with BRM managers and business stakeholders to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for IT projects and services.
Ensure that IT initiatives are aligned with the overall business strategy.
Project Coordination
Facilitate communication between IT project teams and business units.
Utilize IT systems to facilitate IT demand and execution process from idea generation to project hand-off to project management team.
Technology Trends and Innovation
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for innovation and process improvement.



QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field.
Proven experience in IT Business Relationship Management, Business Analysis, or a similar role.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Knowledge of ITIL or similar IT service management frameworks is a plus.
Project management skills and familiarity with project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) is beneficial.
Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) or ITIL is a plus.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work both with a team and independently.



ABOUT MATIV

Mativ is the newly created company through the combination of SWM and Neenah. This is an exciting opportunity for both companies to come together and create a global leader in specialty materials and solutions with approximately $3B in sales generated through our complementary products, innovation capabilities, customers, and attractive end-markets. Together, there is potential to create significant value for our customers, shareholders, and, most importantly, our employees. Mativ is headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia. The Company offers a wide range of critical components and engineered solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. With over 7,500 employees worldwide, we manufacture on four continents and generate sales in more than 100 countries. We offer a wide range of premium applications across diversified and growing end markets, from filtration to healthcare to sustainable packaging. Our broad portfolio of technologies combines polymers, fibers, and resins to optimize the performance of our customers’ products across multiple stages of the value chain. Our leading positions are a testament to our best-in-class global manufacturing, supply chain, and materials science capabilities. We drive innovation and enhance performance, finding potential in the impossible.

description

As an IT Business Relationship Management (BRM) Analyst, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between IT and business stakeholders and supporting the IT BRM Managers, reporting into the VP, Transformation & IT BRM. You will work closely with both technical teams and business units to understand their needs, align IT services with business objectives, and ensure the successful delivery of IT solutions. Your primary goal will be to enhance collaboration and communication between IT and the business units & functions, as well as within the IT functions. You will be a strong advocate for the Mativ IT culture in We Partner, We Listen, We Deliver & We Care.

responsibilities:

Stakeholder Engagement
Develop and maintain strong relationships with business unit leaders, managers, and key stakeholders.
Act as a point of contact between the IT department and business units.
Requirements Gathering
Partner with BRM Managers to document and facilitate the demand intake process, including the gathering and documentation of IT-related requirements.
Build a systemic process for the IT demand funnel.
IT Service Portfolio Management
Assist in the management of the IT service portfolio, ensuring it meets the evolving needs of the business.
Identify opportunities to enhance existing IT services or introduce new ones.
Alignment with Business Objectives
Work with BRM managers and business stakeholders to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for IT projects and services.
Ensure that IT initiatives are aligned with the overall business strategy.
Project Coordination
Facilitate communication between IT project teams and business units.
Utilize IT systems to facilitate IT demand and execution process from idea generation to project hand-off to project management team.
Technology Trends and Innovation
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for innovation and process improvement.


qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field.
Proven experience in IT Business Relationship Management, Business Analysis, or a similar role.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Knowledge of ITIL or similar IT service management frameworks is a plus.
Project management skills and familiarity with project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) is beneficial.
Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) or ITIL is a plus.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work both with a team and independently.


About Mativ

Mativ is the newly created company through the combination of SWM and Neenah. This is an exciting opportunity for both companies to come together and create a global leader in specialty materials and solutions with approximately $3B in sales generated through our complementary products, innovation capabilities, customers, and attractive end-markets. Together, there is potential to create significant value for our customers, shareholders, and, most importantly, our employees. Mativ is headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia. The Company offers a wide range of critical components and engineered solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. With over 7,500 employees worldwide, we manufacture on four continents and generate sales in more than 100 countries. We offer a wide range of premium applications across diversified and growing end markets, from filtration to healthcare to sustainable packaging. Our broad portfolio of technologies combines polymers, fibers, and resins to optimize the performance of our customers’ products across multiple stages of the value chain. Our leading positions are a testament to our best-in-class global manufacturing, supply chain, and materials science capabilities. We drive innovation and enhance performance, finding potential in the impossible.

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

What you’ll be doing...

This Director position will be responsible for end to end delivery of multiple Digital Service (Mobile & Home) programs on the web, mobile, app and cloud based platforms for Verizon. Responsibilities include Digital Marketing, Customer Experience / Omni Programs for Base Customer Support Digitally. The leader will be responsible for building a highly motivated and talented team, coaching and mentoring them to deliver high quality products and services. The Director will partner with business units to establish goals, influence and effectively communicate the vision set by Senior Leadership.

This position can be located in other valid Verizon locations.

Responsibilities

End to end delivery and support responsibility for all Verizon FIOS, Mobility & 5G FWA (Fixed Wireless Access) e-commerce solutions & Systems.

End to end delivery responsibility for Digital Marketing, Customer Experience & Omni programs delivery on web, app & other 24X7 on premise or cloud platforms.

Responsible for production defects (experience, functional, accessibility, & performance) fixing, support and troubleshooting of various platforms.

Establish objectives, create road maps, and align with key partners and stakeholders to ensure delivery of company goals.

Lead technology direction, facilitate key decision points, convert requirements into working product outcomes and drive integration with various Verizon and vendor systems.

Lead the design and architecture support for tactical and transformative ecommerce 24x7 solutions.

Drive SRE implementation including ideation, business case, architecture, design, stakeholder management, development, trials and delivery using industry standard processes and tools.

Partner with onshore and offshore design team to create and optimize UI, UX, usability and functional experience of digital sales and cross channel experience.

Lead creation of “minimum viable product”, prioritize critical tasks and enable test and learn approaches to iteratively deliver technical and business solutions.

Lead design of load and scalability testing and successful execution of testing & tuning.

Deliver results within budget, time, quality and strategic and tactical key performance goals.

Document and comply with software quality, data security and compliance processes.

Create proposals and present effectively to a diverse audience; manage stakeholders.

Hire, retain, develop high performing motivated talent and leaders both onshore and offshore. Manages teams in both direct and matrix structures. Manage multi-skilled global contractors and employees.

Drive employee satisfaction and engagement for the Digital organization.

What we’re looking for...

You’ll need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems, or related field.

Accelerated degree preferred.

Required knowledge of sales, eCommerce, Digital experience and Retail operations.

Must have demonstrated experience in partnering with Business and IT teams at multiple levels to drive alignment and delivery of complex problems.

Even better if you have:

Software Engineering and Development experience, including leading IT teams through Business Analysis, Project Management, and digital technologies.

A history of embracing and incubating emerging technology and open source products

Ability to collaborate with various partners in the tech, startup and academic ecosystems

The ability to seed and extend innovation into the greater organization to develop key talent, consistent with that of a leading technology company

Technical Leadership: the ability to choose the right technologies and inspire your teammates to deliver quality software solutions

Strong presentation skills to communicate complex concepts effectively.

Strong experience in SRE, Microservices, Cloud, Web ,Native (IOS/Android) & related Digital technologies.

Experience with relevant project and program delivery experience. Systems Administration or Engineering background preferred.

Experience with technology leadership, including solid understanding of technology selection, architecture, and full stack implementation.

Delivery experience in highly available and massively scalable ecommerce systems and services. Including Experience supporting mobile web and/ or native systems.

Direct people management experience, including leadership of diverse global teams. Experience leading senior talent, mentoring and coaching.

Experience with metrics instrumentation and leveraging digital analytics to drive experience and performance improvements. Strong experience with A-B testing and multi-variant trials.

Experience in troubleshooting & supporting mission critical 24X7 production systems, lead real-time high stake risk mitigation plan and drive timely decisions

Experience in business process transformation, user experience optimization.

Experience in Agile Process & methodologies.

Experience managing Medium to large scale ecommerce applications.

Experience building and leading a team in the development and rapid delivery of next-generation digital products

Implement MVP solutions that will drive long term technical strategy

Review, contribute to, and oversee the code and architectural patterns designed by senior-level engineers on your team

Collaborate with product managers and other partners to build a product strategy and roadmap

Collaborate with architects, other teams, product owners, and software engineers to drive the implementation of new applications

Take ideas and concepts, and visualize them in ways such that they are communicated effectively and compellingly for internal leaders, partners and customers

Understanding of ways to lead a team developing in an Agile environment

A robust portfolio of shipped code on GitHub or other open Source contributions and experience with distributed/scalable systems is a plus

At Harris Novum, we build feature rich hospital specific software for a healthcare Revenue Cycle Management system. Our Affinity product suite simplifies patient access/self-service and data capture, billing and claims processes, and collection follow-up with an integrated set of patient revenue and patient management solutions.
As a Business Analyst, you will work with the Product Owner and directly with customers and other stakeholders to drive high-level User Stories or Functional Designs down to product specifications. You will be an extension of the Product Owner to help with detailing User Stories/Functional Designs. Thinking through priorities and product workflows. You will work closely with development staff to handle day-to-day execution of support cases, ensuring software quality and the appropriate functional details are covered. You will need to be comfortable with demonstrating the software to stakeholders and customers.
Desired Experience:
Functional knowledge of the U.S. healthcare Revenue Cycle Management operational workflow and systems.
Previous hospital business office, patient access, or other revenue cycle management hospital departmental related experience preferred.
Prior involvement with the rollout of software releases and implementations.
Practical understanding of Agile development principles and practices.
Working knowledge of techniques to document business requirements (User Stories, Use Cases, Sequence Diagrams, or Functional Design equivalent, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Passion for details that you can balance with business realities.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Management or other healthcare related field is preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of business analysis experience.
Certifications (Optional): Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP). Project Management Professional (PMP) can be beneficial.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to facilitate effective collaboration.
Ability to provide guidance, work direction to those with less experience and system knowledge.
Proficiency in using business analysis tools and methodologies.
Familiarity with project management concepts and software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Work independently and with a group of individuals.
Conducts and participates in design reviews, provides product demonstrations and training, supports implementation of software and beta support of customer.
Defines application specifications, creates design workflows and flowcharts, and develops use cases or user stories with screen mockups for product development and quality assurance.
Prepares specification documentation in compliance with the software lifecycle methodology.
Performs workflow analysis studies.
Able to create test cases from use case and design requirements. Complete the design validation and verification testing and QA testing as needed, and analyze results.
Responsible for managing complex projects and able to provide work direction and guidance to project team members.
Acts as a project or implementation lead for software installations and beta releases. Conducting product trainings, software setup assistance, and guidance to new or existing customers.
Supports professional services activities as needed. Ensuring efficient delivery of implementation services and meeting key project milestones.
Collaborates with development staff to validate application design.
Creates and reviews release notes, user guides and other application documentation.
Travel to customer sites, meetings, and conferences as required by business conditions.
Analysis and Documentation:
Analyze and model current business processes to identify areas for improvement, automation, and artificial intelligence.
Create comprehensive documentation, including business process diagrams, data models, and functional specifications.
Define and document product functionality in Release Notes and User Guides.
Create business features, stories and any functional supporting documentation within Atlassian’s JIRA application.
Ensure traceability between requirements to features to user stories/designs.

Solution Design:
Work closely with technical teams to design and propose appropriate technical solutions that meet business needs.
Ensure that proposed solutions align with organizational standards and best practices.
Excellent presentation skills required to perform product demonstrations and conduct end user champion group sessions/early adopters.

JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for reviewing business processes and proposing technical solutions to solve business problems. Gain strong understanding of current procedures and identify improvements. Able to document the current state of business processes as well as the desired future state.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Demonstrates proficiency in requirements gathering, estimation, gaining customer approval, and delivery of requests.
Performs research and interviews business to determine business and technology requirements and then translate such into specifications for projects.
Performs feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the applications management team and the Project Manager to prioritize deliverables, and negotiate on product functionalities.
Creates detailed Requirement Document with functional and technical specifications. Effectively communicates and documents business and technical information in line with agreed processes and procedures.
Provides analytic support by coordinating data interpretation. Partners with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions.
Develop test plans, participates in Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.
Analyzes, facilitate, model, and organize information in order to reconcile conflicts, elicit requirements and distinguish solution ideas from business needs.
Identifies process improvement opportunities. Develops business process models and documentation. Assists business in Change Management activities.
Provide guidance for business implications of various applications. Work with the technology development teams on project requests and production issues.
Balances technology and business issues as well as communicates appropriately with both technology and business experts.

Bachelor’s Degree in Business or IT, preferred.
5+ years of experience working as a Functional and Technical Business Analyst.
Advanced skills in MS Tools- Excel, Power Point, Project, Visio, and Outlook.
5+ years of customer interfacing experience – project oversight, customer presentation.
5+ years’ work experience in full systems development.
An overall general understanding of large operating business environments and projecrs, SDLC, Change Control, Desktop Support, Service Desks, Application Development, Release Management.



COMPETENCIES:

Customer Service: Displays courtesy and sensitivity; Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Meets commitments; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service.
Analytical Skills: Applies logic and complex layers of rules to analyze and categorize complicated information. Goes beyond analyzing information to develop a conceptual understanding of the meaning of a range of information.
Problem Solving: Tests proposed solutions against the reality of likely effects before going forward; looks beyond the obvious and does not stop at first answers.
Communications: Exhibits good listening and comprehension; Expresses ideas and thoughts in written form; Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally; Keeps others adequately informed; Selects and uses appropriate communication methods.
Accuracy and Attention to Detail: Diligently attends to details and pursues quality in accomplishing tasks.
Quality: Applies feedback to improve performance; Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Displays commitment to excellence; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Teamwork: Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views.

The Position

CallRail is looking for a business intelligence analyst to generate business insights and use data to inform decision making. This role will report to the Business Intelligence manager and partner with stakeholders including marketing, product, sales, operations and finance teams.

To be a great fit for this role, you'll have an analytical mindset with a deep understanding of the role data plays for a business. You'll have advanced knowledge of business intelligence frameworks, tools and SQL. The successful candidate will capture and report on KPIs in a useful way and communicate these findings to all stakeholders.



What You'll Do
Design and implement analytical solutions that track key business metrics and provide actionable insights utilizing business intelligence tools such as Looker.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible format to inform weekly, monthly and quarterly business reporting.
Perform large-scale data analysis and develop solutions for trending, segmentation, classification, optimization, etc.
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business requirements, perform deep dive analyses and communicate the findings to help understand the value of the data.
Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results to cross functional teams.
Suggest improvements in the tools and techniques to help optimize and scale the team.
Understand data warehouse elements at a detailed level to support any form of user needs from research to ad-hoc querying to managing large information projects.
What You'll Need
General knowledge of database concepts and data flow processes between systems.
Understanding of business intelligence and data warehousing goals and principles.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders, gathering and documenting requirements.
Experience working in a BI tool such as Looker, Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, etc.
Experience writing complex SQL queries.
Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills; ability to effectively communicate with business and technical teams, including an understanding of the impact that data visualization and aesthetics can have on communicating value of data.
Excellent organization skills and the ability to multitask while efficiently completing high quality work

Bonus if you have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related degree
3+ years of experience in business intelligence or analytics; Looker and advanced SQL preferred.
Experience with Looker, GitHub, DBT and Redshift
Familiar with Python, R, AI/ML and AWS Lambda

Position: Sr. Financial Analyst (Commercial) | Location: Atlanta, GA | Type: Full-time

Job Summary: We are seeking a Commercial Financial Analyst to join our finance team and play a pivotal role in supporting our company's commercial operations. The Commercial Financial Analyst will be responsible for analyzing financial data, evaluating business performance, and providing strategic insights to optimize revenue generation and customer profitability. The ideal candidate should possess strong analytical abilities, business acumen, and the capability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. This is a new role which provides an opportunity to pioneer new ideas/processes and add value across the organization.

Responsibilities:

Business Performance Analysis:

Analyze customer sales data, revenue streams, and cost structures to assess financial performance.

Identify trends and patterns to support decision-making that enhances revenue growth and profitability.

Track operational and financial KPIs to identify root cause of swings in profitability.

Pricing and Profitability Analysis:

Evaluate pricing strategies by analyzing margins, market trends, and competitive landscapes.

Provide recommendations for optimal pricing structures that balance customer value and company profitability.

Perform profitability analysis on products, services, and customer segments to guide pricing decisions.

Forecasting and Budgeting:

Support the development of financial forecasts and budgets by customer profile.

Monitor actual financial performance against forecasts and budgets, highlighting variances and proposing corrective actions.

Financial Modeling and Scenario Analysis:

Develop financial models to assess the impact of different scenarios and strategic decisions on revenue and profitability.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze the financial implications of new business initiatives.

Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare and deliver clear and concise financial reports and presentations to communicate analysis findings to senior leadership.

Translate complex financial data into actionable insights for non-financial stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Minimum

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics, or related field with a minimum of five (5) years experience.
Proven experience in financial analysis, business analysis, or related roles.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other relevant financial software.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex financial information to diverse audiences.
Business acumen with the ability to understand the broader impact of financial decisions on commercial operations.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on accuracy and data integrity.

Preferred

Able to analyze data and build insightful models using Power Query, Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization/BI tools.
Experience using NetSuite to gather financial insights and build reports
Prior experience with process improvement and/or automation i.e. building macros, RPA, or Power Automate flows

Lathem Time is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in driving our product development strategy. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and facilitating the successful delivery of software solutions that are highly valued by our customers.

Job Responsibilities Include:
Develop and maintain comprehensive use case documents to clearly articulate product requirements
Anticipate and identify areas for improvement, proposing innovative solutions to enhance business processes and user experience
Stay abreast of the latest industry trends and advancements in software development and business analysis methodologies
Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among stakeholders, including customers, developers, and management
Conduct thorough product requirement analysis and benchmarking to ensure we exceed our customers’ business objectives
Prepare clear and concise documentation of analysis findings and recommendations so our developers have a clear understanding of the development requirements..
Effectively communicate insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
Gather critical information from meetings and stakeholders to produce actionable reports and feedback
Collaborate closely with the Product Owner to define product backlog items, prioritize initiatives, and ensure product doneness
Assist the Product Owner in managing projects, developing product roadmaps, and monitoring feature performance
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and end users, ensuring their needs are accurately represented and addressed


Mandatory Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business Analysis, Information Systems, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of experience in business analysis or a comparable role
Proven ability to gather, analyze, and document business requirements accurately and comprehensively
Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills to identify and resolve complex problems
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels
Expertise in Agile Scrum methodologies and experience participating in daily Scrum ceremonies
Proficient in Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, and Outlook
Familiarity with Azure DevOps or similar project management tools
Experience with Office 365, particularly OneDrive, SharePoint, and Microsoft Teams
Experience with time and attendance software or similar business applications
Exposure to software as a service (SaaS) environments
Exposure to B2B workforce management software


Examples of projects you will be potentially involved with:
Job/Project Costing
New integrated hardware products
Automated Exports
Mobile Application Refresh
Backend Security Updates.

Your role at Clorox:
Capital Systems Team is to provide more in depth analyses on capital spending in addition to providing systems and operations support to Engineering and Corporate functions (Logistics, R&D, Total Company IT, and CREWS Facilities) with Project Elevate. The Senior Capital Systems Analyst will play a critical role in helping business partners manage capital investments and improve spending accuracy for company-wide capital plans.

The Senior Capital Systems Lead is expected to provide actionable information to help with key decisions about capital spending investments, risks, and opportunities. This person is expected to improve tools and processes to enhance analytic capabilities and understanding of business performance.
In this role, you will:
Capital Forecasting & Reporting
Lead ad-hoc analysis projects for our businesses
Provide business partners and leadership with forward-looking financial direction and guidance relative to spending and forecasting.
Chip in to the monthly forecasting and annual planning processes
Inspire changes and improvements to capital forecasting (LRP, Outlook, Budget, quarterly outlook planning process.)
Foster an environment of continuous improvement that meets or exceeds division expectations.
Capital Systems Management
Maintain a strong internal control environment by detailing key activities and ensuring appropriate Delegation of Authority (DOAs) are followed.
Responsible for analysis related to business and corporate process, design, development and implementation of information technology systems.
Support a fast-moving environment, quickly and efficiently shift and update financial models when assumptions change.
Solve user and system issues. Engage developer as needed to resolve issues.
Training, System, & Process Improvement
Lead the development of One-Right-Way capital processes by maintaining, improving, and creating training documents and job-aids.
Coordinate the development and revision of training materials for the Capital Project Workshops.
Lead the training during the implementation of Project Elevate (Anaplan implementation and SAP S/4 Hana.) Identify and implement improvements to capital systems. Proactively engage users and managers to understand opportunities in systems and processes.
Mentor Project Managers and Engineering Managers in One-Right-Way for capital processes.
What we look for:
Career experience in financial analysis, accounting, operations finance, engineering, or related role(s) that demonstrates understanding and application of financial concepts, economic principles, other valuation metrics
Transformation focused: You are flexible and able to prioritize your work in a dynamic environment, embrace and lead change, and seek to improve processes
Systems and Tools savvy: You have experience sourcing large volumes of data from multiple systems, performing analysis, and developing a point of view
Confident Communicator: You have experience presenting complex financial concepts to various audiences and you engage effectively with your customers in multiple formats
Leadership: You have the ability to work independently and as part of a team; you have experience leading projects and mentoring/coaching less experienced team members
Experience in analyzing Finance/Operations/Engineering within a manufacturing industry
Experience with data analysis/visualization tools. Must have at least one of the following; Power BI, Alteryx, Tableau, VBA, Hyperion and/ SQL
Advanced MS Excel capability (pivot tables and reporting, working with macros, data manipulation/analysis, and formula creation)
Experience working with SAP or similar ERP systems
3-5 years of relevant work experience
Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) is preferred
Continuous improvement experience is preferred

Hybrid
