Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

Who we are looking for
This position supports State Street Global Services, Alternative Investment Solutions (AIS) business. Position Information

The purpose of this classification is to analyze transit services and needs for assigned departments in order to develop and implement technology solutions.

Essential Functions

Develops information systems project plans: conducts assessments with end-users to determine user needs and system requirements; identifies and manages critical path tasks; sets and meets interim project goals; sets and manages project contingency; and performs change control and all other associated project management efforts needed to ensure that project schedule and budget are met.

Manages projects during design and implementation phases: attends regular project progress meetings; works with vendors to resolve problems and to initiate the appropriate solutions; prepares, reviews, and processes change orders for changes to contracted scope of work; monitors adherence to project schedules; conducts and reviews testing; provides technical support during programming and implementation; verifies compliance of projects to County policy; and makes recommendations concerning improvements, modifications, design strategies, programming, systems infrastructure, or other aspects of project development.

Coordinates process for bidding and contracting of services of various project components or other technical services: prepares Requests For Proposal (RFP) and Requests for Quote (RFQ) for services; prepares technical specifications and requirements; participates in negotiations of scope of services and fees for professional services agreements; makes recommendations regarding selection of vendors and awarding of contracts; and monitors vendor performance and contract fulfillment.

Manages administrative aspects of assigned project: updates project schedules and monitors progress of project; reviews project; creates and maintains standard operating procedures and other documentation regarding maintaining system operations; and evaluates and monitors progress against performance and quality measurements.

Administers budgets of assigned projects: coordinates with assigned department in planning and cost estimating; prepares cost estimates for budget planning; provides justifications for requests; monitors and controls expenditures for approved projects; tracks expenditures and pay requests; submits invoices for payment; and maintains related documentation.

Provides post implementation and ongoing end-user support: responds to initial on-site requests for assistance troubleshoots and resolves problems; escalates problem to vendors or other personnel as appropriate; ensures continual operations of applications and systems; and utilizes diagnostic tools and other resources as appropriate.

Maintains an awareness of new applications, technologies, technical methods, trends, and advances in the profession: reviews professional publications, technical manuals, and websites to increase knowledge of network operations; and attends conferences, workshops, and training sessions as appropriate.

Must be able to demonstrate proficiency in performance of the essential functions and learn, comprehend, and apply all County or departmental policies, practices, and procedures necessary to function effectively in the position.

Performs other related duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field required; supplemented by five years of progressively responsible experience analyzing and implementing technology solutions and seven years of experience in the field; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience which provides the requisite knowledge, skills, and abilities for this job.


Preferred Qualifications

Transit experience

Physical Abilities

Tasks require the ability to exert light physical effort in sedentary to light work, but which may involve some lifting, carrying, pushing and/or pulling of objects and materials of light weight (5-10 pounds). Tasks may involve extended periods of time at a keyboard or work station.

Sensory Requirements

Some tasks require the ability to communicate orally.

Environmental Factors

Essential functions are regularly performed without exposure to adverse environmental conditions.

Business Analyst Manager

Great opportunity for a highly motivated and talented Data Analytics Manager to lead and deliver the insights needed to drive successful customer growth, campaign optimization, engagement, and predictive behavioral analysis. Your work will enable further sales and market share across our family of wireless brands that include PureTalk, H2O Wireless and Life Wireless, while also solidifying our competitive advantage of knowing/serving our customers better than the competition. You will be a key partner across our marketing team, sales and IT. You will function as a thought leader, problem solver, researcher, data analyst, report builder, and consultant. You will need to be comfortable rolling up your sleeves to solve complex business questions through data. Measuring KPIs across multiple customer touchpoints, delivering recommendations after identifying trends and actionable insights, and creating predictive analysis based on events, usage and behaviors will be critical responsibilities of this role.

Company:

Telrite Holdings, Inc. is a privately held telecom headquartered in Covington, GA approximately 30 miles east of downtown Atlanta with a secondary office located in Marietta, GA housing our IT and technical operations. Our brands include PureTalk, H2O and Life Wireless and provide wireless services to a broad national customer spectrum utilizing the nation’s largest GSM networks. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, great work-life balance and a unique work environment in our Covington, Georgia headquarters.

Responsibility Highlights

Provide business analytics, data, dashboards, and research support to marketing and sales. Make recommendations that shape marketing campaigns, sales strategy, QBRs, and offer creation.
Proactively identify, prioritize, and conduct analysis that drives meaningful change on KPIs and strategic objectives.
Gather requirements, design and build marketing performance tracking dashboards.
Support funnel analytics, KPI definitions, measurement, data pipeline, visualizations, and actionable insights.
Identify targeting and segmentation recommendations to optimize campaigns and acquisition opportunities.
Build persona look-a-like analysis.
Support account scoring and propensity modeling to identify intent and drive engagement.
Analyze campaign results for learnings and insights to support future strategy/tactics.
Support a highly productive relationship between marketing, sales and customer service while driving strong alignment on marketing strategic objectives and quarterly goals.
Support best-in-class business intelligence and data-driven marketing automation across the customer journey/funnel.
Prepare customer research, insights, and briefing reports. Generate actionable intelligence and uncover opportunities by leveraging tools to search out, break down, and analyze public, first/third-party information and data. Identify our customer’s challenges, pain points, initiatives, opportunities, and efficient entry points.
Construct executive level presentations and present complex analytical findings in clear, concise, and decision-impacting manner.
Promote and evangelize a culture of excellence, data-driven discussions, healthy skepticism, intellectual curiosity, knowledge sharing and teamwork while maintaining an environment that is upbeat and fun.

Skills/Qualifications

5+ years of relevant experience in business analytics, marketing application is a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in related field. MBA is a plus.
Advanced Google Analytics and Excel skills.
Comfortable querying large databases using SQL.
Experience working and joining together large, disparate data sets to uncover actionable insights.
Hands-on experience creating dashboards, reporting, and data visualizations.
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Independently identify key issues, patterns or deviations from norm.
Sharp attention to detail to identify data issues and anomalies during analysis.
Ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment, with attention to detail and effective prioritization.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated experience engaging and influencing senior leaders – ability to “tell the story.”
Resilient, flexible and innovative collaboration.
Previous wireless, cable/ISP, satellite, TV or other subscription-based experience a significant plus.
Acceptable background and E-Verify work eligibility.

Under general supervision, analyzes customer business needs and participates in the planning, design, documentation, and implementation of new or enhanced systems.

Job Description:
The Business Analyst will report to the Sr. Manager of Technical Solutions. Under limited supervision, this position will participate in the planning, documentation, design, testing, and implementation of new system functionality and enhancements to existing functionality for multiple systems. This position is responsible for capturing, analyzing, and documenting customer business needs and how they will be implemented in those designated systems. This position supports the user community by documenting business and process needs, creating system training material and documents, and supporting users needing assistance with system functionality. This position will work with different business units, vendors, and internal IT resources. This position may act as a team or project lead and contributes to building a strong relationship between the business and technology.

Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for both recommending and capturing business requirements, functional, and non-functional requirements for the various systems that client uses.
Participates in, and in some cases may lead, business requirement gathering sessions with internal stakeholders, business vendors, and partner programs and agencies.
Participates in the planning, creation, testing, deployment, and evaluation of the SDLC for client's systems.
Evaluates and provides feedback on system requirements created by other vendors, programs, or agencies.
Participates in or assists with user acceptance testing.
Develops, documents, and reports recommendations for solving and/or addressing problems, questions and issues based on research conducted.
Clearly communicates management's views on major policies or current issues to individuals and entities both
within and outside the organization.
Work with internal functional teams and business stakeholders to extract use cases in their existing implementations.
Solve day-to-day issues arising during automation projects with timely resolutions.
Review and help refine automation business cases to optimize, improve and automate business processes to deliver the desired business outcome
Experience in using Visio & documentation tools to prepare Process mapping (Current & Future State), Workflow diagram, Low level process document.
Excellent logical and analytical skills to help define solutions for business problems.
Uses sound judgment to respond appropriately to internal and external contacts.
Independently establishes and monitors deadlines to ensure timeliness of staff's responses to inquiries, complaints, and other issues.
Serves as a member of the dept Program Administration section and supports the work of other team members as needed.
Coordinates with vendors and technical staff to ensure that functionality of automated systems is consistent with, and in adherence to, program policies, laws, regulations, and best practice standards by users.
Develops and administers training, training documents, and user guidance for system changes or workarounds.
Develops and documents business processes for users of new or upgraded system.
Assists with development of change management plans for transition to new or upgraded systems.
Provides business user support and oversight statewide in the use of all data systems for the program.
Serves as liaison between business users and technical staff in the implementation and development of business process automation.

Agency Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with data systems and acting as a liaison between business users and technical staff.
Experience automating and documenting business processes.
Experience working on multiple complex projects simultaneously.
Experience organizing and analyzing data to inform decision making.
Experience managing business functions and processes.
Knowledge of or experience with Georgia Gateway Integrated Eligibility System.
Knowledge of system development and configuration.
Advanced skills in Excel and other Microsoft Office applications.
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP), Certification of Capability in Business Analysis (CCBA),

Manage contracts, financial origination, and analysis for Green Power EMC. In addition to ensuring that Green Power EMC invoices and monthly expenses/revenues are properly processed and recorded, the position will ensure that accurate and timely financial reports are generated with appropriate analysis completed each month. This position will direct the analysis of monthly billing data, and ensure that appropriate assumptions are documented and that member bills are accurately generated. Will work with the Billing department, the Controller, and other supporting organizations to ensure the integrity of monthly member bills, invoice payments, and other financial analyses. The position will provide budget guidance and direction to GPEMC staff during the development of the Long-Range Financial Forecast and the Annual Budget Process. In addition, the Senior Business Analyst will provide routine reports and directions to GPEMC staff regarding the status of the year-to-date budget vs. actual and the action needed to ensure appropriate budget management.

Manage the environmental attributes programs for Green Power EMC, including the multimillion-dollar REC sales and registration. The program requires engagement with Members' key leadership staff and review and recommend sales strategies to the Members. The Senior Business Analyst will manage REC accounting and billing efforts including Members' quarterly reports and market intelligence.

Manage the contract administration for $100 million (and growing) power purchase agreements to ensure that each individual power purchase agreement meets contract requirements. This position will prepare routine reports on the contractual performance of the agreements, review, analyze, and recommend actions that may be necessary to ensure compliance with contracts.

Develop and maintain tools and processes to help accomplish department goals. Work with other Green Power EMC staff members to support the completion of ad hoc assignments and special projects. Work and communicate effectively with other Family of Company departments to both support their analysis efforts and solicit information necessary to complete ad hoc analysis projects as directed by Green Power EMC senior management team.

Job Duties:

Ensure that monthly invoices, data documentation, and Members' billing calculations are accurate and timely. Ensure the creation of monthly reports on the expenses/revenue and providing other assistance and support to GPEMC Vice President of Administration as required. Coordinate and lead the support of OPC Controller staff, OPC Billing and GSOC Account Payable departments to ensure that overall data documentation supports the actual performance of relevant GPEMC and OPC activities.
Ensure routine reports on Members' Green-e and REC activities. Perform REC market analytics, propose and communicate market options for advantageous market opportunities to Member EMCs. Direct market transactions as agreed to by Member EMCs and ensure that REC transactions are properly reported to appropriate agencies, Member EMCs and GPEMC senior management.
Manage the contract management of over 30 PPA contracts (and growing) including 1) project energy and financial performance, 2) PPA financial and energy performance metrics, and 3) identify and direct the development of new financial instruments (origination) for financing new projects with debt, equity, government grant and tax equity opportunities for existing and new projects.
Providing support, as needed, in any other GPEMC activities and new projects
Assisting, with various tasks related to GPEMC educational program

Required Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree in Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Engineering, Business Administration or similar discipline. Master's degree in any of the above disciplines in preferred

Experience: 7+ of progressive experience in finance, budgeting, data analysis, corporate business planning, production and financial forecasting. Utility experience is preferred.

Equivalent Experience: Ten (10) years of progressively responsible experience with applicable industry.

Specialized Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills, high PC proficiency, ability to interpret and analyze accounting and financial statements, strong ability in using word processing and spreadsheet; proactive, results-oriented style; details oriented, good interpersonal skills, strong ability to interface with a diversity of technical and business disciplines.

Licenses, Registrations, and/or Certifications: Valid driver's license which meets the insurance requirements under Oglethorpe Power's Drivers Qualification Program.

Travel: 5%; Incumbent will be expected to occasionally travel to plant locations or other meetings to assist their supervisor with meetings and other business activities.

Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments – creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them. Why Conduent:
You’ll have an opportunity to work on innovative technology while being surrounded by a culture that recognizes each person’s contributions. You have an opportunity to personally and professionally thrive, make a difference, and be part of a culture where individuality and participation is valued.

We need someone who:
Can work closely with the development team to elucidate the requirements, enable constructive discussions / brainstorming sessions to implement the best-in-class solution.

Have excellent written and spoken communication skills. Should be able to multitask between internal team and clients based on priority tasks.
Can work closely with Dev, architecture, and Design teams to define the GUI view and platform requirements, which is the foundation of the product.

Bachelor’s degree or higher or equivalent work experience
Must have very good understanding of the healthcare payer space with a minimum experience of 1 years in the domain.

Must have prior experience or understanding in configuring benefits or programs in claims system across various sub-systems.
Must be able to work with the clients to create/gather requirements and document them according to standards.
Must adhere to (or if needed, define) the processes for requirement solicitation, documentation, and hand off.

Capability to think out-of-the-box to create new solutions as needed.
Prior experience as a QA or Developer in a healthcare system would be helpful though not mandatory.

MS Visio to define the different views like System, technical, functional, and role-based view.

DB client to write data queries to validate data updated in the database table.

Job Description

The Business Analyst is ultimately responsible for the facilitation and elicitation of requirements and documentation of those requirements for a specific project initiative. The Business Analyst creates/defines the business and functional requirements. The Business Analyst reviews test plans and verifies system functionality delivered for the project.

Responsibilities:

Lead the capture, review, and update business requirements
Produce deliverables based on IT Lead and SME guidance
Capture business capability matrix, detailed requirements, user stories, business rules, etc.
Create communication and training materials, as needed
Enforce Business Analysis standards, templates, and processes
Support the delivery of the Business Architecture by partnering with stakeholders and functional lead(s) to identify business process issues and capability needs
Liaise between technical and non-technical resource team members to answer day to day business questions either directly or indirectly as supported by the Business Leads and SMEs
Conduct walkthroughs with project team members and business leads
Understand and manage to defined project scope
Work with QA and Business SMEs (UAT) to ensure requirements traceability and coverage within test cases
Promote change management principles with executives, senior leaders, managers, and supervisors to influence, build relationships, and manage resistance
Provide support during end user training, prior to production deployments, and post production deployment, as needed

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business or Computer Science preferred
5+ years of Business Analysis experience preferred
3+ years of Commercial / Specialty Insurance industry experience preferred
3+ years of Duck Creek Policy (or similar PAS systems) experience preferred
Experience with Microsoft platforms including Microsoft Dynamics and SharePoint preferred
1+ years of Structured Query Language (SQL) experience preferred
Proficiency with software/systems commonly used to manage Programs/Projects (MS Word, Excel, MS Project, PowerPoint, Visio, TFS, Azure DevOps, JIRA)
Experience with Reinsurance is a plus
Experience developing Business Requirements Documents (BRDs), process diagrams, storyboards, use cases, and presentations
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently in person and remotely
Dedicated and detail oriented
Collaborative and conscientious team player
Excellent Analytical skills
For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of 90k - 105k (GA). The specific salary offer will be based on an assessment of a variety of factors including the experience of the successful candidate and their work location. In addition, all employees are eligible for competitive incentive targets, with awards based on overall corporate and individual performance. On top of this, we offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes medical plans for employees and their families, health and wellness programs, retirement plans, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, and much more.

The Georgia Dept. of Transportation (GDOT) seeks a Business Analyst (BA) who will primarily assigned to compiling and documenting scopes of work to facilitate new IT procurements/contracts. The scopes of work define the applicable boundaries, requirements, activities/tasks, deliverables/milestones, terms and conditions, etc. for purchasing goods/services. The BA will incorporate or gather requirements and related exhibits/appendices. BA will collaborate with business, IT, IT Security, Legal, and Procurement/Legal stakeholders. BA will obtain and assess vendor provided agreements and related materials. BA will prepare any additional documents as needed to facilitate procurements. BA will facilitate reconciling any conflicting items between parties. BA will assist in gathering and documenting selection criteria for proposal evaluations. Consultant shall represent GDOT interests and comply with Ethics/Code of Conduct rules of the State of Georgia. Consultant will be preparing materials to support procurements but will not be participating in the actual GDOT evaluation, selection, or contracting processes.

As time permits, BA may be assigned to GDOT IT Project teams to gather and translate business needs into in-house custom developed product/solution requirements. The BA will work hand-in-hand with business, project, and management teams. BA will solicit, understand, and analyze business needs, data, objectives, and processes. BA will translate user need into materials for successful IT initiation, design, and development. BA will conduct user interviews and joint-application-development (JAD) sessions. BA will identify business “pain points” and rank user stories/use cases potential to improve business effectiveness/performance. BA will clarify and document IT project scope, current/future state, business/application workflows, functional/system requirements, system interaction diagrams, reporting and training requirements, data mapping, logical data models, metadata, screen mock-ups, and test cases. BA will actively participate in the software development life cycle (SLDC) and transfer information to IT Project teams. BA will be responsible for demonstrating requirement traceability within work products. BA will validate requirements were met within developed products and facilitate completion of user acceptance testing. BA will assist project manager in getting dates from business units to complete reviews.

Responsibilities:

Participates in the demand management process to assist the business in establishing business cases, scope, and requirements relating to requests for new systems or existing system changes
Primarily support IT acquisition of products or services by developing scopes of work
Consults with project teams and architects to identify currently know solutions or performs market research
Gathers information/documentation from vendors or contractors
Translates business needs into requirements and functional/non-functional specifications
Gather, clarify/define, and document scope, business scenarios, workflows, requirements, etc.
Conduct interviews, workshops, and JAD sessions
Analyzes and validates business requirements and processes, identifies opportunities for process enhancement to benefit the Department, identifies gaps in information
Uses a structured process to define priorities and opportunities and/or works with stakeholders to define the minimum viable product (MVP) and options for improvements via subsequent phases
Produces required work artifacts
Communicates and presents client’s business requirements to implementation teams
Creates systems models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and system architects
Works with the team to define acceptance criteria or other metrics/performance goals for the system
Provides status updates, completes weekly work time logs, updates work tickets weekly
Provide estimates and target dates for task completion for incorporation into project schedules or work tickets

Work Terms and Conditions: 8AM - 5PM 40 hrs. per week

GDOT has NOT specified a number of days onsite vs remote. However, local candidates (i.e. able to come in office) will be preferred over an out of state candidates (i.e. remote worker). GDOT prefers candidates who can demonstrate they have the capability to work a hybrid work schedule which is a combination of remote and in-office work. Candidate capacity (i.e. days they could come into the office) to work a hybrid work schedule will be discussed during interviews.
The consultant will follow all applicable State of Georgia and GDOT policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and accepted best practices.
The position end date is set for the end of the GDOT Fiscal Year. GDOT may exercise the option to renew contracts in one-year increments. Several successful consultants have continued working for several years with contract extensions. However, GDOT is under no obligation to extend contracts and may terminate employment at any time.
When teleworking or working remotely, consultant must have suitable internet connection and environment to comply with GDOT telework policies.
GDOT will reimburse authorized travel expense lodging and meals. GDOT will reimburse authorized travel use of a personal vehicle. Any travel expenses to start work or relocate to Georgia or will not be reimbursed.
All travel expense reimbursement shall be in accordance with State Accounting Office Travel Policy: https://sao.georgia.gov/state-travel-policy
The Department has 13 holidays, which consultants are not allowed to work nor make up any time for those holiday weeks without management's approval. Consultants are not to take extended leave during their first year of service (e.g. greater than 1 week).
Consultant must have cell phone which can be used for business calls.
GDOT does not provide free parking. All routine commuting expenses are the responsibility of the consultant.

Skill Matrix

BS/BA in a relevant discipline (Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, etc.) Required 4 Years
IT busines analysis work experience in software development, project management, or technology implementations/support Required 5 Years
Experience with Microsoft Office Professional, including Visio Required 5 Years
Experience with data and business process analysis Required 3 Years
Experience in developing statements/scope of work for contracting and procurement Required 3 Years
Work experience in reviewing software license, service, or support level agreements Required
Experience with procurements or solicitations, developing scopes of work or statements of work. Required 3 Years
Strong analytical/technical skills, able to provide impact/risk assessments Required
Excellent communication, teamwork, and collaboration skills Required
Strong problem solving and organizational skills Required
Detail oriented, analytical mindset Required
Able to manage multiple projects/tasks at once; Results oriented and highly organized; Able to work in a fast-paced environment Required

CAMP Systems is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry. CAMP is the pre-eminent brand in its industry and is the exclusive recommended service provider for nearly all business aircraft manufacturers in the world. Our services are delivered through a “SaaS plus” model and we support over 20,000 aircraft on our maintenance tracking platform and over 31,000 engines on our engine health monitoring platform. Additionally, CAMP provides shop floor management ERP systems to over 1,300 aircraft maintenance facilities and parts suppliers around the world. CAMP has grown from a single location company in 2001, to over 1,300 employees in 13 locations around the world.




CAMP’s relationships with business aircraft manufacturers, aircraft maintenance facilities, and parts suppliers place it in a unique position to understand how current offline information flows in the business aviation industry to introduce friction to the global market for business aviation parts and services. CAMP is building a digital business that will streamline the exchange of parts and services and create substantial value for both CAMP and the aviation industry at large.

FlightBridge, a subsidiary of CAMP Systems International, is the only online booking and management platform for the private and business aviation industry, connecting aircraft operators, Fixed Base Operators (FBOs) and vendors. FlightBridge makes it easy to book and manage concierge services such as hotels, rental cars, commercial airline tickets, catering and more, and communicate with Fixed Base Operators (FBOs) and other stakeholders.

FlightBridge fosters an open, supportive, and collaborative work culture to empower every team member to share their ideas and see them to fruition. We appreciate that each new hire brings their unique experience, adding to our culture.




CAMP is an exciting company to work for, not only because of its future growth prospects, but also because of its culture. Smart, motivated people, who want to take initiative, are given the opportunity and freedom to make things happen. CAMP is part of the Hearst Business Media portfolio.




Job Summary




We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Business Analyst to play a crucial role in supporting and enhancing the software systems utilized by our Customers in the Business Aviation sector. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders, including the Leadership team, Product Management, Account Managers, Support team members and Technology team members to elicit requirements, analyze business needs and fully manage the backlog decomposition process to prepare the development of custom solutions that align with the organization's goals and objectives.


Responsibilities




Backlog Management

Requirements Elicitation: Collaborate with key stakeholders to elicit and document detailed business and technical requirements.
Backlog Decomposition: Work closely with Stakeholders and Tech Leads to decompose Features into Stories with clear Acceptance Criteria in preparation for leading Three Amigo conversations.
Documentation: Prepare documentation, including user stories, use cases, process flow diagrams functional specifications and system requirements, to effectively communicate solutions to stakeholders and development teams.
Software Utilization: Work with the Development Team and stakeholders to deliver custom solutions using Microsoft Azure DevOps and Slack.



Process Support and Development

Business Analysis: Analyze current business processes and systems to identify opportunities for improvement and efficiency gains.
Metrics Support: Ensure existing and proposed processes to support generation of data for key metrics.
Testing and Quality Assurance: Work with the software development team to define test plans, test cases, and perform testing to ensure the quality and reliability of delivered software solutions. Assist in tracking and resolving issues identified during testing.
Process Documentation and Support: Create process/help documentation and Release Notes, as necessary, to assist internal and external customers with adopting new processes and/or learning functionality.



Project Management

Project Coordination: Participate in planning, tracking, and reporting on Strategic initiatives. Collaborate closely with Product Management and other team members to drive successful delivery for major efforts.
Scrum Master: Assist with Scrum Master duties including management of team blockers, and conducting standups, as needed.



The above statements are only intended to generally describe the nature of the job and should not be construed as an exhaustive list of position responsibilities.




Requirements




Essential Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
3-7 years of proven experience as an IT Business Analyst or a similar role.
In-depth understanding of Lean Agile, Kanban and/or Scrum methodologies, and best practices.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.



Preferred Requirements

Experience in the Travel industry and/or Business aviation sector is highly desirable.
Familiarity with following tools/applications helpful: Microsoft Azure DevOps, Slack, PowerBI, Helpjuice, Hubspot.

The VCG Data & Analytics Hub - Reporting COE team is looking to hire a Business Data Analyst to deliver value to the Telecommunication organization through business intelligence reporting and deep analytics by driving insights to actions. The team manages the analysis and insights for new and existing Telecommunication customers across all Omni channels including online (desktop & mobile), chat, and call centers. This full-time role will be responsible for developing and building reporting solutions, guiding data-driven decisions and recommending Next Best Actions, analyzing Customer journey touchpoints, driving personalization of behavioral insights, cross-channel analytics, segmentation, assessment of overall impact for use cases and help define, refine, and measure business outcomes to transform customer experience.
The Business Data Analyst will focus on developing, automating and deriving insights from Analytics and Reporting Tools such as Tableau/Qlik/ThoughtSpot/Adobe dashboards, storytelling new customer insights with UI/UX visualizations and maintaining or enhancing existing reports. This will also be an opportunity to build and track campaigns, data-driven use cases, opt-in rates, conversion rates, channel engagement KPIs, empowering stakeholders to optimize channel experiences, championing efforts to optimize revenue, conversion, improve customer satisfaction and expense reduction of a Fortune Fifteen company.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate and partner with Digital and Omni channel stakeholders to identify analytics and reporting requirements and baseline metrics prior to executing new use cases
Develop Digital KPIs and reporting dashboards in ThoughtSpot/Tableau/Qlik/Looker to measure, analyze and report trends on App and Web Engagement, App Adoption, Digital Channel Hops and E2E CX journey metrics with path analysis, cohort segmentation, SQL automation.

Stitch together data from multiple channels to formulate a complete customer journey 360 view.
Create and deploy actionable dashboards for business owners to gauge performance and assist with omni channel optimization decisions such as CX KPIs, NPS, Revenue, Churn, Call-in Rate
Develop VCG Reporting visualizations to highlight insights on opportunities to reduce journey fallout, channel hops, post digital assisted contact rate and optimizing human interactions
Stakeholder scorecards and dashboards with executive leadership to gain alignment and promote usage and maintain consistent KPI definitions in Collibra for Data Governance
Perform A/B Testing, measure success metrics of new releases over existing flows, run simulations for Omni insight personalization, holistically analyze end-to-end journey paths
Correlate, interpret and summarize scorecard reports for Omni, Assisted and Cross-Channel metrics and quantify business outcomes for data-driven campaigns and business performance.

Experience conducting research or analysis and managing projects for multiple stakeholders.
A/B Testing experience and KPI measurements for deriving insights from customer behavior and data patterns from Omni channels

Job Summary
Gather, analyze, and document business requirements for internal customers. Ensure technology solutions align with business needs and strategic goals. Research, design, document, test and leverage business solutions. Assist in defining and planning departmental project roadmaps. Partner with clients and manage prioritization and delivery of IT services for an application module or subject area.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities
Interfaces with Business Stakeholders and IT infrastructure teams to define, gather, and document business processes and needs, and translate into detailed functional specifications for development. Performs business systems and process analysis of existing and future systems/processes. Conducts interviews and requirements gathering workshops. Ensures sign-off of all artifacts.
Coordinates requirements for new and existing applications. Assists in testing, training plan development and training, support for users, and developing user documentation (i.e. web manuals, reference guides, etc.). Participates in QA process; identifies test cases; explains complex processes; aids in developing test plans.
Analyzes current state and emerging technology/application functionality and business needs proactively to add value.
Develops detailed business case, ROI calculations, value definition, cost assessments (expense/capital), benefits, and risk analysis
Works with the project team to manage project scope and timeline, from conception to implementation. Manages project tasks and project life cycle phases (i.e. defining requirements, documentation, process flows and specifications, etc.) to meet customer goals and requirements. May act as a Project Manager on approved projects, defining scope, project schedules, and implementing solutions per IT tollgate processes.
Coordinates relationship and communication with the client and prioritizes the delivery of IT services.
Conducts root cause analysis using knowledge of applications, interfaces, and technology for defect resolution in a module or subject area.

Nature and Scope
Identifies key barriers/core problems and applies problem solving skills in order to deal creatively with complex situations. Troubleshoots and resolves complex problems. Makes decisions under conditions of uncertainty, sometimes with incomplete information, that produce effective end results.
Independently performs assignments with instruction limited to the expected results. Determines and develops an approach to solutions. Receives technical guidance only on unusual or complex problems or issues.
May oversee the completion of projects and assignments, including planning, assigning, monitoring and reviewing progress and accuracy of work, evaluating results, etc. Contributes to employees' professional development but does not have hiring or firing authority.

Work Environment
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.
Typically requires overnight travel 5% to 20% of the time.

Education and Experience
Typically requires BS/BA in a related discipline. Generally 5-8 years of experience in a related field OR MS/MA and generally 3-5 years of experience in a related field. Certification is required in some areas.

Job Description:

Job Summary
This position ties technology to our business needs and determines how new solutions, carrier business rules, and industry changes will affect our customers. He/She performs analysis to ensure we maximize the positive impact across the business, documents what needs to be built and certifies the resulting product with our carrier business partners. This position enables the organization to achieve its goals and brings value to our teams and customers.

Responsibilities:

Agile Methodology: Proficient in Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.), with a strong understanding of Agile principles and practices.
Domain Knowledge: In-depth industry knowledge relevant to the organization, enabling effective analysis of business needs and requirements.
Requirements Elicitation: Proven ability to gather and document user stories, functional and non-functional requirements, and translate them into clear and concise documentation.
Stakeholder Engagement: Demonstrated expertise in collaborating with diverse stakeholders, including product owners, developers, designers, and business units, to ensure successful project outcomes.
Process Improvement: Track record of identifying process bottlenecks and suggesting process improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Data Analysis: Strong analytical skills, capable of analyzing complex data sets to derive valuable insights and support data-driven decision-making.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to facilitate meetings, present findings, and convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Documentation: Proficiency in creating detailed documentation such as user stories, business process flows, and acceptance criteria.
Tool Proficiency: Familiarity with Agile project management tools and proficiency in using tools for requirements management and collaboration.
Problem-Solving: Adept at identifying and solving business problems through innovative solutions and strategic thinking.
Adaptability: Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, adapting to changing priorities and business needs.
Technical Understanding: Basic understanding of technical concepts and software development processes to effectively communicate and bridge the gap between business and development teams.

Qualifications:

Highly experienced in Requirements elicitation and documentation analysis
Hands-on experience with Software Development tools and ability to perform some scripting tasks
Knowledge of Microsoft Office and other documentation tools
Bachelor's Degree (or internationally comparable degree) in Computer Science or related field - Preferred
Experience with Carrier business rules and industry standards - Preferred

Employee Type:

Permanent

Description

Excellence. Trust. Mutual Respect.

These values of Builders culture create success in all we do. We strive to provide deeply supportive partnerships to our customers, agents, and each other.

Summary of the role:

We are looking to fill the position of Business Analyst (BA) to support business and technology projects at Builders Insurance Group. The BA will serve as the liaison between the business, information technology, and end users to ensure that all requirements are documented and communicated so that the right solutions are delivered. Ours candidate will need to be able demonstrate strong communication skills and be able to succinctly capture the requirements (business/technical) to develop, maintain and enhance solutions. The candidate must also be able to analyze data to enable leaders to make informed business decisions

What would be your day in the life at Builders?

Conducting detailed analysis of business & system processes and document impacts due to changes in processes and data
Documenting detailed requirements and designs (business & technical) so that teams can build solutions to the requested specifications
Interacting with subject matter experts and stakeholders to identify their issues and requirements
Using problem solving techniques to support the design of technical solutions and solve business issues
Leveraging business analysis techniques and tools to provide insights into improved business decisions (i.e.; data management, predictive modeling, data mining, forecasting simulation and optimization)

What skills will you need?

Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in business, IT or computer science
3 to 5 years’ experience in analytics and systems development
Proficiency in using Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio
Working knowledge of SQL and other languages to evaluate data sets
Experience generating process documentation and reports
Technical writing experience
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
Excellent problem-solving skills
Working experience collaborating and negotiating with team members, subject matter experts and stakeholders

The Technical Product Owner (TPO) is responsible for working with the various internal and external business partners to help provide solution design to complex business needs. The Technical Product Owner represents the business needs at the agile team level to ensure the team is delivering the functionality that meets business and client needs. He/she must have past experience working with agile technology teams and have business skills and experience.

The primary role is to support the gathering and documenting of requirements based upon the needs of the business and conduct/lead requirement meetings and facilitate user acceptance testing. Additionally, the role will be present these requirements as user stories to IT agile team members in scrum ceremonies such as grooming, planning, daily standups, demos, and retrospectives. The TPO is responsible for providing expert system support for complex system development/ enhancements/ problems/ issues impacting other areas (interfaces/sub-systems). This lead position provides business /technical expertise and team leadership on major, complex initiatives. The position may be responsible for giving work direction, mentoring, and providing input to junior Business Systems Analysts.

What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?

Works closely with Business stakeholders and external customers, vendors, and other areas in Assurant to understand business objectives and product requirements. Interpret high-level business, compliance, and financial needs/requests for complex projects, with little or no background information or foundation.

A self-starter that has the ability to lead solution definition and refine requirements for several concurrent initiatives around the globe.

Be the “go to” person for knowledge of the department’s applications and data. Work closely with the Agile Team on complex system changes.

Writes functional and technical user stories that clearly communicate customer/stakeholder needs to the Agile team, accepts stories once complete and demo’d. Backlog planning, prioritization, and management.

Understands and supports inter-team dependencies, and ability to identify priority issues and determine which issues can be managed within the authority of a TPO and being able to discern those issues requiring engineering support or to be directed from a higher authority.

Analyze complex processes, interfaces, and sub-system problems for modification. Participate in new process definition efforts, as requested. Document existing and new business processes and workflows with a high level of complexity. Data Mapping of complex tables, files and records resulting from the corporate initiatives that involve system integrations, business acquisitions, and assumptions.

Identify and resolve complex, non-routine problems and issues where no precedent has been established or exists. Identify trends/patterns; facilitate and/or conduct root cause analysis; recommend solution alternatives. Identify and implement process improvements.

Validate UI meets business needs and support spot validation of integrations using tools like Postman and/or SoapUI. Work closely with the Testing resources to determine testing requirements involving cross-functional areas and sub-systems. Assist as needed in designing and drafting test plans as well as participate in testing for complex, large-scale projects.

Demonstrate detailed knowledge of Agile principles and scrum methodologies established and approved by our Company. Manage multiple projects, concurrently.

Communicate release date and scope for the initiatives the TPO is leading.

Attends and actively participates in team events (e.g., daily stand-up, grooming, sprint planning, sprint review).

What are the requirements needed for this position?

5+ years of progressive experience gathering and writing user stories for Web based, Mobile Applications, Web Services based functionality and as well as File Interfaces.

2+ years of experience using two or more of the following: Postman, SoapUI, SQL Server, Swagger UI.

3+ years of experience working with Process flows (Visio) and solution diagrams using Microsoft Visio or similar tools.

Experience with agile development; agile certification a plus.

Ability to lead, prioritize and work independently or as part of a project team to complete multiple tasks, concurrently.

Ability to process complex time sensitive data and information from multiple sources, make decisions and communicate actions.

Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively meet and drive the requirements gathering with our internal/external customers and translate into effective user stories for the agile team.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.

Ability to develop productive working relationships with both technical and non-technical partners.

Ability to prioritize and work independently or as part of a project team to complete multiple tasks, concurrently.

What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?

Excellent organizational and planning skills.

Desired knowledge of: Azure Application Insights, Azure Storage Explorer and familiarity with JSON, XML, YAML, HTML, okta authentication, ASP.NET.

Previous Insurance, Wireless (Cell Phone Industry), OEMs, experience.

Previous Telecom/Mobile experience.

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related field.

Experient Group is an Atlanta-based business + IT consultancy that offers flexible and innovative solutions tailored to our clients' business environment, culture and budget. We don't assume anything - we set out to continually prove ourselves by going above and beyond in every client engagement. We work collaboratively to understand our clients' business and provide guidance that enables them to achieve results.

We are seeking a Senior Consultant to join our experienced Management Consulting team where you can fully utilize your skills and expertise in project management and business/data analysis to drive effective solutions for the clients’ needs. You will learn and fully understand our clients business, evaluate the issues and develop solutions to become the clients’ key advisor.

What You’ll Do

Lead a team to drive requirements gathering sessions and prepare and deliver client presentations and work products/prototypes
Use knowledge of business analysis and process as well as effective project management skills to plan and lead work streams with small teams
Actively run overall business analysis efforts according to the overall project plan
Demonstrate a logical, rigorous, and analytical problem-solving approach
Translate business requirements into solution design
Lead business process current state discovery sessions and effectively gather current state workflows
Facilitate the development of future state workflows while identifying process, interpersonal and technical gaps that need to be filled
Lead development of detailed plan to fill current state/future state gaps
Define and execute workflow based end-user test scenarios
Assist with test data management and execution oversight
Lead direct or indirect team members for specific projects or objectives
Lead client status and executive review meetings as needed
Drive additional opportunities at client

What You’ll Bring

Strong project management skills and experience
3+ years of management consulting, professional services, and/or Big 4 consulting experience.
Ability to analyze complex issues and distill concepts to clients
Fully understand client business and become the key trusted adviser
Experience in delicately identifying risks and collaborating with the client to drive action to mitigate and resolve issues
Strong analytical and interpersonal communication skills, while working independently
Organizational skills and the ability to handle a vast array of information
An understanding of the role of data management, information flow, and data governance issues
Experience with vendor integration and management
Experience in serving as a liaison between both business and technical teams to drive effective, timely solutions that fulfill both strategic and operational needs
Proficient in defining and documenting business processes and requirements
A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university. A master’s degree and/or applicable professional certifications are bonuses.

Location: Atlanta, GA based position. No relocation budget available.


Work With Us

At Experient Group, we value community, collaboration and people who are willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. While functional and technical skills are critical, we place a priority on hiring people who match our values. Our philosophy is simple: we attract and hire talented people, then provide them with a supportive community, career opportunities and guidance from our experienced leadership so they can thrive. Job Summary(A brief description of the primary duty of this job):





Develop and support business applications supporting Dynamics AX. Define and analyze business requirements for applications. Responsible for creating programs and related procedures to process data and resolve problems. Exhibit strong communication, diagnostic and analytical skills.




Essential Job Functions(Primary duties and responsibilities):



Responsible for the ongoing operation, support, maintenance, and upgrade of Dynamics AX and other corporate business applications
Troubleshoot and resolve escalated helpdesk support requests in a timely manner.
Work with departments and IT management to define requirements for applications supporting Dynamics AX through written functional and technical specifications for applications.
Implement, design, develop, and test new software applications, extensions to packages and web- based functions and services, provide on-going support for these applications.
Develop and support interfaces between business systems internal to Dynamics AX and external partners.
Design, configure, and implement new software packages, and provide on-going support for these packages.
Establish and implement development and support standards and guidelines.

The preceding description is a summary of essential job functions and is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities required of the Title.

Decision Making(Level of decision making and extent to which this job can structure objectives/activities and affect outcomes):




Completes a variety of atypical assignments. Works within defined processes and procedures or methodologies and may help determine the appropriate approach for new assignment. Works with a limited degree of supervision. Acts as an informal resource for colleagues with less experience. Analyzes complex technical problems and delivers solutions where precedent may not exist.

Required Education and Experience:



Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience is required.
A minimum of 5 years' experience in the development and/or support of software systems required, including multi-tiered client/server applications and web-based applications.
A minimum of 5 years' experience designing and using relational databases, including Microsoft SQL server
Experience with Microsoft Development tools, including Visual Studio .Net and .Net framework
Experience developing windows and web-based applications
Background in a manufacturing and distribution environments
Experience with Dynamics AX 2012 R3

Physical Demands:



Work involves medium physical exertion that could involve carrying or moving materials and equipment weighing up to 51 lbs.
Intermittent manual labor that includes bending, stooping, crouching,reaching, pushing, and pulling.
Squat and kneel to access materials and equipment in tight or enclosed spaces. Occasionally crawl to access equipment.
View a computer monitor and type for extended periods of time.
Talk on phone or use headset for extended periods of time.
Sit for extended periods of time.
Stand and walk intermittently.
Manual dexterity of hands and fingers.
Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer monitor; and/or extensive reading.
Communicate with others to exchange information.
When travel is required, visual acuity to operate motor vehicle in daytime and nighttime.



Work Environment:



Typically works in an office environment where there is no substantial exposure to adverse environmental conditions.
Worker occasionally accomplishes tasks in manufacturing, warehouse, and/or supporting areas where there is exposure to vibrations and moderate-to-loud noises. When in these areas, worker must be aware of and exercise caution around hazardous conditions such as electricity, moving equipment, moving parts, refrigerants, chemicals, torches, solvents, dust, dirt, fumes, and contaminants.
Use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) required of job when worker is in the manufacturing, warehouse, and/or supporting areas. PPE includes but is not limited to safety glasses, hearing protection, and safety toed footwear.

Overview:
Origami Risk is recruiting for recent college graduates to join our next New Professional Program cohort. This six-month program will introduce colleagues to all things Origami Risk, gain a deep understanding of our products/platform, enhance and learn new technical skills, and how we work with and support our clients. The next cohort will start on February 5, 2024 and will be based out of our Chicago or Atlanta Offices.


The Business Systems Analyst I is an entry-level position responsible for contributing to successful project implementations and providing ongoing client support. The Business System Analyst is exposed to client relationship management and technical responsibilities.

Starting base pay for this role is between $65,000 and $67,500. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as transferable skills, work experience, business needs, training, location, and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role will be eligible for a bonus as well as competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, wellness reimbursement, life insurance, and a 401(k) with company match. We offer vacation and sick leave benefits (under a flexible time off policy in most states).

Origami Risk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We thrive and benefit from diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees. We do not discriminate against any individual based upon race, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, color, sex, national origin, age, marital status, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
Responsibilities:
Provides client-facing support with coaching and guidance from senior colleagues.
Researches, addresses, and responds to ongoing service log requests.
Configures the Origami platform to meet client requirements.
Deploys and configures Origami standard data conversions and builds custom Excel data conversions using tools in Origami Admin UI.
Performs unit testing of assigned deliverables.
Leverages Origami standard configuration where possible and follows established best practices and industry standards when designing, configuring, and consulting on solutions.
Records hours worked in accordance with Origami's time entry policy.
Identifies potential scope creep / out-of-scope work and escalates to Project Manager.
Assists with the preparation of training materials for user training.
Identifies potential expanded sales opportunities and notifies / coordinates with the account management team on pursuing.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business analytics, information systems, or a similar technical degree.
6+ months of internship, technical education, or work experience in software configuration/implementation, business analytics, database management, or other related technical disciplines.
Superior communication skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Must possess some knowledge of SQL.
Experience or willingness to learn and embrace XML, JavaScript, and HTML.

Who We Are
Origami Risk is a leading provider of integrated SaaS solutions for risk management, insurance, safety, and compliance. We've designed our single-platform, cloud-based software to be easily configurable to meet the needs of insured corporate and public entities, brokers and risk consultants, insurers and MGAs, third party claims administrators (TPAs), risk pools, and more. To fulfill our singular focus of helping our clients achieve their business objectives, our software is supported by a best-in-class service team of experienced risk, insurance, and safety professionals who have an ideal balance of industry knowledge and technological expertise.

Since its founding in 2009, Origami Risk has received more than two dozen awards for service excellence, technology innovation, and workplace culture. In addition to inclusion in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™, a ranking of the 500 fastest-growing tech companies in North America, Origami Risk also has been repeatedly recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work” and Best and Brightest® Companies To Work For in the Nation by the National Association for Business Resources (NABR).

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.

Equifax is looking for an experienced Salesforce Business Analyst to join our Sales Enablement Team. This Business Analyst role is responsible for the functional requirements of Salesforce–orchestrating the lead to cash process across the enterprise, defining business needs, business processes and business requirements. The Business Analyst is also responsible for identifying areas of transformation and standardization to enable enterprise processes via Salesforce and enable business value. The Business Analyst must assess inputs and outputs from the lead to cash process to enable seamless transition from marketing and sales, as well as, downstream processing.

The Business Analyst works cross-functionally and with multiple levels of the organization to ensure timely and quality design of end-to-end solutions. A successful candidate will be experienced and motivated, with a strong sense of urgency and solid understanding of the Salesforce platform and capabilities–specifically Configure Price Quote (CPQ). This position follows a hybrid framework and requires in-office presence at our Midtown Atlanta location .

What you’ll do

Collaborate with multiple levels of the sales, marketing, finance and operations organizations to understand current business issues and pain points

Identify opportunities to leverage the Salesforce platform to address pain points and drive business value

Partner with business stakeholders to understand current business processes, identify gaps between current processes and enterprise processes, define solutions to address gaps, document user stories and business requirements and associated business value

Support prioritization of user stories across multiple business processes and stakeholders

Design and implement business solutions to satisfy functional and non-functional requirements while ensuring quality, scalability and timely delivery

Create and maintain project deliverables to ensure business processes, use cases, business requirements, functional designs, test plans, etc are thoroughly and consistently documented using standard templates and centralized repository

Assist in designing the data and solution architecture to support business processes

Collaborate with Process Owner/Architect, Admins and IT partners on complex technical solutions

Document acceptance criteria and testing requirements for positive, negative and regression testing for user stories

Support Functional QA Leader to execute testing activities for use cases, including defect resolution (tracking, triage, resolve, re-test)

Provide content for end user training design, documentation and delivery efforts

Provide end user and production support

Embrace the Equifax single instance strategy for Salesforce.com by supporting governance processes and designing business solutions within the governance model

Maintain an understanding of the Equifax Salesforce.com platform and functional components, including functional data model, integration between components and impacts of process and functional designs with upstream and downstream processes

Establish and maintain positive communication and professional relationships with internal/external customers, team members and vendors/partner

Stay current on Salesforce.com functionality, best practices, releases, product roadmaps and 3rd party applications available via the AppExchange

Maintain Salesforce Admin Certification

Seek additional certifications as necessary

What experience you’ll need

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

Minimum 3 years in an analyst, operations, sales, customer support or related role

Proven experience defining business requirements, writing user stories, creating detailed functional designs and/or process documentation

Salesforce Admin Certification

What could set you apart

Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, Business Management, Industrial Engineering or related field

Masters or advanced degree

Experience in Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) and/or Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM)

Deep understanding of Lead to Cash process flows on an enterprise level







We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, 401k matching, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!

Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Position Summary

ServiceNow Business Analyst

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology, a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.

Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below:

The Team
The HR Transformation team is a core component of our Human Capital practice; the work we do supports the five major issues our clients are facing. We collaborate with our clients to develop leading global HR strategies and support organizations in achieving excellence through implementing solutions that transform how they organize, develop capabilities, deploy leading technology, and deliver a leading employee experience.
Keeping the employee in mind, all our services cater to improving an organization's productivity through their human capital asset. The client issues we work with range from the need for a comprehensive HR strategy, to determining the need for new and enabling technologies, to streamlining HR operations and transforming the way HR is delivered.

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities
As a ServiceNow Business Analyst for our HR Transformation team, you will utilize your knowledge and experience of ServiceNow to support Deloitte’s Human Capital Consulting ServiceNow team. In this role you will be responsible for:

Working closely with the client's business function to design and implement a target state process
General support, administration, and maintenance of ServiceNow platform and associated applications
Assess existing artifacts, documentation, and data to baseline client performance against best practices
Oversee business process assessment, target state design, and road map activities
Conduct design and discovery sessions with clients, gather business requirements, and translate into user stories for development team
ServiceNow configuration, integrations, and business rule creation
Coordinate and provide guidance to the development team
Create test cases and contribute in-unit testing and integrated unit testing
Conduct demos of out-of-the-box capabilities and new functionalities of ServiceNow Platform
Work closely with project team to support ServiceNow implementation
Provide technical oversight and ensure the design is accurately translated into a functional solution
Design and oversee integration of ServiceNow with third party system and automate business processes
Monitor health, usage, and overall compliance of ServiceNow and its applications
Negotiate what is expected to be configured out-of-the box or customized
Enable the adoption of new processes, procedures, and tool

Qualifications Required

2+ years of ServiceNow experience in an enterprise environment
Strong understanding of ServiceNow Platform capabilities
Experience with out-of-the-box client scripts, update set creation, and deployment process
Experience and understanding of Agile methodologies
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, a similar technical discipline, or comparable experience
Must be technically savvy and possess strong experience configuring ServiceNow
Familiar with Service Oriented architecture and web service integration (SOAP, WSDL, REST)
Experience conducting design and discovery sessions with clients, gathering requirements, and translating into user stories for development team
Hands on experience in ServiceNow configurations, flow designers, integrations, and business rule creation
Experience working with ATF
Experience in ServiceNow reporting & dashboards
Travel up to 10% annually
A current government security clearance, or the ability to hold a clearance is required
No Sponsorship: be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred

ServiceNow System Administrator / Developer certification
ITIL V3 Foundation Certification
