We are looking to hire a driven and dedicated business operations analyst to maximize our company’s operating capabilities, oversee our marketing strategies, and guarantee customer satisfaction and retention. This role will lead company-wide initiatives that emphasize efficiency and profitability. Key responsibilities include managing resources, quality control, resource allocation and strategic planning.
Description

Sr. Business Operations Analyst Job Requisition Med Link Delivery (MLD)
Position Title: Sr. Business Operations Analyst
Location: Norcross, GA
FLSA Status: Hourly, Non-Exempt
Working Hours: Part-time role, Flex hours
Working Mode: Hybrid, On-site as well as Remote
Hourly Rate: $21.00 - $24.00 per hour
Med Link Delivery, LLC
ABOUT MED LINK DELIVERY, LLC:
We are a healthcare courier logistics company with a relentless focus on efficiency, reliability and patient care. We are dedicated to delivering pharmaceutical and medical supplies to where and when they are needed the most. Leveraging over 20+ years of experience and expertise in healthcare logistics, MLD provides its partners with the confidence and resources needed to grow their business. MLD is driven to exceed customer expectations by continuously innovating and improving the skills and resources required to be the most dependable and trusted partner for courier deliveries in healthcare.
Mission:
To be a trusted partner who drives better business results for our healthcare customers.
Position Summary:
We are looking to hire a driven and dedicated business operations analyst to maximize our company’s operating capabilities, oversee our marketing strategies, and guarantee customer satisfaction and retention. This role will lead company-wide initiatives that emphasize efficiency and profitability. Key responsibilities include managing resources, quality control, resource allocation and strategic planning

Scope of Role Responsibilities:

Support the Senior Dispatch Coordinator in managing the dispatch activities using the software.

Ensure that delivery orders have proper updates and delays are at a minimum.

Ensure that the courier drivers are following the set company guidelines and procedures.

Standardize and streamline processes.

Quality check on all orders being delivered by the drivers to ensure required information is captured and deliveries are made as per the client requirements and Med Link business processes.

Verify delivered orders for billing on a daily and weekly basis in coordination with the Senior Dispatch Coordinator.

Update orders in the system to reflect the correct pricing for the client.

Manage the Driver onboarding process and data management.

Oversee money handling, accounting, and bank processes.

Process payroll and generate financial reports.

Conduct performance reviews judiciously and motivate staff.

Respond to client queries (Phone and Email) regarding their orders.

Manage marketing initiatives.

Work across departments to align teams, set goals, execute initiatives and improve processes to help the organization run efficiently and effectively.

Performs other duties as assigned.


Requirements:
COVID-19 & FLU vaccination requirements:
The company strives to be a trusted partner who drives better business results for our healthcare customers. Employees and new hires in sales, field-based, and driver/roles that require access to customer accounts, hospitals & facilities as a function of the job will be required, based on customer requirements, to obtain the COVID-19 vaccination and annual flu shots as an essential function of their role.
Education:
Undergraduate (Bachelor’s degree) or relevant work experience in medical courier space
Critical Experience & Skills:

1–2-year professional driving experience.

Excellent knowledge of local and regional roadways.

Strong attention to detail and time management skills.

Ability to work independently and demonstrate a high level of responsibility.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Previous experience in pharmaceutical transportation is a plus.

Outstanding people skills

Physical Demands:

Moderate to heavy physical activity. Repetitive daily lifting of at least 50 pounds.

Standing, lifting, sitting and moving for extended amounts of time.

Infrastructure Requirements:

Laptop or Desktop with at least 24” extended monitor

Broadband internet connectivity of at least 30 Mbps

Smartphone with WhatsApp

Headset or Earphones

Competencies:

Accuracy/Quality – Is attentive to detail and accuracy. Committed to excellence, looks for improvements continuously, monitors quality levels, finds root cause of quality problems and owns/acts on them.

Adaptability/Flexibility – Adapts to change, is open to new ideas, takes on new responsibilities, handles pressure and adjusts to meet changing needs.

Dealing with Ambiguity - Effectively copes with rapid change. Comfortably handles risk and uncertainty and is not easily rattled.

Dependability – Meets commitments, works independently, accepts accountability, sets personal standards, stays focused under pressure and meets attendance/punctuality requirements.

Innovation - Finds creative solutions to problems/needs that lead to positive outcomes, translates creative ideas into tangible action items.

Integrity/Ethics – Deals with others in a straightforward and honest manner, is accountable for actions, maintains confidentiality, supports company values and always does what is right.

Organization – Manages multiple, simultaneous client activities and projects. Organizes resources to accomplish tasks in an efficient and effective way; coordinates multiple people and functions to accomplish a single goal; prioritizes multiple activities, capitalizes on all available resources.

Problem Solving – Interprets data and gives recommendations, solve unique and challenge problems, undertakes task and breaks them down into manageable parts in systematic way and thinks of all possible alternative for a situation.

Sense of Urgency – Makes and executes decisions in swift and timely manner. Pursuing everything with drive and preservice and often goes “above and beyond” to complete the task at hand.

Teamwork - Meets all team deadlines and responsibility, listens to other and values opinions, helps team leader to meet goals, welcomes newcomers and promotes a team atmosphere.




Salary

$21 - $24 per hour

Overview

Come join Intuit’s Controllership Organization (as part of the Finance team) as a Staff Business Analyst - Order Management Pricing Operations Analyst. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion for innovation to join our team and revolutionize the way the world does business. Intuit’s Finance team drives business growth and profitability through strategic, financial and operational leadership.

This role is a Staff Business Analyst within the CAO organization. The position is located in Tucson, AZ, San Diego, CA, Atlanta, GA or Mountain View, CA

Intuit continues to grow in size and complexity as we launch new offerings, acquire new companies, and grow our platform-based ecosystem. This individual is primarily responsible for ensuring appropriate documentation and maintenance of E2E pricing processes and controls. They will be accountable for developing a strategy to serve as the Company’s approach for a first-line of defense in service to pricing quality assurance from configuration to customer delivery, as measured by no pricing errors. This person will work closely with business and functional partners throughout Intuit to drive the strategies to attain those goals.

This is a highly visible and exciting role in the Finance controllership group ensuring successful end-to-end processing of customer transactions across all core product lines globally in service to Intuit’s overall growth, while maintaining compliance and financial integrity. The ideal candidate will have strong understanding of billing systems with analytical and investigation skills and the ability to organize himself/herself to deliver against critical objectives and priorities. They will be able to navigate difficult issues successfully and align stakeholders in service to a common outcome. This individual will leverage his/her business acumen to independently design and implement strategies to deliver key outcomes.

What you'll bring
Bachelors’ degree in Finance/Operations Management with minimum of 10 years postgraduate experience, or equivalent work experience.
7+ years of relevant experience in financial operations and reporting for large Fintech, SEC filers in high-growth industries. Must have Software or SaaS industry experience.
Strong end-to-end process orientation with demonstrated analytical thinking, audit/investigative skills, project/change management, and problem-solving skills. Proactively address issues, own the outcome, and continuously strive for best-in-class processes and deliverables.
Ability to deliver outstanding business outcomes with effective and fast decision making that takes into account the interests of all four key stakeholders – employees, customers, shareholders, and partners.
Excellent interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functionally and at all levels of management. Effectively navigates social dynamics of teams, groups, and organizations.
Confidence, good judgment, energy, and personality to work in a dynamic, multi-business unit environment across all levels of management and across business units and functions.
Excellent analytical and organizational skills, time prioritization, resource deployment, and risk assessment.
Excellent written and verbal communications, presentation and influencing skills, including the ability to elevate issues to the right level internally and externally to resolve. Superior ability to clearly articulate a point of view and adjust communication style and content to suit audience needs. Frames complex issues into simple stories
Experience preferred but not limited to the following: Oracle, billing systems (e.g. BRM), Order Management and Accounts Receivable systems, Google.docs, Smartsheet
How you will lead
Develop and maintain a strong understanding of the business unit product line ups, the customer experience and pricing/monetization models across Intuit’s ecosystem and billing platforms, along with the processes and controls that operate (across teams and End-to-End) to ensure that pricing and entitlements are appropriate.
Ensure that the flows for the end-to-end process, controls and systems are documented and maintained. Develop and document the audit and testing strategy to serve as the Company’s approach for a first-line of defense in service to pricing quality assurance from configuration to customer delivery.
Create a ‘pricing community’ that defines roles and functions that are part of the pricing process across all product lines and billing systems. Engage the pricing community with communication and op mechs to understand and develop a pricing quality strategy and each person/team’s roles in supporting first line of defense walkthroughs and testing of pricing-related controls across the ecosystem.
Develops a calendar and timeline for the testing to provide transparency to the pricing community for timing and the engagement model.
Drives end-to-end walkthroughs and control testing, whether self-performed and/or through reviewing work from the pricing community with appropriate documentation and evidence, to assess whether there are any gaps in the design of controls as well as to assess the overall effectiveness of controls that operate in service to accurate pricing, billing and a quality customer experience. Define success metrics and measure/monitor pricing quality. Create automated dashboard reporting and alerts to effectively identify pricing issues proactively.
Provides regular updates to the pricing community and to senior leaders to share progress towards success metrics, the effectiveness assessment for the controls, any gaps in control design/effectiveness (and remediation) and for continuous engagement of the community.
Hold stakeholders accountable for their roles within the pricing community, pricing quality and for timely and rapid remediation of any issues identified.
When and if pricing issues are discovered, serve as the primary POC driver across the ecosystem and community to perform and transparently share a root cause analysis. Drive remediation plans with stakeholder teams to resolve issues quickly and in accordance with SLAs. Use your business domain knowledge in combination with operational skills to lead projects that may include identifying gaps, defining requirements, and driving systemic changes or automated controls.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive inventory of pricing/offering use cases that will be incorporated into testing and regression processes for future offering releases.
Build partnerships with cross functional teams; such as business stakeholders, finance systems technology partners and marketing ops to achieve measurable business outcomes in pursuit of improving the health of pricing offerings through our billing systems.

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management.

Cardinal Health’s Information Security team is on a tremendous growth journey adding several new team members in our CyberOps, Resiliency, Security Architecture, and IT Risk and Compliance teams. We aim to be a world-class cybersecurity and risk management organization that enables Cardinal Health to be healthcare’s most trusted partner.

We currently have a career opening for an IT Business Analyst.

Responsibilities

Business Analysis is responsible for deeply understanding the business in multiple functional areas and across Business Units, as well as understanding the application landscape and capabilities. They maintain relationships with the business and leverage requirements engineering practices and methods to enable improved business processes to drive business success. They align business strategies and capability needs into business and technical requirements to ensure IT systems enable the desired value.

Leads sessions using variety of requirements gathering methods such as interviews, documentation analysis, surveys, site visits, business models with executives, managers, developers and subject matter experts.
Facilitates the team through the analysis of, and makes recommendations towards, complex business decisions.
Mediates across different IT teams utilizing knowledge of IT and roles and responsibilities within the organization.
Focuses on process analysis and re-engineering, with an understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the current and future business environment.
Demonstrates excellent listening, communication, and facilitation skills.
Knows and executes best practices for business analysis processes and functions (from an industry and strategic standpoint.
Defines requirements in accordance with SDP/SDLC, management and project/product scope. Ensures problem statements and objectives are clearly defined. Ensures requirements are aligned to project scope, objectives and strategies.

Qualifications

Proven experience as an IT Business Analyst in a corporate environment.
Experience gathering end user requirements and coordinating solutions with a technical team.
Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experience preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products preferred.
Experience in creating application relevant reporting.

Accountabilities

Work closely with the business, IT and Security Teams.
Provide documentation for new Operational Technology Security applications, processes, and services.
Collaborate with the Security Architecture, OT Security, Network, and Enterprise Architecture teams.
Document Security Architecture standards and patterns into consumable playbooks to be leveraged by IT Solution Delivery teams.
Work to develop an Agile process or modified Waterfall for delivery of defects and enhancements.
Work with IT and Business teams to develop reporting on application performance, customer experience, issue trending, etc.…
Work from Home opportunity

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

Overview:
Job Summary/Purpose: This is a non-permanent, Project-based position (up to 3-year extended assignment).

As the Technology Support Lead Analyst, you will join a team of professionals charged with managing support services for Chick-fil-A's corporate staff. We serve over 4,000 people through a managed service provider, offering service desk, walk-up support, and laptop delivery. Responsibilities include setting strategy for support services that scale with business growth, reviewing interactions to enhance customer experiences, and managing the service provider to ensure effective daily operations and continuous improvement. This role combines strong technical skills and leadership responsibilities with an emphasis on delivering a high level of customer service.
Responsibilities:
Design and constantly refine service desk support function to provide excellent user experiences.
Partner with service provider to explore opportunities to improve the support services by collecting customer feedback, analyzing performance metrics, and researching industry best practices.
Hold service provider accountable to negotiated service levels and address performance issues, as needed.
Proactively determine recurring customer issues and work with stakeholders to ensure appropriate resolution.
Cultivate and encourage the creation of a robust set of documented knowledge base articles for supported services and devices to ensure Service Desk agents can respond to our users' needs.
Cross-train and assist in other functional areas including Executive Support, laptop depot, and walk-up support.
Forecast future business needs and develop strategies to support company growth.
Serve as an escalation point for support issues beyond the service provider.
Ensure a consistent customer experience by establishing key partnerships with other support teams within the technology department and throughout the business to develop and maintain support policies, procedures, and processes.
Ensure escalation groups are held accountable to resolve issues following agreed-upon support policies, procedures, and processes.
Remain knowledgeable about emerging technology trends by attending conferences, pursuing certifications, establishing personal networks, and benchmarking.
Minimum Qualifications:
Experience managing and improving support processes through an ITSM platform
Understanding of ITIL Framework
Strong problem-solving ability

Cross-functional team player

Highly collaborative

Excellent customer service skills

Excellent oral and written communication

Analytical mindset

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience leading a support team
Experience with ServiceNow platform
Project management experience
ITIL Foundations
HDI Manager Certification
Travel Requirements: 20% Required Level of Education: Bachelor's Degree

Job Title: Deposit Operations ACH Support Analyst - Remote Night Shift
Job Description:
As a leading regional bank, SouthState has been providing financial solutions to individuals, families, and businesses in the Southeast for more than 100 years.

SouthState team members strive to create remarkable experiences while building meaningful and lasting relationships. We are proud to be a reflection of the communities we serve and our team members share core values that make SouthState a great place to bank, and a great place to work.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

This is a night shift position with the hours of 12:00pm - 9:00pm

It is the responsibility of the ACH Support Analyst to take ownership of all tasks and challenges that they encounter in the operation of their assigned position, which involves managing the daily tasks associated with large ACH origination client file submission and processing. Applies strong working knowledge of Nacha Rules and regulatory requirements to all aspects of daily work. Performs the daily duties of coworkers in their absence; support other areas within Deposit Operations/ACH as needed; Ensure compliance with South State Holdings, Inc. Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and other operating procedures. The daily functions of the ACH Specialists supports overall bank processing of 14 million transactions a month and 10,000+ companies originating $18 billion+ in monthly ACH activity.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

This group of customers represents extremely high volumes and failures in service and/or delivery can result in financial and/or reputational impact to the bank. The Analysts support the bank’s largest ACH originators through a series of processes and controls designed to provide the best service while limiting the ACH risk to the bank Analysts will also collaborate directly with the clients to resolve any transmission challenges before escalation of any issue to management. The daily functions of the ACH team support overall bank processing of 14 million transactions a month and 10,000+ companies originating $18 billion+ in monthly ACH activity.


Manage the daily submission and monitoring of individual customers’ ACH files submitted directly to the bank. This includes, but is not limited to, monitoring reports for duplicates, limit exceptions, and errors.
Work closely with internal departments and external customers via email and phone to ensure effective communication, implementation of services, and risk mitigation. Adhere to department SLAs.
Resolve incoming ACH returns daily to ensure timely settlement and client notification.
Assist with ACH research that includes, but not limited to, trace requests, ACH NOCs, and ACH returns.
Manage and respond to frequent communication from other financial institutions related to client origination activity
Assist with daily reconcilement and clearing of settlement and return entries.
Manage the escalation of customer or system issue to Operations Management as appropriate.
Applies strong working knowledge of Nacha Rules and regulatory requirements to all aspects of daily work
Assist management with client, bank, and vendor disaster recovery testing.
Will need to work third shift or adjust schedule as needed to assist with coverage while other team members are on PTO
COMPETENCIES

Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree or comparable work experience.
Minimum of 3 years bank operations experience with a concentration in ACH processing.
Knowledge of Fiserv PEP+ preferred.
Accredited ACH Professional (AAP) certification preferred.
Working knowledge of ACH format and Nacha Rules
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate at all levels
Highly organized with ability to manage multiple tasks, work in a demanding environment with critical processing deadlines and critical financial and reputational impacts.
Strong professional communications and technical knowledge and aptitude required.
Strong working knowledge of Word, Excel, and Windows OS.
Strong understanding of payments, systems, and workflows.
Experience in Commercial Customer Service required.
Intermediate understanding of Regulation E, Nacha Rules, and ACH Risk.
TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES


Completion of annual required compliance courses as assigned.
Annual ACH training
PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, reports, and identify customers. This position requires a large amount of time in front of a computer. This can be done sitting or standing with use of the right desk.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

(If applicable) Telecommuting roles no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. They must also have a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered. Analysts will be required to come on-site to a local office location periodically for meetings.

TRAVEL

Travel may be required to come to meetings as needed.

Pay Grade L

Salary: $47,982.94 - $63,351.55 Annually

(Salary Commensurate with Experience)

Job Title: Customer Support Sales Operations Analyst Sr *Hybrid Schedule Available*
Job Description:
Customer Support Sales Operations Analyst Sr *Hybrid Schedule Available* in GAC Savannah


Unique Skills:

See job description


Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in marketing, business administration or related field required or equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. 4 years related experience with at least. 3 years in the sales support process.

Position Purpose:

Under limited supervision, perform data management tasks related to the development, deployment, maintenance and implementation of data management systems and processes in support of Product Support Sales quoting technical data. Under limited supervision, work with Sales Specialists to produce standard products and/or customer proposals based on data analysis and maintenance activities of such to ensure data management systems and processes are accurate. Support ability to produce standard products in support of Product Support Sales quotations. Maintain and monitor database of all standard products in coordination with Sales Specialists.
Job Description

Principle Duties and Responsibilities:

Essential Functions:
Prepare sales/contracts documents including standard products, sales proposals, sales discount agreements and financial information by gathering various technical and/or non-technical data. Deliver effective, accurate information for potential buyers and key representatives.

Work independently and exercises latitude to resolve data management issues.

Execute tasks for development and maintenance of documentation as per departmental standards, including standard operating procedures, work methods, other supporting documents.

Act as focal point for all submitted products from Sales Specialists to include analysis of incoming requests for quality, tracking, reporting, and process management.

Maintain and utilize SAP to establish accurate quoting and sales information in order to facilitate accurate and timely presentation of proposals and to provide accurate reporting data for senior management and General Dynamics.

Lead and coordinate the daily communication with all levels of internal and external customers for global Product Support Sales team.

Communicate, coordinate and mentor other team members regarding activities within the department.

Additional Functions:
Lead special team projects as directed. .

Perform various support services which may include preparing reports, coordinating training, overseeing all aspects of internal team meetings, monitor and manage department office supplies and budget. .

Travel as required. for team meetings. .

Perform other duties as assigned.

Other Requirements:
Possess ability to understand and work with corporate structure, programs, and procedures.

Knowledge of the business aircraft marketplace.

Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple priorities.

Strong interpersonal, professional business-like verbal, written and overall communication skill.

Must possess initiative, poise, persistence and ability to gather and analyze information under many diverse conditions.

Ability to lead projects.

In addition to duties performed during normal business hours, must be available as needed outside normal work schedule, due to domestic or international business demands.

Must have knowledge and understanding of international cultures, customs and time zones.

Must be able to type 60 wpm and be proficient in Microsoft Office products.

SAP experience preferred.

Skills Qualifications: Demonstrated knowledge of applications in web environments; ability to analyze processes and identify areas for improvement; ability to translate logic to solve application problems; understanding of the Systems Development Life Cycle; working knowledge of relational database design, including tables, views and indexes; ability to communicate effectively and to work well with others; strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask; ability to act as a representative of Gwinnett County Public Schools; and ability to work across functional boundaries and interact with employees at all levels of the organization.

Primary Responsibilities: Responsible for the design, development, testing, and implementation of applications, primarily in PeopleSoft, and Web environments.

1. Design, develop, test, and implement applications while maintaining enhancements and developing new functionality to optimize existing intranet and internet solutions.

2. Design and implement applications systems, create applications system documentation, and resolve problems when they occur on existing systems.

3. Assist in the development and maintenance of the departmental budget.

4. Facilitate continuous improvement opportunities of program and project management methods based on organizational need.

5. Conduct analysis of application systems.
a. Report status on assigned tasks.
b. Perform feasibility studies and requirement analysis.
c. Assist or train other team members in resolving application problems.

6. Maintain a high degree of technical competence in programming and system analysis.

7. Maintain a working knowledge of vendor supplied software/utilities pertinent to position functions.

8. Provide world-class customer service.
a. Demonstrate any new or enhanced system to users.
b. Work with user and technical teams in a professional manner.
c. Consult with management to get approval for new applications.
d. Contribute to project management requirements.
e. Participate in status meetings.

9. Perform other duties as assigned.

Physical Demands:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit for extended periods of time. The employee is also required to talk, hear, stand, and walk. The employee may be required to use hands to finger, handle, feel, and/or reach. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Information regarding recruiting and phishing scams:
Employment offers will always be made by a Uniphore hiring manager or Talent Acquisition team member with a @uniphore.com email address only. We will never text you about an employment opportunity, interviews or employment offers, and we do not make job offers after only one interview. Additionally, we will never ask you to provide funds for onboarding, supplies or anything else, nor we will ask you to submit your personal information (date of birth, passport details, banking information, social security number, etc.) as part of the interview process. If you are receiving an employment inquiry or employment offer from a non Uniphore.com email address, please assume it is spam. If you believe you have been a victim of a phishing or false employment scam, you may want to report this incidents to the FBI iC3, or visit the Department of Homeland Security’s Cyber Smart website to learn how to report such scam.

RaceTrac Company Overview

Job Description:

The Business Systems Analyst – Fuel (EV) is responsible for identifying and documenting business needs including understanding their structure, processes and operations. Responsible for partnering with the internal business and external vendors to collaboratively generate creative ideas, problem solve, gather business and technical requirements. Develop solutions and implement technologies to enable new and existing business functions. This role will be a liaison between the business and Fuel Technology teams.

This role will be dedicated to supporting the Energy Transition strategic initiative relating to alternative fuels for RaceTrac customers. This includes, but is not limited to, the rollout of electric vehicle chargers.

Responsibilities:

Support Silver Comet by understanding and documenting the technology opportunities related to alternative fuels.
Understands and effectively communicates RaceTrac’s position with electric vehicle charging.
Creates and maintains partnerships across Metroplex, Silver Comet and IT across all levels to proactively identify areas where technology can drive efficiency or revenue generation while delivering a high quality product.
Develops and documents requirements for technology solutions that better enable development and store systems teams to improve efficiency, reduce cost, and drive revenue.
Develops user acceptance test plans, test scenarios and manages execution of UAT while documenting results and communicating to senior leadership outcomes and timelines.
Owns communication and documentation of new feature enhancements and versions to business and IT stakeholders from 3rd parties as well as internally built applications that includes developing roadmap for testing, communication and deployment.
Collaborates with business owners on needs related to the Energy Transition initiative and translates them into actionable requirements; tracks budgets and timelines throughout process.
Establishes and manages relationships with internal stakeholders and senior leadership throughout the company to communicate and guarantees the delivery of a high quality product.
Discovers new opportunities to optimize the business through improved processes and functional enhancements.
Works with the teams of developers, engineers, product owners and project managers to plan and execute projects in a timely manner while delivering upon the customer’s expectations.
Develops and refines metrics for project and individual performance; communicates metrics to developers and motivates all team members towards buy-in, personal and group accountability of these goals.
Works with Senior Manager of Fuel Technologies to assess current processes, systems, and tools to update and ensure the most efficient project or delivery lifecycle.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science or Information Technology preferred
2-5 years of experience as a business analyst or experience of SDLC management (Agile, DevOps, Lean, etc.)
Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skill with the ability to multitask in order to balance immediate and long/term priorities preferred with highly effective oral and written communication
Facilitation skills and demonstrated ability to work with cross-functional teams required
Preferred fuel, alternative fuel, or logistic experience preferred

About Gap

Gap has always been about optimistic American style. Starting with our very first store on Ocean Avenue in San Francisco, opened almost 50 years ago by Doris and Don Fisher. The thread that’s run through those five decades is the phenomenal people that make up our brand – our employees and our customers. People who are rooted in the legacy that makes Gap what it is, but who are also focused on the future. People who want to leave the world better than they found it.

We’ve built our brand on staying true to our roots while always being out in front of what’s next. If you want to be part of an iconic American brand, and help lead the way for where we’re headed, we’d love to have you join us.

About the Role

In this role, you will leverage your knowledge of the business to effectively execute and quickly adapt strategies to ensure operational excellence, merchandising execution, maximum productivity and profitable sales and earnings growth. You will drive high performance across all initiatives, and ensure consistency within your portfolio as measured by company goals and KPIs that drive a profitable portfolio. You will lead, develop, coach and inspire a portfolio of stores to deliver an optimal customer and employee experience. Your goal is to lead execution and support the brand and enterprise vision, ensuring your teams are delivering results and holding their teams accountable.

What You'll Do
All leaders are expected to become experts of the brand's selling behaviors, leading and leveraging these behaviors with every customer who walks through our doors and allowing us to provide a exceptional customer experience.
Drive profitable sales through effective business analysis; identifying financial opportunities and action plans to address current business challenges and deliver desired results
Attract, develop and fuel a talent pipeline in support of the district, region and brand talent strategy
Distinguish between customer segments, with differences in needs and approaches, and understand variances in profitability and value creation potential
Maintain strong relationships and collaboration with peers, cross functional partners and Headquarter partners to leverage expertise in developing and executing strategies
Responsible for quality of services and advice in meeting business partner needs
Responsible for end results of team and shares responsibility over resources, budget and adherence to policies
Who You Are
Leadership experience overseeing district, multi-unit or high volume business
Strong business acumen and proven track record of leading, adjusting and developing business strategy to achieve profit & loss results
Keen awareness of the marketplace inclusive of Gap Inc brands, external competitors and overall retail trends
Ability to embrace challenges, take risks, learn fast and influence change to lead execution of strategic initiatives through others while managing competing priorities
Able to travel overnight and/or between stores as required
Ability to assess relatively complex situations and analyze data to make judgments and recommend solutions
Understanding of concepts and procedures specific to own subject area
Benefits at Gap
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*
Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*
Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*
Employee stock purchase plan.*
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*
See more of the benefits we offer.
For eligible employees

We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.

The Data Contributor Services organization is a team of Operations Consultants responsible for the intake and quality of all data within the USIS business unit of Equifax while serving as the relationship manager and SME for data furnishers across various data domains. As a Data Operations Analyst in this organization the ideal candidate should be willing to build and manage relationships with data furnishers, oversee ingestion of billions of rows of data each month and serve as the primary point of contact for their assigned portfolio of furnishers. He/she will monitor, research, and respond to data furnisher activity including credit reporting submissions, questions/inquiries, audits, and data furnisher onboarding/off-boarding procedures. He/she should be able to analyze large datasets, demonstrate technology savvy, and be knowledgeable of the FCRA regulations and Metro 2 reporting guidelines. He/she will thrive in a challenging fast-paced environment and is looking for an opportunity to develop professionally and technically.

What you’ll do

Serve as relationship manager for data furnishers (financial institutions, payment processors, fintech startups, etc).

Responsible for the oversight of billions of rows of data that come from data furnishers (consumer and commercial tradeline data).

Monitor, research, and respond to data contributor activity including file update submissions, data reporting questions/inquiries, audits, and onboarding/off-boarding procedures.

Ability to analyze large datasets, be technology savvy, and be knowledgeable of the FCRA regulations and Metro 2 reporting guidelines.

Facilitate on-site visits and annual data reviews with data furnishers.

Recognized as SME in data processing/cleansing technology, data exchange rules, and data reporting regulatory guidance.

Provides consultation and support to customers, sales, and other teams.

Understand internal system changes, business rules, and overarching data governance.

Stay abreast of external regulatory and industry reporting changes.

Consult with clients and prepare understandable messaging for the data furnishers to articulate how changes may impact them.

Works with customers and programmers to implement custom solutions that deliver data to customers to drive impactful decisions. Drafts the requirements and QC's work performed by programmers to ensure changes affecting production are properly implemented.

What experience you need

Bachelor’s Degree or Higher in Business, Computer Science, or related field

4 - 5 years of experience handling Big Data

Project management and relationship management experience

Comfortable using MS office, Google Workspace (preferred) and Salesforce

Data analysis and querying skills using language like SQL

Drafting technical instructions for IT programming/ implementation. BI skills a plus

Sort and identify patterns/anomalies in large data sets

What could set you apart

Knowledge of FCRA regulations and Metro 2 credit reporting guidelines and requirements is preferred

Familiarity with cloud based data visualization tools i.e: Looker, Data studio etc., a plus

Knowledge of electronic file transmission (SFTP/FTP/Internet) protocols/procedures

We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, 401k matching, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!

Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Who We Are:

Angel Oak Capital Advisors is an investment management firm focused on providing compelling fixed income investment solutions for its clients. Backed by a value-driven approach, Angel Oak Capital seeks to deliver attractive risk-adjusted returns through a combination of stable current income and price appreciation. Our experienced investment team seeks the best opportunities in fixed income with a specialization in mortgage-backed securities, other areas of structured credit, and corporate credit. A highly entrepreneurial organization that embraces a strong service-based culture, Angel Oak was named a Top 150 Workplace by the Atlanta Journal Constitution the past six years.

Position Overview

The candidate will support the ongoing enhancement of data and Salesforce primarily within the firm’s Sales organization. Streamlining workflow, tracking of sales activity and the distillation of large data sets into actionable insights will be a critical component of the role’s success. Additionally, efficient execution of day-to-day salesforce administrator functions will also be essential.

Principal Accountabilities:

Serve as a primary system administrator for the Salesforce application with ~60 users
Handle day-to-day administrator functions, including user account setup and maintenance, customization of configurations, views, reports, and dashboards, automations, data validation, troubleshooting
Administer 3rd party applications (integrated with Salesforce)
Work with leaders, subject matter experts, and users in the valuation, scope, completion and documentation of new development projects
Effectively act as a liaison between users and vendors
Assist in training of new users and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization
Develop tools and resources for the sales teams to track sales activity and help prospecting
Analyze data sets and summarize into digestible report mediums/presentations (Excel, PowerPoint) that enable decision making and sales activity

Qualifications

Minimum:

Bachelor's Degree from a four-year college or university
Minimum one year of direct hands-on experience as a Salesforce Administrator (Lightning) with an emphasis on data analysis
Strong knowledge of Salesforce functionality and best practices
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Detail oriented and self-starter with strong written and interpersonal skills
Ability to explain technical information to non-technical stakeholders and summarize large data sets
Ability to assess the impact of new requirements and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes
Strong data management abilities (data integrity, duplicates, merging)

Preferred:

Demonstrated track record of enabling sales organizations to drive growth through data analytics
Salesforce Administrator Certifications (ADM201C, ADM211)
Experience working with Salesforce Pardot (Account Engagement)
Experience in finance or asset management
Experience with Broadridge SalesVision, Distribution Insights Sales Analytics and Market Analytics, DocuSign, CRM Analytics, Salesforce Maps, and Salesforce Shield
Experience with coding languages (SQL, Python)
Experience with Flow, Process Builder, Workflow Rules and APEX

NOTE: These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work involved for this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of this job.

Angel Oak Capital Advisors provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

Republic National Distributing Company (RNDC) is a family-owned business with roots extending before Prohibition that has evolved into one of the nation’s largest wine and spirits wholesalers. Our success is grounded in our core values of Family, Service, Accountability, Honesty, and Professionalism. We offer a vibrant, inclusive culture and workplace experience for individuals who want a career that makes them feel accomplished and engaged. RNDC values the health and well-being of our associates, inside and outside the office, offering dynamic health and wellness benefits that supply exceptional care and value. RNDC is geared toward growing our footprint and our people. Join our team of energetic professionals who believe in many happy hours and are experts in our craft.

Summary

The Technical Analyst Sales Performance is primarily responsible for the business support, optimization, and enhancement of the RNDC Sales Performance/Sales Compensation application platforms. The scope of this role includes the tracking, management and payout for 10,000+ payees in accordance with incentive/commission compensation plans and sales goals, with more than 300 users accessing those platforms, 200+ sales incentives per month per RNDC market, with approximately 4-5 markets per region. The user community for the systems within this position’s scope include Portfolio Managers, Sales Finance Managers, Sales Division Managers, and Analysts.

In this role, you will
Build and maintain customized reporting and dashboard analytics to share with Sales Performance Group, as well as Regional Presidents and State VPS.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including RNDC Markets, HR-Comp, and Supplier Finance to ensure all compensation and SPM methodologies, polices, and procedures are working as designed
Deliver hypercare by completing setup of new Sales Performance/Incentive plans, overseeing day-to-day processing / execution, providing technical support, responding to inquiries, identifying software application and reporting issues and gaps in functionality and driving timely resolution
Participate in the technical design, system administration, security, and business management of the sales performance and sales compensation applications and platforms
Lead User Acceptance Testing and deployment
Assist with the definition of policy, governance and business processes for Sales Performance / Sales Comp. Assist with UAT and Testing
Serve as the architectural Subject Matter Expert for the sales performance / sales comp platforms and applications
Translate business requirements to user stories for technology implementation,
Minimal Travel Required (5-10%)
What you bring to RNDC
Bachelor’s degree preferred; or four or more years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Expertise in sales performance application model design along with a good technical understanding of sales performance application platforms.
Strong knowledge in Design, Development and Testing of business technology applications.
Two or more years of wine and spirits distribution industry knowledge
Prior experiences with a sales performance management tool similar to Varicent or SAP Callidus

401(k) with company matching

We follow CDC Guidelines and have a fun and safe environment for our teams.

Organization
Established in 2006, Interactive Government Holdings, Inc. (IGH) is a leading professional services and technology provider to the Federal government. We are a growing government contractor seeking to add staff to assume dynamic roles in support of our customers and company performance. Our mission is to serve our men and women in uniform, and their families, globally and their support systems locally. We utilize strategy, data science and make the programs we execute more efficient for the people our programs serve. IGH has a national and international contract staff as well as a HQ team in Springfield, Virginia. IGH has consistently been ranked as one of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies by Inc. Magazine. We are proud of our ability to shape tomorrow, while ensuring all carry out their critical missions and tasks today.
Job Description
Interactive Government Holdings (IGH) is seeking qualified, trained and capable individual to perform Data Analyst II / Future Operations Duties in support of the Georgia Army National Guard Recruiting and Retention Battalion. The Data Analyst II (Recruiting, Retention, and Attrition) evaluates trends in recruiting in order to establish new and effective means of hitting the target market. The data analyst is responsible for keeping the recruiters in R&R Command advised of current recruiting numbers, market trends, and possible weaknesses in order to increase current market share for the GAARNG.

Major responsibilities include (not all inclusive):

Provide Recruiting and Retention Command and Staff with current/historical custom recruiting reports and data trends as requested.

Provide Company Command teams current/historical custom recruiting reports data and data trends as requested.

Sort, download, and consolidate all accession spreadsheets into one report.

Consolidate IST/ISR additions and Data Warehouse accessions.

Provide “Block Mission” accession data.

Provide accession data for Battalion, Company, Section, and RRNCO levels.

Daily status board update: Utilizes daily accession data, convert to briefing slides, and post hard copies to the command status board.

MOS bonus list reports: Sort G-1’s raw bonus vacancies spreadsheet report into two specific reports, the commanders report (includes 100%+ fill, FWD/REAR report dets); GAARNG bonus section’s report (deletes 100%+, FWD/REAR dets).

Battalion Briefings Coordination.

Plans and schedules ongoing meetings as required for Commanders and Staff.

Recommend adjustments and transmits WARNORD for Battalion level briefings to accommodate resources and decision made at the higher level.

Conduct a wide range of activities related to staff work such as tracking progress of FRAGORD deadlines. Generates accession slides.

Perform scribe functions during the Battalion level briefings.

Weekly significant event reports:

Identify and provides the Battalion Commander, Executive Officer and Command Sergeant Major significant reports on Monday mornings that lists events pertaining to R&R and GAARNG for the next 7 days in detail, and then extensive information for the next two quarters.

Prepare reports that also include scheduled VTCs, meetings, MEPS schedule, Company drills, and mobilization readiness IPRs for Senior Leadership within the Battalion.

VTC coordination:

Coordinate and verifies rooms (IP address/bridge) with NGB video operations.

Ensure VTC location is reserved and equipment is operational.

Conduct communications check prior to VTC.

NGB DPRO reports: Provide technical knowledge to Battalion S3 and downloads, organize, consolidate, and archive Director’s Personnel Readiness Overview data which results in the independent compilation of data relevant to R&R program areas.

Generate R&R spreadsheets for annual ACoE submissions, to include training pipeline losses, accessions, end strength, and reenlistment to the Battalion S3 for distribution to higher.

Track, monitor, and update R&R’s E-mail distribution lists.

Update R&R maps.

Qualifications:

Individual must have a valid Secret security clearance (or higher) or be able to obtain one.

Extensive knowledge of the GAARNG Recruiting and Retention Mission is required.

Experience as an Army National Guard Recruiter is required.

Good presentation, written, and oral skills are required.

Applicant must have experience using Microsoft Excel and other data compiling platforms. Applicants must be able to present data in many different forms, such as tables and graphs.

Normal work week, normal office work hours. Occasional travel for training and/or conferences.

This position is contingent upon award of a contract.

IGH offers a competitive benefits program which includes: Paid Vacation and Sick Leave, 401K (4% company match), Company Paid Life Insurance Policy, and comprehensive Health, Vision, Dental and Disability plans.

IGH is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.

IGH is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Work Location: In person

Prologis, Inc. is the global leader in logistics real estate. In partnership with our customers and our communities, we develop modern, high-quality properties that set the standard for innovative building design and sustainability. Prologis owns or has investments in properties and development projects of ~1.2 billion square feet in 19 countries and enables 2.8% of the world’s GDP. We have committed to achieve net zero emissions by 2040. Beyond real estate, our Essentials platform optimizes the company’s global asset portfolio to provide our customers solutions that address today’s warehouse and shipping challenges. Prologis Ventures invests in logistics innovation and technology companies to modernize supply chains worldwide.
Job Title:
Financial Operations Analyst
Company:
Prologis
Prologis is looking for a Financial Operations Analyst/Associate to join our multifaceted Operations team. You will have direct accountability and ownership of budgeting, forecasting, processing, planning, analysis and reporting of multiple financial metrics for a portfolio of assets within assigned markets in our growing East Region. If you're looking to make an impact on a Global level, apply today! This role will be operating locally out of our Buckhead office.
Position Responsibilities:
Budgeting, Forecasting & Reporting
Responsible for the preparation, coordination and review of annual operating budgets, forecasts, reporting and monthly variance analysis of each assigned market.
Coordinate collection of leasing assumptions, operating and capital expenses for budgets and forecasts.
Review budget, forecast and actual results for reasonableness and take appropriate action as necessary. Examples of follow-up actions are giving feedback to the operations teams about their inputs, correcting errors found through in-depth cash flow analysis, and explaining variances between forecasts and actual monthly accounting results.
Participate in the preparation of quarterly budget and forecast presentations to divisional leadership.
Serve as the Operations Finance expert in assigned markets and be a resource to the local team.
Present forecasting, budgeting, and reporting results to Market Officer, with a focus on key performance drivers
Provide guidance to Property Management and Leasing Teams on forecasting, budgeting, and reporting systems and processes.
Act as a liaison between accounting and the local market teams
Support senior management and cross-functional business partners with timely, accurate and actionable analysis.
Track key performance indicators (KPI’s) (i.e., NOI, Same Store Sales, Occupancy, Rent Change, Turnover Costs, Capital Expenditures) and explain main performance drivers and variances.
Provide data stewardship for leasing activity from lease review through data entry, including workflow management between multiple groups to ultimately ensure that reporting captures the transactions’ character. Serve as an expert in the reporting implications of lease transactions.
Essential Skills & Experience:
Undergraduate degree, preferably with a concentration in finance, accounting, real estate, or economics
3+ years related work or related graduate course work experience. Budgeting and forecasting experience is a plus.
Excellent analytical and written communication skills, including the ability to present and engage with regional management team members.
Advanced Excel modeling skills a must
Proficient using Word and PowerPoint
Self-starter – ability to creatively tackle new situations and analyses without heavy direction.
High level of intellectual curiosity with strong desire to continuously learn, improve / automate existing processes and solve problems independently.
Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy
Execute responsibilities with a sense of urgency and follow-through.
Positive and proactive work ethic, with a strong commitment to delivering a high level of customer service.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines with efficiency and accuracy.
Show tact, discretion, confidentiality and good judgement in handling sensitive and confidential matters and documentation.
Hiring Salary Range of: $75,000–$91,000. Salary and whole compensation package (bonus target) to be determined by the candidate’s location, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data.

Company Description

Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio.

Collectively, our global businesses manufacture, assemble or distribute faucets, showers, accessories, tubs, sinks, garbage disposals and sanitaryware in North America, China, South Africa and Europe.

Moen is the #1 consumer faucet brand in North America, which offers a vast array of stylish and innovative kitchen, bath, leak detection and connected home products.

House of Rohl includes our five premium and luxury brands: Perrin & Rowe®,ROHL®,Riobel®, Shaws® and Victoria + Albert®.

We welcome you to visit the Moen and House of Rohl websites.

Job Description

BASIC JOB FUNCTIONS / RESPONSIBILITIES :

Play a key role in generating analytical solutions to complex business problems by mining data, leveraging data experiments, conducting analysis, and generating insights that to yield relevant, actionable insights.

Support Retail Strategic Account Team’s data and analytics requests by gathering business requirements, sourcing and validating data, analyzing data, building models, synthesizing insights, and presenting results.

Develop and automate daily, weekly, monthly, and seasonal reporting and dashboards to monitor the health of the business and to share business insights with Sales, Marketing, and Finance stakeholders.

Conduct and support analysis across multiple large-scale data sources (structured and unstructured) to identify and socialize key facts and insights.

Collaborate with Retail Strategic Account Teams, Marketing, Finance, and Information Technology (IT) to understand business needs and identify key opportunities and challenges, particularly in defining analytical problem statements and building the fact basis needed to create recommendations.

Apply relevant statistical tools to help build predictive models, improve customer segmentation, optimize product assortments, refine approach to pricing, and improve elements of the overall marketing mix.

Partner with internal and external IT teams to develop short and long term data analytics tools and infrastructure.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math Business Intelligence or a related quantitative discipline is required.

Minimum of 3 years of experience in a Business Intelligence-related, analytical role

Experience in extracting, manipulating and analyzing data, drawing conclusions and making recommendations.

Experience with business intelligence and visualization toolkits such as Qlik, Tableau, SQL, R, Python, or SAS.

Experience developing solutions using large volumes of data; creating predictive models, using applied statistical analysis such as regression, classification, clustering, etc.

Demonstrated sense of urgency and ability to persevere to reach objectives for challenging problems.

Strong communication skills with experience presenting and translating data into decision-ready insights is preferred.

Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite. Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills are required.

Ability to travel ~10%

Additional Information

Fortune Brands' Water Innovations (WINN) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. WINN's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.

Job Description:
This position is part of TruthMD’s Roster Processing department within Operations. This department’s primary responsibility is to obtain, process, validate and import public state board licensing and demographic information for healthcare providers. The Technical Data Analyst will facilitate processing and importation of this data by executing SQL queries to validate and ensure the accuracy of data. This position will report to the VP, Operations.

Responsibilities:

Execute SQL quality assurance scripts at various points during data-processing
Troubleshoot and identify data discrepancies and collaborate with the data team to reconcile errors
Provide insight and feedback on current processes to improve data quality
Assist with automation of current manual processes, including automation testing
Assess changes in data structure and make changes to queries as needed
Assist with writing queries to identify possible bugs or data errors within SSMS database
Perform ad-hoc projects for management to ensure success with various client-related deadlines
Attend twice-weekly stand-ups to keep up to date with other work within data processing pipelines
Leverage existing SQL querying tools to facilitate and expedite processes
Work with internal teams to improve workflow and system processes
Report bugs and recommend improvements as they relate to the roster process

Requirements:

High proficiency in SQL and Excel
Strong organizational and planning skills to keep in-line with refresh schedule
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases
Experience using ticketing system for all project work, Jira is a plus
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum 2+ years in related field

Citizen and Green Card only. No Visa sponsorships please.

Job Purpose: The Senior IT Business Analyst role is to drive the successful alignment of information technology solutions
with business objectives, ensuring the efficient and effective delivery of IT projects and initiatives. This position plays a
critical role in bridging the gap between technology and cross-functional business areas, working closely with stakeholders
to gather and analyze requirements, identify opportunities for improvement, and recommend innovative solutions to
enhance operational efficiency and drive business growth.


Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for improvement.
Use a variety of data analysis and organizational tools to uncover insights.
Work with business users to understand requirements.
Work closely with functional leaders to fully understand their business needs and identify the best way to address the
needs using existing software.
When needed evaluate other software solutions to address the needs of the business.
Assist the development team with documenting the data flow and overall system workflow.
Ensure that any new software integration into ASB systems meets functional requirements, system compliance and
interface specifications.
Ensure that development projects meet business requirements and goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and identify
and resolve systems issues.
Coordinate and meet with the business leaders to ensure that business requirements are clear and include defined
ranges for changes to the existing system or needed functionality within all systems new and existing.
Serve as the quality analysts to thoroughly test the features of the new system and ensure it meets all the functions
that were defined in the original business requirements.
Develop business requirement documentation to include process flow, use cases, and system diagrams.
Work closely with the development team to ensure they fully understand the business requirements and they are
delivering a quality solution.
Oversee implementation of projects with internal and external consultant groups from inception to completion.
Documents the project from the initial conception, through the requirements phase, design, development, and
implementation.
Validates results by working closely with subject matter experts to test programs.
Ensures operation by training business partners in the use of new system or changes to the existing system.
Constantly looks for new ways to improve the processes, procedures, and overall workflow within the organization.
Is an advocate of change within the organization capable of communicating the process improvements to the
business processes.
Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and provide recommendations for solving using
analysis.
Review and analyze existing application effectiveness and efficiency to develop strategies for improving or leveraging
these systems.


Qualifications:

3+ years as a Business Systems Analyst.
3+ years direct experience in full life cycle software development.
Experience with Infor M3 or similar ERP manufacturing, sales, and distribution systems.
Bachelors or Master’s degree in business or Computer Science or similar experience.

Experience working with reporting and data analytic software.
Technical background and knowledge of SQL is preferred.
Experience with cloud based ERP systems.
Sharp problem-solving, analytical and innovation skills.
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex ideas into simple language for non-technicians.
Ability to communicate to a wide variety of audiences, both business and technical.
Solid technical background and skilled at developing releases for upgrades, troubleshooting and implementation of
new software programs.
Keen leadership and project management skills, ability to drive projects from inception to completion.
Strong knowledge of system and software best practices and methodologies.
Self-motivated with strong attention to detail.
Ability to adjust priorities and execute tasks in a fast pace environment.
Experience working in a team oriented, collaborative agile environment.
Knowledge of database design and file management techniques.
Ability to identify and document business requirements, ensure quality of data and pull of information to assist with
analyzing key business questions.
Ability to understand existing business processes and assist with efforts to re-engineer processes.
Proficiency in basic project management.
Ability to work with business and third-party consultants in support of our software integrations process is a key
requirement. Support of workflow design, business process mapping, and requirements gathering will be a critical
part of this position.


Work Environment: Hybrid/remote- 6 days in office moving to 12 days in office beginning in January 2024. Preference given to candidates near Grovetown, GA or Sidney, OH

Job Title: Business Analyst I - Emory College of Arts and Sciences
Job Description:
Discover Your Career at Emory University:
Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Supports efforts to ensure that information systems support departmental objectives and information management needs.
Works closely with departmental customers to conduct business analysis and identify business objectives and requirements.
Collects information to assist in the development of technology plans and strategies. Assists in planning and implementing systems related projects.
Supports customer satisfaction by monitoring the delivery of ongoing information services to designated clients.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Five years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions OR a bachelor's degree and three years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions.
Additional Information:
As a member of the Academic Advising and Success Programs Team within Undergraduate Education, the Business Analyst I for Academic Retention, Graduation and Student Success reports to the Associate Dean of Academic Advising and Success and other stakeholders to manage and innovate retention projects, data management, and outreach. The ideal candidate will have strong data management skills, communication skills, a collaborative approach, and a commitment to student success.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and/or Competencies
Knowledge of retention/ graduation strategies and their application in the higher education setting.
Knowledge of and appreciation for a complex research university.
Data management and analysis skills
Ability to conceive, plan, execute and assess projects.
Attention to detail with regard to specific policies, practices, and standards.
Ability to communicate effectively across a range of stakeholders, such as students, faculty, staff administrators, and external agencies.
Ability to work effectively with teams on specific projects in a collaborative atmosphere.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.
Job Responsibilities
Coordinate with the Associate Dean for Academic Advising and Success on retention and graduation initiatives
Regularly create and provide pertinent data analytics to undergraduate leadership regarding retention indicators, such as failure to enroll, holds on registration, and disengagement from academic advising, etc.
Data management for retention, graduation, and academic standing
Mid-semester check and grade data
Academic Progress Report Data
First year students of concern data
Student attendance and engagement data (EAB)
Coordinate comprehensive, individualized, and small group identification, outreach to a diverse population of students to foster retention, graduation and academic success.
Oversee the targeted outreach to students at risk of transfer
Coordinating outreach for students of academic concern, including students on academic probation or in the Academic Re-Engagement Program
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with higher education data platforms like EAB, Peoplesoft, Slate and Tableau
Experience in data analysis/ management at a Research I University
NOTE: Position tasks are generally required to be performed in-person at an Emory University location. Remote work from home day options may be granted at department discretion. Emory reserves the right to change remote work status with notice to employee.
Emory Supports a Diverse and Inclusive Culture: Emory University is dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran's status. Emory University is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of its affirmative action, equal opportunity and nondiscrimination policy in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, transfers, discipline, terminations, wage and salary administration, benefits, and training. Inquiries regarding this policy should be directed to the Emory University Department of Equity and Inclusion, 201 Dowman Drive, Administration Building, Atlanta, GA 30322.
