Job Title: 2024 SOFTWARE ENGINEER PROGRAM – FULL-TIME OPPORTUNITY - ATLANTA
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


2024 SOFTWARE ENGINEER PROGRAM – FULL-TIME OPPORTUNITY


Be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that engineers large-scale, complex and resilient technology solutions that drive our global business. You'll help build and optimize digital applications and systems that support millions of customers, clients and employees worldwide.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading financial services firm with operations worldwide. With over 55,000 technologists globally and an annual tech spend of $14 billion, JPMorgan Chase is dedicated to innovating and improving the design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming that goes into creating high quality software and new products. Under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands, the Firm serves millions of customers in the U.S., and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients globally. Visit http://www.jpmorganchase.com/tech for more information.

In launching your career in our Software Engineering Group we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation & engineering practices. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You’ll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment—one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.



What to expect

Start with an in-depth induction program that teaches you about our businesses, builds on your knowledge of development methodologies, and sharpens your professional skills.
Dive head-first into creating innovative solutions that make a difference for our customers, clients and employees.
Create and improve the design, analytics, coding and testing for high-quality software and new products.
Own projects end-to-end, keeping teams and stakeholders up to speed on the progress of what’s being developed.
Work and share ideas, information and innovation with our team of technologists from all over the world.
Develop through on-going training, mentorship and access to senior leaders.
Participate in our Force for Good program to develop real-life tech solutions for social good organizations while learning new skills and collaborating with our JPMorgan Chase tech experts.
Join an inspiring and curious team of technologists who will support you in developing new skills, experiencing new projects and businesses, and taking your career where you want to go

Locations you may join in the United States:

Chicago, IL
Columbus, OH
Houston, TX
Wilmington, DE
New York Metro, NY
Plano, TX
Palo Alto, CA
Seattle, WA
Tampa, FL

About you

If you're ready to put your passion for technology to work in a way that makes a real difference, you’ll find your place in our Software Engineer Program.

Key skills include:

Computer Science and/or Engineering majors are preferred while other majors may be considered
Pursuing a B.A., B.S. or 5th year M.A. or M.S. with expected graduation between August 2023 and June 2024
A well-rounded academic background with a preferred minimum GPA of 3.2
Foundational knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, Javascript, Java, C++, C#), databases, data structures and algorithms
Relevant internship experience and leadership in school or community organization
Experience across the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Exposure to agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency and Security
Emerging knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)
In touch with industry wide technology trends and best practices with a thirst for learning, growing and trying new things
Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, and passionate about building an innovative culture
Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance and software improvement

To be eligible for this program, you must be authorized to work in the U.S. We do not offer any type of employment-based immigration sponsorship for this program. Likewise, JPMorgan Chase & Co., will not provide any assistance or sign any documentation in support of any other form of immigration sponsorship or benefit including optional practical training (OPT) or curricular practical training (CPT.)

What’s Next?

Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume and location preference. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.

After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you’ll receive an email invitation to complete a coding challenge powered by HackerRank. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.

HackerRank is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed this step. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We will provide reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities.

Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.

ABOUT US

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents and perspectives that they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. (If you are a US or Canadian applicant with a disability and wish to request an accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us by calling the Accessibility Line (US and Canada Only) 1-866-777-4690 and indicate the specifics of the assistance needed.)

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst Marketing and Sales
Job Description:
The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for CCI's efforts to develop and expand an analytically driven business performance evaluation framework. You will support the testing, analysis, and reporting function in projects across multiple functional areas of the business, including Marketing, Pricing, Sales, Operations and others. This role requires a creative individual who possesses skills in data handling, model development, analytics, and storytelling. Innovation is encouraged and a desire to collaborate well with our team, boundary partners, and leaders across the organization is a must.

Cox Communications is seeking a Senior Data Analyst who is experienced in:

Data mining, modeling, analysis, and visualization.
Analytical capabilities building and continuous improvement.
Using data analysis to assess the performance and identify insights of strategies and tests.




In this role you are part of a team responsible for CCI's efforts to develop and expand an analytically driven business performance evaluation framework. You will support the testing, analysis, and reporting function in projects across multiple functional areas of the business, including Marketing, Pricing, Sales, Operations and others. This role is a unique opportunity to help deliver on the vision to grow analytical capabilities, as well as support the development of key strategies critical to the business.

What You'll Do:


Serve as a subject matter expert supporting effectiveness analysis, including:

A/B testing and multivariate experiments.
Sales, Marketing, Pricing performance, including evaluation of strategy objectives.
Performance of offers, customer migration, churn, etc.
Designs and develops big data-based models and reporting tools using tools like SQL and Python in the Snowflake environment.
Identifies and mine new data resources to enable reporting and advanced analytics.
Translates data and trends into actionable insights via regular and ad-hoc reports that tell our competitive story.
Understands organizational objectives and helps improve reporting, analytics, and development projects to meet these goals.
Provides support to ad-hoc requests from senior leaders and boundary partners.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency by implementing data validation and quality assurance procedures .
Provides Data Analysis services across multiple products, business or organizational areas.
Interacts with business leaders to understand key objectives and concerns.
Develops database logic to extract required information for reporting.
Supports efforts to distill massive amounts of complicated data into meaningful and actionable insights.
Designs, develops and implements dashboards and reports to facilitate data review and analysis.
Manage and prioritize multiple projects, ensuring that they are delivered on time and within budget.
Drives successful projects by providing action-oriented analyses, optimization and a data-driven approach.




What's In It For You:

At Cox, we reward your hard work with meaningful benefits.

First, we offer a highly competitive compensation package, 401(k) with a generous company match, comprehensive healthcare, life, and disability benefits, plus numerous other benefits, including adoption assistance, pet insurance, and discounts on travel and cars!

We value people more than technology. That means you'll work within a culture and with a team that values your leadership, your experience, your contributions, and you - yes, you - as a person. We believe recognition is important, and Cox strives to celebrate those who help make us successful every day. We also encourage diversity and support inclusion; we want you to do you and feel comfortable doing so.

We also offer boundless opportunities for growth; you can sharpen your skills, learn a new talent, join a mentoring program, even earn an advanced degree. You'll find the potential for lateral or upward career growth within the Cox family businesses, including the innovative startups in transportation mobility, clean tech and more.

Who You Are:

Minimum



Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 4 years of experience in a related field (Marketing, Data Analytics or related field). The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master's degree and 2 years of experience, a Ph.D. and 1 year of experience or 8 years of experience in a related field with no degree.
Analytical/financial analysis background.
Strong multitasking, analytical and creative skills.
Self-starter with strong organizational, detail and follow-up skills.
Excellent interpersonal, leadership, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout the organization.
Demonstrated business acumen, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Develop framework to analyze effectiveness of offer recommendations, strategy rules and processes; provide insights to strategy teams for improvements.
Ability to translate and communicate complex analyses clearly and concisely.
Conducts business/strategy impact analyses, validations, and measurement through all stages from concept formulation, definition of metrics, determination of appropriate statistical methodology, research evaluation, and final presentation
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Deadline driven, ability to work with a sense of urgency.
Proficiency with quantitative tools including Excel and presentation tools such as PowerPoint and willingness to learn new tools that may be valuable to the team.
Continuous learner mindset.
Comfort setting direction and drawing insight from multiple (and often unclear) data sources.
Hands on experience with SQL.
Hands on experience with BI and dashboarding tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau, Power BI, or similar reporting tools.)




Preferred



Bachelor's degree in marketing, data analytics, engineering, computer science, economics, finance or similar analytical or technical field.
Telecommunications, cable industry, high tech, or consulting experience.
Familiarity with financial and data modeling techniques.
Interest in learning (or prior experience with) statistical analysis methods.
Strong knowledge of programming languages SQL, Python, R.
Experience working with Snowflake, AWS (Amazon Web Services) and/or ThoughtSpot.
Process management tools such as Airtable.

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience with data analysis and visualization, data pipelines, metrics.

Experience with reporting (e.g., dashboards), process analysis, and process improvement for human and automated processes.

Experience with networks and associated metrics (e.g., traffic, capacity).


Preferred qualifications:
Master's degree.

Knowledge of optical and IP networks worldwide operations.

Passion for trustworthy data, transparent metrics and making technical language accessible to the wider organization.

About the job

Within Network Delivery Engineering, the life-cycle engineering team is at the front of introducing new technology into Google networks and infrastructure. The mission to manage the deployment of new technology in production networks by enabling repeatable and scalable processes is accomplished by managing deployment readiness, sharing information with our peers and measuring introduction velocity against plans.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $136,000-$203,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. The Senior Analyst, Promotion Operations will lead analytics involving the U.S. Animal Health Business encompassing roughly $2B of revenue and over 30k customers. The individual will need to support the ED, Pricing and Promotions - in leading the Indirect Transaction Processing team on day-to-day processes, but also cover on ad hoc projects where needed. This role will act as a floor leader and interpret technical issues into business speak to help provide clarity to management on current issues and proposed solutions. The individual will be expected to identify potential cross team process opportunities which will increase efficiencies and accuracy across the business. The individual will be responsible for both written and verbal communications to the business and customers which will be customized to the recipient. As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development, and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in several ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking, and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees.

Duties & Responsibilities

Continuous Improvement / DELIVER & SEEK:

Follows and updates approved processes.
Provides input on opportunities to improve current processes and procedures.
Analyzes data and interprets trends.
Identifies potential issues via analysis to help avoid larger issues downstream.
Displays agility to run forensic analysis on ad hoc issues to identify root cause issues and solution.
Develops and reports on key operational performance measures to monitor processing level of effort, accuracy, and compliance.

Internal Control & Audit / INTEGRITY, DELIVERY & PROTECT:

Ensures adherence to risk control checklists, provides coordination and assistance for audits as they are performed.
Leads testing as needed.
Supports process audit activities as defined by supervisor.
Role model for the department when adhering to guidelines and compliance principles.
Maintains customer data files, both electronic and hard copy, and comply with corporate retention guidelines.
Collaborates with fellow Commercial Excellence teams to ensure accurate and timely execution of responsibilities.

CUSTOMER SUPPORT:

Provides guidance to coach fellow team members tasked with resolving customer issues and ad-hoc inquiries.
Provides information support and customer service within a timely manner.
Follows approved processes and executes day-to-day activities accurately and efficiently.
Builds business relationships to pro-actively identify potential issues that may impact customers before issues are identified by customers, improves technical expertise, and utilizes available resources in a rapidly changing business and systems environment.
Ensures experience through customer-based touch points undergoes constant improvement measures.
Serves user community and builds relationships to understand the business needs.
Acts as the subject matter expert, partnering with Commercial Excellence Support team to facilitate responses to various customer inquiries.
Coordinates and collaborates with internal partners (e.g., Marketing and sales) and external customers (e.g., distribution) to effectively perform tasks.

SYSTEM AND DATA ANALYSIS:

Provides understanding of systems and business data to management via support of technically advanced or escalated ad-hoc requests.
Designs sophisticated queries, builds technically advanced reports, and influencing the design scope for automated reports.
Validates completion and accuracy of information provided on fulfilled requests by team members.
Encourages team members to investigate potential enhancements to provide higher quality reporting deliverables.
Initiates projects to forensically investigate root causes and leads solution implementation of team members, management, and business stakeholders.
Coordinates research of business reported discrepancies to seek resolution of issues.
Develops ad hoc reporting to evaluate potential process improvement opportunities and establish new ways of working to promote operational efficiencies.
Serves as a Key User for the Vistex System.

Additional Duties and Responsibilities

COMMUNICATION:

Communicates effectively with team members, management, high-profile customers and business stakeholders.
Shares experience and knowledge of tools, systems, and internal solutions resources with team members to improve communication channel effectiveness to exceed customer expectations.
Understands dynamic customer challenges and identifies effective solutions to pro-actively address customer, marketing and sales opportunities.
Directs team members to appropriate support resource for issue resolution to enable timely solution to customer challenges.
Ensures that existing processes and supporting documentation is kept current, readily available and leveraged in the day-to-day activities of the team members or for potential audit.
Professionally communicates and collaborates with fellow Commercial Excellence team members, internal business partners, sales managers, marketing teams, external data vendors and distributor channel partners as it relates to sensitive customer, sales and/or pricing/promotion information.
Develops and maintains good working relationship with external business partners to support our mutual customers and facilitate issue resolution as needed.

PROJECT SUPPORT:

Leads projects and encourages team member contribution that effectively supports task enhancement of varied size and complexity to achieve overall objectives.
Delivers assignments on time, with quality, across multiple priorities.
Promotes agility mindset to ensure that project progresses effectively.
Leads testing initiative and ensures quality assurances are met, and verifies information, calculations or transaction data is accurate and due diligence is achieved.
Participates on strategic projects or sub-teams as needed to execute objectives.
Demonstrates core process knowledge to perform activities and cross-checking activities to ensure high-quality deliverables are created.
Recommends process improvements, system enhancements and bug fixes to gain efficiencies in Vistex.
Launches new system functionality release cycles with IT, GBS and other groups as appropriate.
Provides and maintains process and system documentation to include integration with other systems.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
Five to seven (5-7) years progressive experience in IT, Marketing, Administrative, Finance, Accounting, Customer Service and/or relevant business experience.
Advanced ability to make quick decisions and prioritize for self and junior team members.
Strong communications skills.
Ability to customize communications both verbally and written for respective recipients.
Ability to lead without authority.
Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize and balance multiple tasks simultaneously.
Expert analytical skills with very high capacity to translate data to the needs of the respective stakeholder.
Evidence of a focus on Continuous Process Improvement for use in problem solving of software issues, pricing / program calculations, and process flows.
Demonstrated understanding of the push/pull model behind discounts and rebates strategy, as well as the legal and compliance risks associated with such programs.
Process oriented individual with strong problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated understanding and ability to apply principles, concepts, practices, and standards including knowledge and use of Animal Health data with willingness to stay current on business and industry.
Ability to extract and manipulate data from multiple data sources (i.e., SQL databases, delimited text files, Excel, Access, etc.) and integrate them into a single source view/report.
Advanced report development and analytical skills using Excel including the ability to utilize functions is required.
Previous knowledge of reporting and data visualization applications such as Cognos, Tableau or Qlik highly preferred.
Strong working knowledge of databases, data extraction (SQL) and master data management practices required. Experience in Oracle, ModelN, GBSMDGx, SAP ERP, SAP S/4HANA environments highly preferred.

Experience and aptitude in subjects including distributor channel sales, inventory, transaction processing, contract pricing, rebate programs, incentive compensation, master data management and data stewardship practices highly preferred

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction.
Must be willing to take a drug test and post-offer physical (if required).

Must be 18 years of age or older.

Organization performance management
Data analysis and visualization
Special strategy and projects and analytics
Perform other duties as assigned

Strong project management capabilities with excellent reporting and dashboard development and data management

Business Intelligence and Automation Analyst (BI Analyst)




Find your more with Mohawk!


At Mohawk Industries, we’re committed to more – more customer solutions, more process improvements, more sustainable manufacturing, and more opportunities for our people.





As a Fortune 500, global flooring leader with some of the best-known brands in the industry, Mohawk is a great place to start or develop your career with an emphasis on more of what’s important to you. Come find your “more” with Mohawk!




What we need:




Mohawk is looking for BI and Automation Engineer to develop automation, analytics and BI solutions for our North American Customer Experience team.




This role will perform statistical analysis using data from multiple sources, utilizing Python, R and/or Power Automate to automate highly manual and error-prone process to improve downstream execution, reduce process variation, improve reliability of data, and reduce back office waste. The BI and Automation Engineer will also create visualization tools and dashboards to guide business decisions.




What you’ll do:




Design, develop and maintain scalable, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc.

Write high quality SQL code to retrieve and analyze data from database tables

Work hands-on with BI technologies/data warehousing like SAP Analytics Cloud, Power BI, Microsoft SSAS, SAP BusinessObjects suite, SAP HANA, IBM DB2

Maintain and add to existing automation framework for Data, API, Web and other applications

Develop and execute comprehensive suites of automation test plans, test cases for inclusion in regression, automation for newly integrated features, and development of tool sets to augment QA and Development testing

Reduce the IS development teams’ effort of CX system enhancements by supplying queries, procedures and testers in small scrum teams to deliver high quality products in a timely and cost-effective manner




What you have:




Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics or related field

1+ years of experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational/business planning

Experience in a data engineer or BIE role with a technology company (preferred)

Experience with Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), SAP ECC, MS Azure and with SAP C4/HANA (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Commerce Cloud, Customer Data Cloud) (preferred)

OR a combination of education and experience equivalent to the above

Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets and analysis to support business decision making




What you’re good at:




Exercising independent judgment and demonstrating solid time management and organizational skills, including the ability to meet tight deadlines and schedules

Communicating and negotiating effectively with internal and external customers

Working collaboratively as part of a fast-paced team, with strong personal organization, poise and professionalism

Coding in modern programming language (Python, R, Java, JavaScript, C#, etc.)

Writing and tuning SQL scripts

Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems




What else?




While we’re a primarily in-office team, we thrive on flexibility and ensuring our people can balance personal and professional time

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Mohawk’s vertically integrated manufacturing and distribution processes provide competitive advantages in the production of carpet, rugs, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone and vinyl flooring. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy all remodeling and new construction requirements. Our brands are among the most recognized in the industry and include American Olean, Daltile, Durkan, IVC, Karastan, Marazzi, Mohawk, Mohawk Home, Pergo, and Quick-Step. During the past decade, Mohawk has transformed its business from an American carpet manufacturer into the world’s largest flooring company with operations in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Europe, India, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Russia and the United States.

Job Title: Office of Equipment Management-GSP131 -Business Support Analyst 2, (PG-K) 7565 Honeycreek Ct Lithonia GA 30038
Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY: Under general supervision, performs complex administrative duties and statistical, financial, or operational data analysis and reporting in support of management decision making in functional area. Identifies trends, discrepancies, and variances to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of operations. May partner with other departments, divisions, outside agencies, and vendors to address business issues. Exercises various latitudes of independent judgment. May administer or provide high level support for various projects, grants, contracts, implementation of procedures, and/or any specialized functions. Assists with orientation, training, or providing task guidance of junior team members.




JOB SPECIFIC DUTIES: Under general supervision, serves as the project coordinator for the Department's fleet management program. Assists in planning, directing and managing activities for the unit responsible for performing daily system administration duties in support of the Department's fleet management/cost accounting software application. Creates and analyses reports/queries and researches the underlying source data. Assists and prepares business practice changes. Researches and analyzes system/user problems by applying a variety of analytical and research techniques. Develops and evaluates solutions to improve service and efficiency of the software application. Assists with developing, conveying and implementing standards, policies, and procedures to be used in the development of new and/or enhancements to existing software applications.




MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

The selected candidate must meet the advertised minimum qualifications to include State Entry Qualifications as well as Agency Specific Minimum Qualifications




STATE ENTRY QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree in business or related field from an accredited college or university AND Two years of experience related to area of assignment.
Note: An equivalent combination of education and job specific experience that provided the knowledge, experience and competencies required to successfully perform the job at the level listed may be substituted on a year-over-year basis.



AGENCY MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Demonstrated knowledge of policies and procedures governing fleet management and inventory control.
Demonstrated knowledge in the use of fleet management/cost accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite applications with special focus on advanced Excel and Access functions.
Possesses strong oral communication skills; able to express ideas and facts to individuals or groups effectively.
Ability to identify and analyze problems using sound judgment to develop effective solutions.
Displays a high level of commitment toward work and a high standard of ethical conduct.
Demonstrated ability to read, interpret, and explain manuals and program documentation; write and prepare reports, presentations, and correspondence.
Demonstrated ability to consistently deliver responses, reports and other requested data on time and within budget.
Committed to providing quality customer service.



AGENCY PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience with GAMS or similar asset management software.
Demonstrated knowledge of PeopleSoft Financials or similar accounting software.
Demonstrated experience in writing and using SQL scripts and/or programming of VBA macros.
Ability to effectively communicate with end users in the business unit.
Demonstrated knowledge of equipment management processes.
Demonstrated knowledge in procurement policies and procedures.
Demonstrated experience in the implementation of new software applications.
Government experience in a similar professional working environment.

At Kids2, we’re really good at what we do. And when we’re great at our jobs, we help parents be great at their jobs.
Parenting is demanding, and that’s where we come in. We want to reimagine how brands can make it easier for early stage parents – not by just selling them products, but by providing holistic solutions that transcend borders, categories and aisles.
No matter our title or department, at Kids2, our job is to create more tiny wins for parents, so they can create bright futures for their little ones. That’s a big task!
We’re serious about what we do, AND we love to have fun. Our team is hardworking, entrepreneurial, and passionate about helping families create millions, if not billions of tiny wins.
SUMMARY
Support the Account Team to drive sales and long-term initiatives with customer interaction and communication. The sales analyst provides sales reporting and data analytics for the account team to drive key decision making and success measurement of the business relative to sales. The Sales Analyst creates and maintains weekly and monthly reports regarding sales trends including point of sale data and customer inventory metrics. Sales Analysts play a key role in the monthly forecast consensus process by providing key inputs to the forecast. The Sales Analyst is expected to maintain the account business plan and provide forecast and planning guidance to the sales and demand teams based on the most up to date data and customer intelligence.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Holistically support account team with data, reporting and regular analysis to identify and execute business opportunities
Maintenance of the account business plans for account responsibilities
Weekly reporting/tracking using customer POS data: Sales, Inventory, Promotions, New Items, etc
Prepare monthly segment trend, competitive analysis, and promotional analysis along with insights using POS and syndicated data
Generate item level and account-level forecasts for assigned accounts
Review forecast exceptions weekly to ensure forecast and orders are in-sync
Work with sales managers to ensure all set quantities, promotions, item expansions and exits are captured in the forecast
Generate trend reports and analysis to help determine changes to replenishment strategies, determine necessary forecast changes, and recommend changes to the assortment as necessary
Review and compare customer forecast and Kids2 forecast to identify key differences, determine reasons for differences, and drive to a consensus forecast
Interaction, Communication, and Collaboration with the account (Buyer, Replenishment team, Inventory Analyst)
Monitor and influence demand forecast for account responsibilities
Gather and analyze data to understand problems and address them proactively
Provide Ad-hoc support and analysis as needed
Maintain technical skills on appropriate software applications to provide optimum level of support
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Retail and Analytics experience preferred
Demonstrates ability to analyze data and make appropriate recommendations
Demonstrates business curiosity, drive for results and learning on the fly
Advanced Excel experience with pivot tables, graphs, and reporting
EDUCATION & SKILLS
4-year college degree in business, engineering, or related field
English-conversational and writing
Retail Link and other retail portals
High level of organization and detail-orientation
Plans and manages effectively.
Critical thinking and problem solving
Focuses on the customer.
Communication: Internal and external
Excellent communication skills and working with cross functional groups and customer
Ability to consult with account teams and proactively identify appropriate
Communicate and work collaboratively internally and customer
Demonstrated ability to work independently
Service oriented
Learning agility
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
None required.
COMPUTER/TYPING SKILLS
Must be proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; have flexible use of hands; and talk or hear.
The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and color vision.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
General office environment.
We offer competitive pay, flexible hours, and generous benefits. Plus, to keep things fun (because we are all kids at heart), we offer a host of team member activities and philanthropic efforts throughout the year and company-wide awards and recognition for a job well done!
Check out our website at www.kids2.com and our social media pages on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram for more information and open positions in the career section.

As a leading regional bank, SouthState has been providing financial solutions to individuals, families, and businesses in the Southeast for more than 100 years.

SouthState team members strive to create remarkable experiences while building meaningful and lasting relationships. We are proud to reflect the communities we serve, and our team members share core values that make SouthState a great place to bank, and a great place to work.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

It is the responsibility of the Asset Based Lending Sales Associate/Analyst to take ownership of all tasks and challenges that they encounter in the operation of their assigned position.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Asset Based Sales Associate/Analyst will be responsible for assisting business development, underwriting and relationship management teams in sourcing, underwriting and management of bilateral and syndicated asset-based credit facilities of $10.0 million and above.

Assist Origination and Underwriting teams by spreading financial statements and determining risk ratings using bank software or templates and preparing projections models to help analyze and structure loans.

Assist Origination and Underwriting teams by creating and updating loan request in the Bank’s loan production software.

Assist Relationship team by monitoring and analyzing operating/financial performance and collateral trends using financial statements, field exams, and appraisals and create.

Assist Relationship team by updating loan requests for existing customers in the Bank’s loan production software.

Provide industry research and create and update prospect and client information in various proprietary databases.

The duties and responsibilities listed above may be revised at any time within the sole discretion of the bank without advance notice to or the consent of the employee.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements

Education : B.A. Degree Required; Degree in Finance, Accounting, or Business preferred.

Experience : A minimum of 2 years of experience in Commercial Lending is required.

Certifications/Specific Knowledge : Strong analytical and quantitative skills, good understanding of financial statements, strong interpersonal skills, attention to detail, strong Excel and basic modelling skills.

TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES

Required annual compliance training, New Employee Orientation

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

WORK ENVIRONMENT

This position will have a dedicated working space at South State premises.

TRAVEL

Travel may be required to visit customer and attend meetings as needed.

Job Overview:

Operations Compliance Analyst- Atlanta, GA


As a Operations Compliance Analyst, you will work under the guidance of the Sr. Director of Operations to facilitate the auditing of compliance controls across our regional branches. Your role will be instrumental in auditing existing processes to enhance regulatory compliance, minimize inventory loss, ensure adherence to DOT and OSHA regulations, maintain robust financial controls, and promote a secure and safe workplace for our dedicated employees.


Position Responsibilities:

Regulatory Compliance Management: Partner closely with the SOM, Sales, Finance, Fleet & Safety departments to jointly develop, execute, and sustain comprehensive compliance programs and policies. Ensure alignment with regulatory standards such as OSHA, FDA, and DOT.
Regulatory Assessment: Conduct periodic assessments to evaluate the extent to which key compliance processes are adhered to in the daily operations of the distribution center..
Monitoring and Auditing: Conduct routine audits and assessments to track compliance levels, identify areas of improvement, and implement corrective actions as needed.
Data and Reporting: Process, identify, and maintain audit findings, documentation, & trending data. Publish weekly compliance scorecard to highlight finds and update MAPs
Training and Education: Organize and deliver training sessions to employees and management teams to raise awareness and understanding of compliance requirements.
Document Management: Establish and maintain an efficient filing system for all correspondence, records, reference data, reports, and sensitive documents for their respective locations
Requirements:
Proven experience in regulatory compliance, preferably in a facilities or distribution center setting.
Familiarity with OSHA, EPA, FDA, DOT, LEED, and other applicable regulations.
Strong organizational and communication skills.
Attention to detail and ability to manage complex documentation.
Proficiency in MS Office, SAP (database management) and reporting tools.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team.
Total Rewards:
Actual placement within the compensation range may vary depending on experience, skills, and other factors
Benefits, subject to election and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Paid Time Off (including paid parental leave, vacation, and sick time), 401k with company match, Tuition Reimbursement, and Mileage Reimbursement

ABOUT THIS POSITION
The PCS Business Integration Analyst is the link between Product, Client Success and Development with the goal of providing superior service and support to the various stakeholders responsible for the various Waystar Robotic Process Automation (RPA) product lines.

Utilizing the knowledge of the authorization and referrals verification process and the rules required by the various health plans, the PCS Authorization Business Analyst applies business analysis techniques, tools and common templates to ensure timely and thorough resolutions of all received requests; performs analysis and troubleshooting to identify and correct root causes; and when applicable, delivers business requirements, processes, and/or instructions in a clear and coherent manner to the appropriate stakeholder(s).

The PCS Business Integration Analyst serves as a subject matter expert and helps define and set team strategy to effectively deliver superior service and support up through the department and out to the appropriate stakeholders.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Performs business analysis activities, such as requirements analysis, creation of use cases and business rules consistent with workflow requirements of Waystar's Health Systems & Hospital clients.
Draws on real-world experience and maintains a working knowledge of health plan authorization and referral requirements.
Applies functional knowledge of ANSI 278, 276/277, 270/271 transaction sets to optimize the design, testing and implementation of defined business requirements associated with RPA, API and EDI based solutions.
Collaborates with Product, Client Success, Technology and/or other departments regarding Robotic Process Automation (RPA), API and EDI related inquiries, activities and business issues.
Performs data analysis and troubleshooting of application issues and business user concerns to identify and correct root causes.
Draws on real-world experience and maintains a working knowledge of health plan authorization and referral requirements.
Applies functional knowledge of ANSI 278, 276/277, 270/271 transaction sets to optimize the design, testing and implementation of defined business requirements associated with RPA, API and EDI based solutions.
Translates business requirements into detailed requirement specifications and use cases.
Drives integration through collaboration with various stakeholders in the recommendation, and implementation of enhanced and/or new business processes.
Acts as liaison between various stakeholders and Development to address questions/issues.
Must be a self-starter, be able to set priorities and back other team members when required.
Works team-driven department, cross-department and various sized projects, independent of supervision.
Executes within defined SLA parameters according to Waystar application and client requirements.
Serves as a subject matter expert and leverages that knowledge in the decision-making process.
Helps define and set team strategy to effectively deliver superior service and support up through the department and out to the appropriate stakeholders.
WHAT YOU'LL NEED
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field and/or equivalent relevant work experience.
5+ years of business analysis, or Healthcare industry healthcare support/operations experience.
In-depth knowledge of Prior Authorization or Referrals. Claims Status and Eligibility processing experience a plus.
Experience with the prior authorizations and referrals process, along with the benefits verification and insurance rules required by the various health plans.
Detailed knowledge of ANSI 5010 278, 276/277, 270/271, 837P, and 835, files
Experience in medical billing and revenue cycle management. Healthcare Back Office experience in Revenue Coding, Reason/Remark Codes or reconciling pending claims with Payers a plus.
Experience navigating commercial insurance portals such as United Healthcare, Availity, and Navinet in the submitting, review and management of prior authorizations and referrals. Experience with RPA (Robotic Process Automation) of these transactions a plus.
Preferred Skills:
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work well both independently and in a te am environment.
Willingness to learn new skills & tools.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation abilities.
Proficiency in Excel.
ABOUT WAYSTAR
Through a smart platform and better experience, Waystar helps providers simplify healthcare payments and yield powerful results throughout the complete revenue cycle.
Waystar’s healthcare payments platform combines innovative, cloud-based technology, robust data, and unparalleled client support to streamline workflows and improve financials so providers can focus on what matters most: their patients and communities. Waystar is trusted by 1M+ providers, 1K+ hospitals and health systems, and is connected to over 5K commercial and Medicaid/Medicare payers. We are deeply committed to living out our organizational values: honesty; kindness; passion; curiosity; fanatical focus; best work, always; making it happen; and joyful,
Waystar products have won multiple Best in KLAS® or Category Leader awards since 2010 and earned multiple #1 rankings from Black Book™ surveys since 2012. The Waystar platform supports more than 500,000 providers, 1,000 health systems and hospitals, and 5,000 payers and health plans. For more information, visit
waystar.com

@Waystar

Company Name: The Housing Authority of the City of Atlanta (AHA)
Job Description:
Department: Real Estate Asset & Property Management
Position Title: Property Operations Analyst
Reports to: SVP, Asset & Property management
Salary grade: N



Position Summary:

Responsible for providing guidance and subject matter expertise on HUD Regulations and Atlanta Housing (AH) policies for an assigned mixed income real estate housing portfolio. Performing all functions with respect to data collection and reporting, documentation review, data validation for property and tenant household information, cross-referencing and compiling records, checking accuracy of payment schedules, preparing reports, and conducting other assigned portfolio management tasks.



Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Provides compliance guidance to partners through quarterly refresher trainings onsite and occasionally offsite
Conducts Business Process Reviews to monitor and analyze property performance to determine adherence with HUD Regulations, AH Policies, and partner’s Management
Plan. Disseminates, tracks, and analyzes 50058 Error Reports and work with properties to ensure errors are properly corrected
Provides guidance to new partners for understanding and implementation of the PBV- HomeFlex Program
Travel to community to assist with the intake, determining eligibility and processing of applications when needed
Coordinates with the AH’s IT Team and Data Team to obtain AH Management Portal, HUD-EIV and SAVE Access
Coordinates with Contracts and Procurement & Acquisition Management Services to set up new vendors for payment
Monitors, tracks and notifies AMS when there are vendor changes/update
Collaborates with the QC Compliance Team, Asset Management team, PBV Subsidy Program Manager and Information Technology to grant, update, and deactivate EIV,
Uploads monthly payment applications to the Asset Management portal. Notifies partners the payment applications are ready for review and update of adjustment. Reviews and reconciles monthly payment applications with previous payment application to ensure rent amounts and the number of PBV units being paid are in accordance with the PBV-HomeFlex Agreement. Processes adjustments for New Admissions, Annual Recertifications, Interim Recertifications, Unit Transfers, and End of Participations. Verifies 50058’s have been submitted to support adjustments reflected on Schedule B. Follows up with partners to discuss any discrepancies found during the quality review of payment applications. Ensures Schedule B adjustments reflect changes in occupancy on the rent rolls and 50058 submissions
Collaborates with internal partners such as Finance, Real Estate Development, and Housing Choice Voucher Program and Finance (REIF) to ensure accurate and timely payments to partners, assist Portfolio Managers in resolving issues that arise with the portfolio, and provide Portfolio Managers with current operational and compliance data for assigned portfolio
Assist the Property Compliance operations with conducting Business Process Reviews as needed, distributing HUD 50058s reports to partners, and ensuring that 50058 errors are corrected
Inspections, provide inspectors with PBV unit numbers, coordinate the scheduling of PBV inspections, generate inspection notification letters and distribute summary reports to partners; Policy and Strategy, to collect and review quarterly Supportive Housing reports for accuracy and completeness; and Information Technology (IT) to set-up new property folders on the Asset Management Portal and grant portal log-in access.
Tracks property and resident issues reported to AH. Works with Partners to facilitate and ensure a successful and timely resolution.
Collaborates with the PBV Subsidy Program Manager and QC Compliance Team to ensure the successful on-boarding of new properties; provides feedback on site-based waiting list advertisements, obtains property unit listing from Partner, assist with the creation of the PBV payment application and 50058 templates, vendor set-up, and assists with granting EIV and SAVE access as well Asset Management Portal access

Knowledge and Skill Requirements

Work requires independent decision-making, judgment, communication and organizational skills
Ability to recognize process issues, collect data, establish facts, research and compare variances, and draw valid conclusions
Strong attention to detail. Excellent time management and organizational skills
Advanced Microsoft Excel, Access, Word, and Outlook skills required
Ability to effectively investigate, analyze and problem solv.
Remain consistent in delivering positive results, following tasks through from start to finish
Proven ability to effectively engage in continuous improvement of processes, procedures and protocols

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in public policy, real estate, subsidized housing, business or related field.
Five (5) or more years of progressively responsible experience in real estate administration and/or HUD regulatory Compliance. PIC 50058 reporting is a plus.
Certified Occupancy Specialist Certification or equivalent preferred.

Working Conditions:

Works in an office environment. May require frequent bending, stooping, reaching and prolonged sitting and/or standing. May occasionally require work at AH project site to support events and community engagement. May require regular lifting usually not exceeding 15 lbs. May be required to have a valid State of Georgia driver's license and be fully insurable for the purpose of obtaining clearance on company "Authorized Drivers List".

Job Title: Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Job Description:
Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Work Location: Atlanta, GA
Employment Type: Full-time regular
Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding environment where you will work alongside the industry’s best and most talented, with the opportunity to have a front row seat in planning analyses and decisions for the public and private sector? If so, you have found the perfect opportunity! Walker Consultants is seeking a seasoned individual to assist our planning, operations, and technology practice as we serve our clients throughout our southeast US market share. Our services apply decades of best practices that enhance the users’ experiences and advance the owners’ goals.
Our primary objectives always focus on achieving the following:
Make it easier for people to reach their destinations
Support and encourage transportation mode of choice
Optimize parking and transportation customer service and bottom lines
Improve quality of lives through economic growth and built environments that work for people
Perform due diligence services helping gauge market risk and upside potential
Responsibilities
At this continuing developmental level, this role performs:
Conduct extensive research and analyze data in specific or general parking, mobility, and transit areas using a variety of methods.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Write and present formal and technical reports, working papers, and correspondence.
Identify common problems, issues, and opportunities based on observation, research, and data analysis.
Develop strategies, actions, and projects to address identified issues consistent with community goals, best practices/standards, and applicable regulations.
Develop recommendations and implementation strategies.
Prepare information (i.e. project fact sheets, display boards, slides, online platforms, etc.) to explain projects to and gather input from stakeholders and the public.
Work with and communicate effectively with a broad range of team members, clients, review agencies, and others as appropriate for a range of project types.
Participate in a range of challenging parking, mobility, and transit projects including strategic urban plans, corridor and curb management studies, feasibility studies, and alternative analyses.
Support development of planning, operations, and technology documents with a primary focus on research, data collection, field assessment, data analysis, mapping, writing, and editing reports.
Prepare information to explain projects clearly and succinctly to stakeholders and public, as well as gather feedback and input from community members and stakeholders.
Assist with coordinating projects among team members, clients, and external consultants.
Communicate and interact with team members, clients, and review agencies.
10% travel required - overnight and air travel to client sites.
Qualifications
Two years demonstrated proficiency as an entry-level analyst or planner, or
Master’s degree in business, marketing, planning, architecture, engineering, or other degree appropriate to the area of concentration (mobility and parking planning, parking operations, parking technology, etc.), or
Five years transferable experience in parking, mobility and transportation industry, and
Appropriate verbal, writing, analytical and/or software skills for the specialty area.

Benefits of Joining Walker
As a skilled member of the Walker family, you will be given the opportunity to grow and develop your skills surrounded by committed, talented and enthusiastic co-workers. In addition to competitive compensation, as a full-time employee, Walker offers vacation retreats, tuition and professional certification reimbursement, professional organization membership reimbursement, 401(k) match and HSA employer contribution, commuter benefit accounts, medical, dental, vision insurance, flexible work schedules, and more!
Who We Are
Walker is a 100% employee-owned company of many capabilities offering professional services to clients in the private and public market sectors. Walker maintains a strong foundation as an industry leader in all aspects of parking planning, design, engineering, restoration, and consulting that encompass operations, technology, and mobility solutions engaging a wide spectrum of specialists and renowned experts who have been advancing standards in the industry for several decades.
Walker works collaboratively as a national team to provide sustainable planning and transportation solutions. From small towns to large urban metros and transit agencies, we help our clients build communities that are places people want to live, work, and have fun. For every project, we develop creative strategies that both put people first and are rooted in data and in line with overall goals for transportation, economic development, climate, and land use. We are focused on the future, and our plans and policies are shaped by technology, data, and infrastructure that optimize current and future investments.
You’ll join a dedicated team working with a variety of clients (cities, transit agencies, metropolitan planning organizations, hospitals, airports, universities, developers, and others) on cutting edge projects to plan for the future of transit, manage curb space, and provide more sustainable mobility options for people. This includes planning transit around a system of solar microgrids to power electric bus fleets and local resiliency/mobility hubs.
You’ll have an opportunity to directly test ideas, shape policy, and see your plans implemented. At Walker we go beyond planning, we guide implementation.
Walker Consultants is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We invite all qualified applicants to apply and do not discriminate against individuals because of their race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or age.

What You Will Do:
Imagine, define, analyze, and document product vison, requirement and effectively communicate to management, business, and technical staff.
Manage, track and report product line or product feature performance throughout its lifecycle including product strategy, product planning and issue prioritization.
Coordinate product priority decisions in concert with cross-functional teams
Coordinate internal and external product communication and information across product line and partner organizations.
Manage product development process inclusive of product commercialization tasks required to bring product to market.
Manage product development and improvements including road map and statement of direction across product line.
Manage issues throughout the product development process including problem identification, root cause analysis, and partner communication.
Act as a primary negotiator between internal departments and clients to resolve issues.
Serve as product expert and liaison to Sales.
Consumer interface in the education and enrollment of consumers into the new product programs
Partners with Tech to create business requirements.
Ability to conduct and document gap analysis.
Be in frequent contact with internal and external customers.


Skills and Experience You Will Need:
Required
Minimum 6 years’ experience in Technical Operations, Business Analyst, Project Management or Product Management.
Prior experience in negotiations, vendor and project management required.
Experience with market analysis, writing user stories, triaging defects and testing.
Communicate technical concepts and requirements clearly to both IT and business resources.
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Payments related experience.
Desired:
In-depth knowledge of card brand regulations, including PCI.
Experience as a SaFe Agilist
Education:
High School graduate/GED (Bachelor's degree desired)
Who We Are:
About GalaxE.Solutions
GalaxE is a professional IT services firm that specializes in platform-driven solutions and the use of automation to achieve enterprise business transformation and mission-critical change for some of the largest companies in the world. Using our proprietary solution set, GxFource®, we apply machine learning techniques and predictive analytics tools as part of a broad artificial intelligence strategy that provides effective impact and data-driven business transformation.


Since its founding, GalaxE has been dedicated to advancing the benefits of technology. As we continue that legacy and look to the future, a focus on business enablement through agile, cost-efficient, and effective integration of people, process, and technology anchors our success. We revolutionize change in the costs of doing business that transform companies and their ability to leap beyond the competition.

At GalaxE we value people and are committed to diversity and inclusion where our employees are made to feel comfortable and are encouraged to be authentic. We focus on cultivating both traditional IT and non-traditional, new collar, workers through our Outsource to America®, program.

Working with like-minded team members you will get a chance to discover, develop, and use cutting-edge technologies to transform the way we deliver creative business solutions.

Sound like you? Join us and find out for yourself what it means for you, and your career, to be part of the GalaxE team. Let’s build something, together. #WeAreGalaxE

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a fintech client looking for a Business Data Analyst. This role is 100% remote but requires candidates to work East Coast hours.

Duties:

Business Data Analyst will be responsible for helping define and set up sustainable and customized measurement strategies, liaise across teams, create dashboards and necessary connections with existing tooling to help us demonstrate success via data-driven insights
Outputs Expected: Determine the story in the data to create and present relevant findings, analysis and recommendations that drive business outcomes through improved customer experience
Design and execute complementary feedback strategies to support stakeholder needs and improve the quality of learner feedback while being mindful of feedback fatigue; Methods include short-term/long-term surveys, group feedback sessions, etc.
As a Business Data Analyst, you will create standardized and customized reporting for business stakeholders in the form of dashboards (Qualtrics, Looker, Google Forms, etc.), scorecards, and presentations for synthesized reports
Act as SME for needs assessments, sentiment data, and individual team/performance metrics among leadership, stakeholders, and other research teams to help enable customer-centric decisions
REQUIREMENTS:

BS or MS degree in an appropriate quantitative field (Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Econometrics, Operations Research)
1-2 years of data analysis experience
Dashboarding (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Customer data collection tools (Google Analytics, Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Qualtrics, Amplitude, BigQuery, Looker, Tableau, session replay, etc.)
The successful candidate will be an expert in customer analytics and survey research; This role is perfect for someone who is empathetic, able to see situations from the customer's perspective, and a wizard with data
The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

LMI Tech Systems is looking to bring new talent to our fast-growing TaaS PAK (Technology as a Service) division. As a TaaS Pak Sales & Senior Research Analyst (SRA) your role will revolve around the ability to meet face to face and build FAST relationships with clients, PRESENT our exceptional services, and CLOSE your clients on the spot. Working directly with Georgia’s small and midsize business owners (SMBs), you will present our innovative technology solutions and solve the client’s technology pain points.

Benefits of a TaaS PAK SRA:

Excellent pay plan with no cap.
A long-term career with upward mobility.
Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance.
An exciting team atmosphere.
Working with other experienced, professional closers and award-winning tech staff members.
In-depth training of all tech services offered and our LMI sales procedures.

As an SRA, your role will involve direct engagement with business owners. Your responsibilities will include gathering essential information about their current business technology, inputting this data into our digital Technology Cost Analysis worksheets, and subsequently presenting the completed Technology Cost Analyses and tailored solutions to the business owner(s). Your ability to effectively communicate these solutions will be critical, as you'll also be responsible for closing each prospect during the same visit.

Candidates must be personable, have excellent communications skills, enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, be a self-starter and, above all, must be able to give powerful presentations and close the prospect! We are looking for a salesperson from within the tech industry. Knowledge of SMB technology is a must. Knowledge of closing prospects is a must. WE WANT TECH PEOPLE THAT ARE REAL CLOSERS and know how to ASK FOR THE MONEY.

If you are interested in an excellent career, working with a financially strong and committed company, and being rewarded for what you do, then we want to meet you.

Job Type: Full-time employee.

Compensation: Weekly salary plus commission, car allowance, phone allowance.

Must have excellent transportation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Compensation package:

Commission pay

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
No nights
No weekends

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

It is the responsibility of the Small Business Sales and Marketing Analyst to take ownership of all tasks and challenges that are encountered in the operation of their assigned position. This position is responsible for, but not limited to, assisting the Retail Area Managers (RAM) by providing sales resources, training, and support to the Small Business Bankers (SBB) and Branch Managers (BM) tasked with serving the small business relationships in our communities. This position also manages, builds, and leads small business marketing efforts in collaboration with the Marketing Team, to include social media efforts. This position is a partner to the Consumer and Small Business Banking Leadership Team and specifically partners with Retail Area Managers.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

This position is expected to perform the specific duties, tasks, and responsibilities as outlined below:

Assist the RAMs in providing small business sales resources and support to the Small Business Bankers and Branch Managers

o Provides ongoing prospecting lists- mines data from various sources including S&P Global, Vertical IQ, web, host, social, etc., and provides prospecting leadership to SBB & BM groups

o Branch Reporting- provides branch portfolio reporting and identification of opportunities to grow existing small business relationships

o Relationship Sales Coaching- provides group and one-on-one sales coaching/training

o Advanced Online/Digital Relationship Sales Training- provides group and one-on-one digital relationship prospecting & training

Manage the Online “Contact Us” / Leads Process for Small Business Banking

o Customer Experience- provide an efficient and remarkable customer experience by managing our ‘contact us’ leads process

o Lead Process Mgt.- track and report on Lead > Opportunities > Approvals > Closings Data

o Small Business Loan Application Process- develop, implement, and continuously manage the process flow for Online Small Business Loan Applications

Work with MarCom on ongoing Small Business Projects

o Small Business Content Strategy- develop, implement, & manage content strategy

o Small Business Relationships- develop, implement & manage onboarding process

o Website Management and Enhancements

o Small Business Newsletter- develop, implement, & manage

o Small Business Podcast- develop, implement, & manage

Manage the Strategy for integrating the Digital and In-Person Marketing and Sales Efforts for Small Business

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

COMPETENCIES


Sales and Marketing Management experience
Digital marketing experience
Financial Services, banking product knowledge & competition acumen
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to lead and motivate others
Excellent leadership skills
Ability to manage multiple requests simultaneously
Strong analytical skills with the ability to work under deadlines
Ability to organize and pay close attention to detail
Familiarity with e-mail systems, Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and basic personal computer skills
QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION, AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS


Education : Bachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.S.) from four-year college or university
Experience : 5-10 years relevant work experience and/or training, especially in Small Business Banking and/or Marketing; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Certifications/Specific Knowledge : None
TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES

Required annual compliance training, New Employee Orientation

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, reports. This position requires a large amount of time in front of a computer. This can be done sitting or standing with use of the right desk.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Telecommuting roles, no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting, must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. They must also have a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered.

TRAVEL

Travel may be required to attend meetings, conference and training as needed.
