Job Title
Business Analyst III - Pricing
Position Overview
This position is focused on pricing analysis, administration and support of pricing enablement tools, applications, and infrastructure. The position will be involved in the maintenance of the business-specific data. This person will partner with Category, Channel, and Sales Leadership to provide specialized analysis and insights to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies. The role will provide user support and help define future system enhancements assisting the Residential Division use application(s) to achieve a strategic advantage.
Essential Duties:
Use mathematical analysis to track pricing trends.
Perform margin and pricing analysis to support business initiatives.
Identifies opportunities to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies.
Ensure pricing automation systems operation for all business users.
Work with the IS Development team on a regular basis to administrate enhancements and bug fixes.
Liaison with Salesforce.com premier support on a regular basis to manage open cases and ensure the best use of resources.
Enforcement of business rules. This will require the monitoring of data entered into the system and following up with users regarding problems and/or business rules.
Lead and manage requirements, testing, and implementation of system and/or process improvements affecting sales automation systems.
Serve as business analyst to administer, implement and maintain price lists and price agreements in collaboration with product, channel, and sales leadership.
Maintain and support control of core pricing automation system functionally including data management, basic system and configuration.
Analyze systematic issues as reported by users and/or identified through testing to determine root cause, business issue, data challenges and recommendations for resolution.
Other Duties:
Assist other departments necessary to implement action plan(s)
Ability to make sound decisions based on customer, company, and employee needs
Perform other duties as assigned by manager
Position Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, accounting, statistics, marketing, or finance or 5+ years of experience with pricing and/or sales operations.
5+ years of Business Intelligence experience in complex report development, advanced knowledge of relational databased, SQL, query tools (Teradata SWL Assistant, AQT, Crystal, Business Objects Enterprise).
Excellent business requirement definition skills.
Strong practical understanding of systems, databases and database terminology.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications; high level in Excel.
Sound analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot / problem solve with internal and remote user groups.
Self-motivated and capable of managing own tasks with little direct supervision, organization, able to prioritize and multi-task, works well under pressure and tight deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively and persuasively at all levels.
Preferred Experience:
Preferred experience with a pricing science and pricing management software such as
Zilliant, Price IQ, Price Manager, and Deal Manager
Competencies:
Deliver Compelling Communications
Influence Others
Demonstrate Good Judgement
Initiate Action
Innovate
Learn Continuously
Build Trusting Relationships
Work Shift
8 Hr non-rotating shift, Hrs fall to in punch day, Observed Calendar, shift starts AM

Job Title: Installation Deployment Support Operations Planner and Analyst
Job Description:
Job Description
Location:
Fort Stewart,GA,US
Remote Work:
No
Job Number:
R0182162



Installation Deployment Support Operations Planner and Analyst

The Opportunity:

As an expert in transportation and mobility operations, your unique skill set inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to help solve some of our clients’ most complex problems and find solutions that keep our nation safe.

As an Installation Deployment Support Operations Planner and Analyst, you’ll bring your transportation and mobility expertise to determine and assess operational deployment readiness requirements backgrounds to collaborate with thought leaders in multinational, Joint, Army, and commercial agencies through the Joint Logistics Enterprise on projects for unit movement operations. You’ll use your skills as you plan, organize, and supervise the preparation and execution of unit movement and deployment operations.


Work with us to help assist commanders in planning and conducting unit movement operations and operational maneuvers. Further your career while creating mission-forward solutions that matter.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

10+ years of experience with U.S. Army operational or sustainment planning and executing Mobilization Operations, Deployments Operations, Sustainment Operations, Redeployment Operations, Combat Training Center (CTC) rotations, Deployment Readiness Exercises (DRE), and Joint Event Life Cycle (JELC) exercises
Experience incorporating and applying the use of ATP 3-35, AR 525-93, FORSCOM 55-1, and ATP 5-2-1
Experience working at or with an Installation Transportation Office (ITO), Corps Transportation Office (CTO), Division Transportation Office (DTO), and Composition III (COMPO III) Deployment and Distribution Support Teams (DDST)
Experience as an air load planner
Knowledge of the Integrated Computerized Deployment System (ICODES) and TC-AIMS II introduction and access
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time
Secret clearance
HS diploma or GED
Completion of the Unit Movement Officer (UMO) Deployment Planning Course, and the Air Load Planners (ALP) or Joint Air Load Planners (JALP) Course
Completion of the Joint Operational Planning and Execution System (JOPES) Course or JOPES Support Personnel Course (JSPC)

Nice If You Have:

Experience with Airlift Integration Interface (A2I) for air load planning and validation
Completion of the U.S. Army Transportation School TC-AIMS II Course
Completion of the AMMO-62 Hazardous Material Certification Course

Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Create Your Career:

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen's culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we've compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $58,300.00 to $133,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

EEO Commitment

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Job Title: Finance Operations Analyst AP – Travel & Expense
Job Description:
At MIMEDX, our purpose starts with helping humans heal. We are driven by discovering and developing regenerative biologics utilizing human placental tissue to provide breakthrough therapies addressing the unmet medical needs for patients across multiple areas of healthcare. Possessing a strong portfolio of industry leading advanced wound care & surgical products, we are committed to making a transformative impact on the lives of patients we serve globally.




POSITION SUMMARY:




Participate in the daily operations and workflow activities for the shared services group of finance operations; including but not limited to Travel & Expense, Procure to Pay (P2P), and Order to Cash (O2C). Focus on an exceptional level of customer service while being a strong internal & external business partner to ensure communicated timelines are met. Develop and maintain key relationships with all stakeholders.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:




Assigned tasks will be a mixture of data entry, technical, IT and analytical skills in a cross-functional team environment with the requirement to collaborate effectively to implement and maintain business solutions
Set up and maintenance of new and existing employees in Concur which include secure login and security access rights
Maintain Concur to ensure audit and compliance with company travel policy and IRS requirements including responsibility for Concur training and employee support
Audit and process Concur expense reports in a timely manner
Maintain Concur database for all updates
Respond to messages on the Concur email and incoming calls in a timely manner
Support and maintain effective communication with internal partners and external suppliers to ensure acceptable service level agreements as assigned by management
Generate reporting from Concur for internal and exteral Audit requests
Assist with P-Card and Amex Corporate card set up
Send out new hire WEX gas card account information and activate employee accounts
Maintain WEX (company gas cards) system including employee changes and terminations
Responsible for PBC requests from internal & external auditors related to Concur travel & expense
Engage in process improvement opportunities and initiate relevant cost reduction practices to drive efficiency
Serve as backup support for AP as needed including but not limited to: process & enter invoices, download invoices from AP email box and copy to shared network folder



PROBLEM SOLVING:




Effectively identifies problems as they occur and takes appropriate steps to solve them in situations where the problem is not difficult or complex
Refers complex, unusual problems to supervisor



DECISION MAKING/SCOPE OF AUTHORITY:




Under general supervision, exercises some judgement in accordance with well-defined policies, procedures, techniques
Work typically involves regular review of output by a senior coworker or supervisor



SPAN OF CONTROL/COMPLEXITY:




Fully functioning support role having greater responsibility to perform all (or most) of the standard work within the function; moderate impact to the department



EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:




Associates Degree in Accounting preferred
Minimum 5 years’ experience in field



SKILLS/COMPETENCIES:




Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
Comprehensive knowledge of Accounting procedures and principles
Hands on experience working with spreadsheets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
High Level of accuracy and efficiency
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information that must not be shared with others
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite such as Excel and Word

Company Name: Savannah College of Art and Design
Job Description:
As a housing operations technical analyst, you will report to the senior director of housing operations to deliver exceptional customer service to all SCAD Savannah residents, university partners, vendors, and community partners. Responsibilities include managing student user data via StarRez; implementing room selections, assignments, change requests, and cancellations processes; enforcing details of the Housing License Agreement, such as housing contract dates, room consolidation, check-in and checkout processes, and damage billing; serving as a liaison between residential students and physical resources; and supporting, programming, and testing residence life and housing software platforms like StarRez. You will also provide guidance, training, and development to residence life professional and paraprofessional staff regarding housing operations processes. Opportunities for innovation and improvement are approached in collaboration with the senior director of housing operations and the IT department.

Bachelor’s degree with excellent customer service and user experience skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic office environment

Preferred qualifications:

Systems thinking and data analytics background
Experience in IT, university housing and residence life, or student affairs, especially utilizing StarRez

Certificates, licenses, and registrations:

Valid driver’s license and acceptance as a SCAD authorized driver

Work Hours: The university work week is Sunday through Saturday. Most offices are open Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. To accommodate business needs, employees may be assigned to other workdays and/or hours, including weekends and evenings.

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. The position will work closely with dedicated brand analytics and operations teams to understand Guest Experience (GX) KPIs and provide strategic insights to drive decision-making. The expectation is that this individual will become an expert on multiple sources of GX experience data and analytic models critical to business insights and decision-making across all Inspire brands.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Development of analytical models and decision tools to inform operations and brand leaders regarding all elements of the Guest experience and its impact on customer retention across the Inspire Brands portfolio

Maintaining and enhancing the GX feedback program, including data collection & integration, field-facing dashboards and insights, and internal analytics support.

Performing analysis to identify top drivers impacting restaurant performance and provide data-driven insights to drive change

Support cross-functional assignments and projects with analytic support requests made by brand counterparts

Work as an operations data governance steward, partnering with the IT/data platform teams to ensure data accuracy

Proficiency working with SQL or Python, experience with data visualization software (i.e. Tableau, Power BI) a plus

Experience in automating reporting and implementing scalable processes

Experience coordinating with IT/data platform teams for data management and validation

Job Title: Inside Sales Account Rep Senior Analyst
Job Description:
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Song, Technology and Operations services — all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.


In today’s business environment, growth isn’t just about building value—it's fundamental to long-term business survival. So how do organizations sustain themselves? Bachelor's degree

Technology and/or inside sales experience

Experience delivering group presentations

Has metrics-based sales experience with emphasis on performance, quota attainment, and promotion

Specific knowledge of the IT and cloud- based technology industry

Title: Business Analyst-Human Capital Analyst

Locations: Dublin, GA; Atlanta, GA.

Join a fast-growing company of dedicated professionals who bring a diverse set of talents and experience to collaboratively deliver high-impact solutions to their clients.

At GovStrive, we are committed to helping federal agencies better understand the needs of their workforce and support their critical operational priorities for HR. We partner with our clients to transform their HR strategy by improving business processes, conducting data analysis, integrating innovative systems, and cultivating a workforce culture ready for the future of work. Our cloud-based solutions and diversified talent enable federal agencies to make better business decisions for their organization – all while aligning our strategy to the agency’s mission and enabling a stronger workforce culture. GovStrive is a people-centric organization that invests in their employees’ professional growth.

Position Summary
We are looking for a self-driven, resourceful Human Capital Analyst who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment to join our Dublin or Atlanta, GA office. As a member of the Consulting team, the Human Capital Analyst will support projects and workstreams that help organizations manage and improve their business performance and operations. Areas of responsibility will include, but are not limited to project management, program management, HR service delivery, business process re-engineering, workforce strategy and talent management, change management, employee engagement, organizational design, training, leadership development, and diversity, equity & inclusion. The Human Capital Analyst will actively participate as a member of a project team to identify, recommend, develop, and implement programs, processes and frameworks that deliver required results in support of the overall objectives of our clients. This position requires interaction with clients at all levels, various vendors, and 3rd party consultants.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with team members on your project workstream, prioritize work assignments, and execute next steps.
Prepare for and participate in client meetings, internal meetings and working sessions.
Support client satisfaction through the delivery of quality service/work products and results.
Execute against technical approaches, frameworks and methodologies based on guidance received from leadership.
Provide inputs to the development of project deliverables (e.g., briefings, presentations, reports/dashboards, trainings, communications, standard operations procedures).
Contribute to business development efforts, including proposals and whitepapers.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with a focus in business, human resources, organizational psychology, or related field
Fundamental analytical, critical thinking, and conceptual reasoning abilities
Excellent documentation skills
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Facilitation skills
Decisive and effective judgment
Ability to collaborate well in teams while also working independently
Comfort with ambiguity by demonstrating flexibility and adaptability
Efficient managing time and prioritizing workload
Experience working in Microsoft Office suite

GovStrive offers a culture that supports work-life balance and invests in our employees’ development and personal growth. GovStrive offers a comprehensive benefits package, including PTO, healthcare, matching 401K, flexible hours, identity protection, and a collaborative work environment.


EEO Statement

GovStrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. GovStrive does not discriminate in employment on the basis of age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, sexual orientation, or protected veteran status.

Job Title: Analyst III, Sales Incentive Compensation & Alignments
Job Description:
Provide analytics for alignment and Sales Incentive Comp for Commercial Operations. The individual will need to be the subject matter expert for alignment and Sales IC. They will work with the team on day to day processes, and cover ad hoc projects where needed. The role will act as an executor of assigned work and be able to digest and model data for interpretation. Execute and implement processes measures to gain efficiencies with departmental functions. The individual will be responsible for consistent communication and alignment with key stakeholders regarding issues/changes affecting Incentive Compensation.As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in a number of ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees.

Duties & Responsibilities

Systems
Be proficient in CompMax system.
Review and understand downstream effects of system interactions that feed the CompMax system where appropriate.
Proficient understanding of Bitman and how the system interacts with CompMax.
Strategy/Analysis
Analyze data and interpret trends.
Identify potential issues via analysis to help avoid larger issues down stream and provide solutions to strategic needs.
Proactively communicate issues before they are identified by the field and provide information supporting solutions.
Display agility by running forensic analysis on ad hoc issues to identify root cause issues and solution.
Identify key stakeholders and communicate accordingly with business specific information.
Translate technical terminology into business speak when communicating to leadership and key stakeholders to ensure full understanding of the complexities to help support decision making.
Internal Control ' Audit / Integrity, Delivery ' Protect
Ensure adherence to risk control checklists, provides coordination and assistance for audits as they are performed.
Perform testing for CompMax and Bitman including new enhancements and regression testing.
Perform strategy testing, including set up, filters, components, verify all calculations and special conditions.
Continuous Improvement / Deliver ' Seek
Support review for root cause analysis for issues that arise within the full end-to-end process from goals and achievements to payment execution.
Provide input on opportunities to improve current processes and procedures.
Follow approved processes for updating system changes.
Communicate proactively when issues arise that may affect the desired output of the systems including CompMax and Bitman.
Project Support
Align with AD, Alignments and Incentive Compensation on key projects that roll up under the department and prioritize accordingly.
Participates on projects and contributes effectively as a team member on tasks of varied size and complexity to execute objectives.
Maintains and continually improves upon processes.
Delivers assignments on time, with quality, across multiple priorities.
Provide quality assurance and testing support, and verify information or data is correct in a quick and efficient method.
Performs all Company business in accordance with all regulations and Company policies and procedures. When violations are noted/observed they are to be immediately reported to management. Demonstrates high ethical and professional standards with all business contacts in order to main BI’s excellent reputation within the community.
Successfully completes Compliance Modules assigned annually by the Company.

Requirements

Bachelors degree (or equivalent experience) from an accredited institution in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Marketing, or other related field
Three to five (3-5) years of progressive experience in an administrative, Finance, customer service and/or relevant business experience.
Experience in Animal Health is a plus.
Extensive understanding of Sales and/or Incentive Compensation.
Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize and balance multiple tasks simultaneously.
Demonstrates acceptable level of performance for all relevant competencies as defined in the On Track To Success Competency Model. History of successful performance.
Process oriented individual with strong problem solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize and balance multiple tasks simultaneously.
Intermediate analytical skills with ability to model data for translation.

Process oriented individual with intermediate problem solving skills.

Senior Analyst, Success Operati ons

Department: Customer Success


Job Status: Full Time





FLSA Status: Exempt


Reports To: Director, Success Operations





Positions Supervised: None


Amount of Travel Required: 0%





WHY JOIN US?
We explore ways to deliver new value, foster creativity, and reach beyond boundaries. We use drive and commitment to energize, engage, and inspire others. We do what is important and strive for continuous improvement, work with passion, and purpose. We act with mutual respect, communicate fearlessly and collaborate to leverage our collective talents. At Riskonnect, we share this set of expectations and values. They guide us every day in every way. These values are more than words – they unite our organization and bring meaning and purpose to what we do.

THE TEAM
Teamwork is the heart of Riskonnect. We thrive on collaboration, believing it's the key to our growth and innovation in risk management. We encourage feedback, offer advancement opportunities, and support continuous learning. Join us to experience a culture that values teamwork and embraces a collaborative mindset, where your success is our success.



THE OPPORTUNITY
Riskonnect is looking for a Senior Analyst to join our growing Customer Success Operations team. In this role, you will report to the Director of Customer Success Operations and partner closely with Customer Success leadership to deliver data driven insights, drive visibility and understanding of core metrics and business drivers, improve operational efficiencies, and develop scalable strategies to improve the customer experience. The ideal candidate is intellectually curious, strategically, and analytically minded, proactive in seeking solutions to challenging problems, and highly focused on solving problems for our customers.

WHAT MAKES YOU A FIT?
If you're an innovator and a pioneer who's passionate about not just your own success but also contributing to the success of both our internal and external customers, you're exactly the kind of candidate we're looking for. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where your success is intertwined with the satisfaction and achievement of both customers and teammates. In addition to your innovative mindset and commitment to teamwork, you should possess the following skills and requirements:

Leverage data to create analyses on Customer data (Health, Risk & other Customer Journey data) which result in actionable insights and strategic recommendations for the Customer Success leadership team.
Dissect trends, quantify opportunities, and undertake customer and driver-based revenue modeling to support business planning and forecasting processes.
Own and develop reporting and analytics for Customer Success and Support; driving increased visibility into core metrics such as renewal rates, time to solve, gross and net retention, client health scores and other metrics.
Analyze and evaluate the impact of key business initiatives, and proactively surface insights and areas of opportunity for the business.
Ensure leaders and individual contributors work with the right set of leading, real time, or lagging date set to measure customer performance and take action to achieve goals.
Implement processes to improve operational efficiency in a rapidly growing environment.
Build, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting, dashboards and analysis on key business metrics and challenges.
Partner with Customer Success leadership to understand and develop scalable strategies to improve business processes and systems, with a focus on operational excellence, improving team effectiveness and efficiency, and driving key outcomes for customers to achieve retention and health goals.
Develop a deep understanding of how Success Management correlates to Gross Retention across all products and customers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as Finance, Sales Operations, and Professional Services.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree in information systems, risk management, or a related field
5+ years of professional experience in an analytics/business operations/finance / consulting role; prior experience with SaaS a bonus.
Some experience of SQL and data visualization or other reporting solution preferred. Examples might be Domo, Tableau, PowerBI, Cognos, Crystal reports, Gainsight or similar.
Some work experience in a similar or related area is preferred.
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment and make decisions quickly.
Passion for delivering outstanding customer experience.
Understands and applies analysis tools/techniques, issue resolution skills and demonstrates strong knowledge of relevant factors in the industry.



WHY BE A PART OF OUR TEAM?

Delivering innovative solutions backed by world-class customer service starts with having the best talent. Our 500+ professionals are valued for the kind of inspired thinking and collaborative spirit that keeps us at the forefront of our industry. As a Riskonnect colleague, you’ll work alongside some of the best and brightest as you help customers manage some of the world’s most challenging and complex risks. In fact, for the past three years, Riskonnect has been recognized as a Best and Brightest Company to Work For (Nationwide). One year on the list could be a ‘one hit wonder’. Two years initiates a trend. Three years makes us part of a very exclusive club and shows the true essence of our organization is to ‘walk the walk’. We are very proud of this accomplishment.

If you read this and thought “I can do this!” then please submit your qualifications and apply directly at Riskonnect.com/company/careers/

Smart Space was created primarily to offer real solutions to the growing worldwide environmental crisis emerging from carbon emissions. Commercial and residential buildings account for the majority of the total carbon footprint of cities around the world. New buildings are built with this in mind, so the real key to substantial progress is reducing existing building energy consumption and carbon outputs. Smart Space is dedicated to retrofitting residential and commercial buildings to reduce energy waste, improve indoor air quality, while optimizing a return in the investment for clients. Using the most current technologies, diagnostic tools, and principals of building science, we are passionate about the whole building approach with the understanding that a space performs optimally as a integrated whole. We are a full service company that offers a complete range of products and services to improve the comfort, health, and efficiency of spaces.

We see our Building Analyst and Sales Technician as a source of our competitive advantage. Smart Space looks for people who are eager to bring skills, knowledge, and passion to an integrated team. As we work towards scaling our growth while maintaining the quality of our services, we are hiring a dedicated Building Analyst/Sales Technician who will have three key areas of responsibilities: (1) gathering and analyzing data, (2) learning and acquiring new skills in the continually evolving field of building science and sustainable retrofitting, and (3) educating our customers about the most effective strategies to improve comfort and indoor air quality, reduce energy waste, and save money.

Roles and Responsibilities
Establish an initial relationship with customers and communicate the scope of work (initial and post Smart Space BPI Home or Commercial Energy Assessment, sitting down to discuss reports generated, and filing of rebate applications etc)
Collect and analyze data of buildings using diagnostic tools (blower door, duct blaster, pressure pan tests, infrared camera imaging, safety testing, etc) with a keen eye towards quality control, detail, and mitigating risk
Select and manage tools, materials, equipment, and track inventory
Identify any health and safety issues related for retrofitting projects
Inspect and analyze building envelope, mechanical systems, electrical systems, or process systems to determine the energy consumption of each system
Analyze technical feasibility of energy savings measures using knowledge of engineering, energy productions, energy use, construction costs, maintenance, system operation, or process system.
Generate software reports based on gathered data
Educate residential customers based on date gathered, software modeling, and principals of building science on the most effective retrofit projects to reduce energy waste, improve indoor air quality and comfort.
Negotiate terms of agreements and draft contracts
Prepare internal and external reports pertaining to job status
Proven working experience in related fields
Able to articulate a broad knowledge of and passion for building science and the field of sustainable retrofitting in a thoughtful, concise, and professional manner
Expert knowledge of building products, construction details, relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards
Familiarity with software modeling programs for retrofitting
Qualifications
Proven working experience in related fields
Able to articulate a broad knowledge of and passion for building science and the field of sustainable retrofitting in a thoughtful, concise, and professional manner
Expert knowledge of building products, construction details, relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards
Familiarity with software modeling programs for retrofitting

Required Skills

Outstanding communication, relationship, and collaboration skills
Resourcefulness in the ability to achieve results in the most effective manner
Excellent organization and time management skills, including the ability to work within strict deadlines
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Comfortable in wearing multiple hats when necessary to get the job done
Communicate and align strategy with key internal and external stakeholders
Eager to learn and acquire new skills and knowledge as the field evolves and changes

Operating business model analysis of the current business systems supporting product quality and identification of gaps in process and data streams
Identify and expand value streams including and aligning with system application and process mapping
Support synergies with global business entities to ensure alignment for needs and growth requirements are met

Provide input and training related to the product quality business systems throughout the organization as identified and needed
Accomplish project objectives by planning and evaluating related activities and communicating status and project to management on a regular basis

Job Title:
Financial Operations Analyst
Company:
Prologis
Prologis is looking for a Financial Operations Analyst/Associate to join our multifaceted Operations team. You will have direct accountability and ownership of budgeting, forecasting, processing, planning, analysis and reporting of multiple financial metrics for a portfolio of assets within assigned markets in our growing East Region. If you're looking to make an impact on a Global level, apply today! This role will be operating locally out of our Buckhead office.
Position Responsibilities:
Budgeting, Forecasting & Reporting
Responsible for the preparation, coordination and review of annual operating budgets, forecasts, reporting and monthly variance analysis of each assigned market.
Coordinate collection of leasing assumptions, operating and capital expenses for budgets and forecasts.
Review budget, forecast and actual results for reasonableness and take appropriate action as necessary. Examples of follow-up actions are giving feedback to the operations teams about their inputs, correcting errors found through in-depth cash flow analysis, and explaining variances between forecasts and actual monthly accounting results.
Participate in the preparation of quarterly budget and forecast presentations to divisional leadership.
Serve as the Operations Finance expert in assigned markets and be a resource to the local team.
Present forecasting, budgeting, and reporting results to Market Officer, with a focus on key performance drivers
Provide guidance to Property Management and Leasing Teams on forecasting, budgeting, and reporting systems and processes.
Act as a liaison between accounting and the local market teams
Support senior management and cross-functional business partners with timely, accurate and actionable analysis.
Track key performance indicators (KPI’s) (i.e., NOI, Same Store Sales, Occupancy, Rent Change, Turnover Costs, Capital Expenditures) and explain main performance drivers and variances.
Provide data stewardship for leasing activity from lease review through data entry, including workflow management between multiple groups to ultimately ensure that reporting captures the transactions’ character. Serve as an expert in the reporting implications of lease transactions.
Essential Skills & Experience:
Undergraduate degree, preferably with a concentration in finance, accounting, real estate, or economics
3+ years related work or related graduate course work experience. Budgeting and forecasting experience is a plus.
Excellent analytical and written communication skills, including the ability to present and engage with regional management team members.
Advanced Excel modeling skills a must
Proficient using Word and PowerPoint
Self-starter – ability to creatively tackle new situations and analyses without heavy direction.
High level of intellectual curiosity with strong desire to continuously learn, improve / automate existing processes and solve problems independently.
Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy
Execute responsibilities with a sense of urgency and follow-through.
Positive and proactive work ethic, with a strong commitment to delivering a high level of customer service.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines with efficiency and accuracy.
Show tact, discretion, confidentiality and good judgement in handling sensitive and confidential matters and documentation.
Hiring Salary Range of: $75,000–$91,000. Salary and whole compensation package (bonus target) to be determined by the candidate’s location, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data.

About the Role:
Job Summary
Under the minimal supervision of a manager or director and according to established policy and procedures, the Business Systems Technical Analyst demonstrates knowledge of ERP system/software design, build, test, support and performs complex system analysis, design, integration, testing, implementation, maintenance and planning of assigned applications and/or projects. Directly interacts with assigned department managers and staff to provide automation services in support of department’s strategic and operational objectives. Plans, coordinates, develops and provides appropriate training for managers and users. Ensures development of training materials, production of continuity workbooks, documentation of standard operating procedures and user checklists. Serves as the contact and liaison with user community and vendor. Responsible for performing job duties in accordance with mission, vision and values of NGHS. Participates in department and hospital task forces, focus groups and/or committees as assigned by their supervisor to meet the group objectives. This position is accountable for developing and sharing knowledge with other members of IT and operations, and mentoring Analysts. The Business Systems Technical Analyst position is responsible for providing system-level support for various business applications, currently including the Infor Lawson ERP application, as well as technical project management. System-level support includes installation, configuration, maintenance, training, reporting and production support for business ERP applications, currently including the Infor Lawson application. This position works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation and knowledge with the application. The Business System Technical Analyst may provide leadership for other team members as well as the business units, technology teams and support teams. This position will support the business objectives of the hospital as well as the delivery of safe patient care and services. This position, with the approval of the Manager and Director of Business Applications, has the ability to be 100% remote employment

Description:


Company Overview

At Procure Analytics (PA), we are passionate about driving continuous value by utilizing cutting-edge technology and implementing customized solutions in various categories to service our 900+ member companies.

Headquartered in Atlanta, PA was founded to address the complex challenges of frequently ignored indirect and tail spend categories of Maintenance, Repair, and Operations (MRO), Packaging, and Freight. PA combines $1.5b+ of purchasing leverage and supplier relationships, together with dedicated advisors, proprietary analytics, and artificial intelligence, to drive ongoing value and supply chain resiliency for our members. PA’s analytical and reporting tools offer the insight needed to optimize MRO, Packaging, and Freight – all at no cost to members.

In the last decade, PA has grown from 2 employees and $5 million in total managed spend to over 100 employees and more than $1.5 billion dollars in spend, while maintaining its high-touch service model and member-focus.

PA has a very collaborative, humble, and values-driven culture that upholds these guiding principles:

Act with integrity and in compliance
Drive value creation
Be disciplined entrepreneurs
Be innovative
Be accountable
Treat others with dignity and respect
Strong Private Equity Ownership

In December 2021, Genstar Capital invested in PA, along with a large rollover from Bregal Sagemount and the management team.


Genstar Capital is a leading private equity firm that has been actively investing in high quality companies for over 30 years. Based in San Francisco, Genstar has developed a strong market reputation of working in partnership with management teams and its network of strategic advisors to build industry-leading businesses while generating outsized returns. Genstar’s vision is to help build lasting, impactful companies that will continue to succeed well beyond their ownership.

Genstar currently has approximately $33 billion of assets under management and targets investments focused on targeted segments of the software, industrials, healthcare, and financial services industries. In 2020, Genstar was ranked 2nd worldwide in aggregate private equity fund performance (out of 529 PE firms) and ranked 3rd in 2019 (out of 497 PE firms) by HEC-Dow Jones. For more information, please visit www.gencap.com.

The Loan Operations Analyst is responsible for researching and resolving loan control reconciliation discrepancies and identifying, recommending and implementing process enhancements to prevent future discrepancies while ensuring compliance with bank policies, procedures, and applicable laws/regulations. Performs other projects and duties as assigned.

Essential Functions, Duties, and Responsibilities:

Serve as subject matter expert on the areas of the Loan Hubs and Loan Operations involved in the loan control clearing process (e.g., booking, funding, payment processing, etc.).
Serve as a point of contact between Accounting and other departments to investigate and clear outstanding items on the GL and DDA reconciliations owned by the Loan Operations Department including, but not limited to, Loan Control, Payments in Process, ACH Clearing, Indirect, Escrow, etc.
Track and report to management on progress of outstanding items needing resolution.
Recommend controls and process enhancements by performing root cause analysis on loan control reconciliation outages; writing improved procedures to implement recommendations.
Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes.
Train employees on transactional impact related to the reconciliation process, including debit/credit process.
Work with Audit, Compliance and Risk Departments for ongoing reviews and follow up.
Assist Loan Operations with writing new and updating existing procedures within the Department as needed.
Follow departmental procedures and guidelines to meet the compliance standards.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Competencies:

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Individual must be detailed with a high degree of initiative and attention to detail.
Needs a thorough understanding of loan terminology and workflow of loan closing process.
Able to perform accurate calculations and transactions.
Must be self-motivated and able to operate independently in the absence of other departmental personnel.
Must have strong systems knowledge of the primary systems utilized by the company with a skill set to easily learn other systems and teach other analysts, as necessary, to lead or assist in projects assigned.
Strong analytical skills and problem solving.
Advanced computer proficiency.
Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite Products.
Strong time management and organizational skills and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Knowledge of general accounting principles, especially the debit/credit relationship.
General lending knowledge.

Industry and Work Experience:

Minimum of 3 years’ banking experience required, preferably in a Loan Operations environment.

Academic:

High school diploma or GED required.
Bachelor’s degree in business or related field preferred.

Job Summary:

As a Retail Sales Analyst for The Home Depot suppliers, you will be responsible for analyzing sales data and providing actionable insights to optimize product performance and drive revenue growth. Working closely with the sales and marketing teams, you will play a crucial role in making data-driven decisions to enhance the supplier's presence and profitability within The Home Depot stores.

Key Responsibilities:

Sales Data Analysis:
Gather, clean, and analyze sales data from various sources, including point-of-sale systems, inventory reports, and market trends.
Identify sales patterns, trends, and opportunities to uncover potential growth areas and challenges.
Performance Reporting:
Prepare and present regular sales performance reports to key stakeholders, highlighting key metrics and KPIs.
Monitor and evaluate product performance, promotional activities, and overall sales effectiveness.
Demand Forecasting:
Utilize historical sales data and market trends to create accurate demand forecasts for supplier products.
Collaborate with inventory and supply chain teams to ensure optimal stock levels and prevent stockouts.
Pricing and Promotion Analysis:
Assess the impact of pricing strategies and promotional activities on sales and profit margins.
Recommend pricing adjustments and promotional plans to maximize sales and profitability.
Market Research:
Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and consumer behavior to inform sales strategies.
Conduct market research and analyze consumer feedback to provide insights on product improvements.
Sales Strategy and Planning:
Work with the sales team to develop effective strategies for increasing product visibility and market share within The Home Depot.
Assist in the development and execution of sales plans and marketing campaigns.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create clear and concise data visualizations, graphs, and charts to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Collaborate with internal teams, including sales, marketing, and supply chain, to align strategies and achieve shared goals.
Support category reviews and business meetings with The Home Depot.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in a retail or consumer goods environment.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Microsoft Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences.
Knowledge of the home improvement industry and The Home Depot's retail environment is a plus.
Experience with big box retailers a must.
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

The Retail Sales Analyst role for The Home Depot suppliers requires a blend of data analysis expertise, retail industry knowledge, and collaboration skills to drive the supplier's success in The Home Depot stores.

Experience participating in planning new systems/processes/re-engineering and working collaboratively across organization to support business systems.
Ability to effectively function in dynamic environment subject to changes in schedules and priorities, and work on multiple projects/issues concurrently. Assist with evening and weekend work (per assigned rotation) in response to needs of the systems supported.
Experience desired (but not required) in healthcare supporting business applications.

As a thought-leader and best-in-class provider in education, wellness, youth development, and community-building, The YMCA of Metro Atlanta is one of the oldest and most essential non-profits serving in Atlanta. Today, we’re looking for you to join us as we carry out our mission to positively impact lives and communities across the state.

At the Y, we’re an association of like-minded people (staff, volunteers, and members), on the forefront of a movement to ensure that everyone - especially children - experience an equal opportunity to reach their full potential. In the course of a year, we provide more than 3,000 children, ages 6 weeks through Pre-K with high-quality literacy and STEAM-infused learning; give 58,000 youth and teens access to sports, aquatics, day and resident camps, teen leadership development programs, and employment opportunities; provide over 200,000 members with programs, services, and facilities to enjoy connection and maintain wellness regardless of age; and engage over 25,000 volunteers and donors from across Atlanta to share in the gift of supporting their communities.

NATURE AND SCOPE:
Under the direction of the Director, Enterprise Services, the Business Systems Analyst works in partnership with YMCA departments and system owners to understand their goals, tactics and needed business capabilities, and recommends solutions that enable efficient and effective operations and growth. The incumbent will design, develop, test, launch, and maintain a portfolio of systems, tools, and workflows which enable business operations, decision-making, personal productivity, cross-team interaction, and employee and customer engagement.
RESPONSIBILITIES (including, but not limited to):
Strategy & Planning:
Meet with system / process owners and end-users to understand their business and operations, goals, challenges, and opportunities.
Analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of business systems, reporting / analytics systems, and collaboration tools, and identify opportunities to further leverage, retire or replace these systems.
Maintain a catalog of common patterns to be reused in new solution designs.
Conduct interviews and gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, and site visits.
Lead design sessions to define or prototype system features.
Participate in functional user groups and other meetings, sharing problems and identifying solutions across multiple YMCA business teams and systems.
Confirm and manage the priorities of current and upcoming customer work requests.
Stay current on technology trends, understand, and research emerging technologies, and evaluate feasibility and practical application for the benefit of the YMCA.
Acquisition & Development:
Participate in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.
Prepare requests for proposal, conduct research on software and hardware products, vendors, and consultants, and perform cost-benefit analyses to justify recommendations.
Translate business needs into functional / technical solutions and operational processes.
Design, build, configure, and maintain responsive, flexible, and scalable solutions.
Plan and perform in-depth functional, non-functional and regression testing, with expected results and end-user reviews, to ensure features and functions have been correctly enabled and optimized.
Provide orientation and training to YMCA teams, including IT operations, to ensure the solution is appropriately sustained.
Create systems models, specifications, diagrams, charts, and other required documentation to guide application developers and IT operations teams.
Ensure that deliverables adhere to YMCA architecture and security standards, and external regulations, and that solutions operate efficiently and reliably.
Ensure that robust dev-ops processes and procedures are followed and that all systems are fully supportable prior to migration to a production state.
Service Delivery & Operational Management:
Deliver assignments on time, with high quality and with no surprises.
Develop and provide subject matter expertise and support for enterprise systems and tools.
Collaborate with customers to ensure their systems and IT service delivery meets business needs and expectations.
Quickly respond to and resolve incidents, conduct root cause analysis, and take corrective and preventative measures to reduce the risk of recurrence.
Promptly inform management of any incidents which compromise the information of any person or organization on which YMCA maintains data.
Adhere to IT principles, architectures, methods, policies, and procedures, and maintain required documentation.
Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house and externally hosted systems.
Ensure YMCA controls, external regulations and IT principles are followed by all delivering IT services to YMCA.
Maintain an inventory of all applications used by YMCA, and periodically assess business, technical and operational health with the goal of informing future investments.
REQUIREMENTS:
Associate degree in a technology field and 3+ years of experience or a high school diploma and 4+ years of experience as a business systems analyst
Building, maintaining, documenting, and supporting complex, reliable and accurate systems
Microsoft certification
SaaS solutions and application integration services
Microsoft Azure & Active Directory
Business intelligence, data visualization and reporting services
Microsoft 365 Global Administration and Management
Microsoft Office Apps, SharePoint, Teams
Thirst for knowledge, intellectual curiosity
Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities
Logical and efficient
Thinks critically, evaluates assumptions, and has a keen attention to detail
Highly self-motivated and directed
Solves a range of straightforward problems; analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures
Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action
Ability to work across the organization
Strong customer-service / user-experience orientation
Excellent interpersonal skills, both in person and written
Ability to travel approximately up to 5% (can be up to 1 - 3 days or more in a month, including weekends, depending upon scheduling requirements)
Ability to work out of core office hours as required to achieve personal and departmental goals, and to respond to critical incidents
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree in a technology field
5+ years of experience as a business systems analyst
Certifications: Microsoft and/or other certifications a plus
Azure Data Factory a plus
Knowledge about the YMCA Movement
PowerBI and SQL a plus
Mobile web and/or mobile apps is a plus
PowerShell, SSO a plus
Intune a plus
Forms, Flow, Automate a plus
Other certifications a plus
Physical requirements include frequent standing, sitting, walking, lifting 20-50 lbs., reaching and manual dexterity skills to operate computer. Occasionally may stoop/squat, crawl/crouch, pull/push, twist trunk/neck climb, and grasp or squeeze with right and left hard in completing required tasks of position. Communications skills necessary for this position include writing, speech, vision, hearing and reading comprehension.
Employment Requirement:
Ability to pass a pre-employment background check including Criminal Record check, Drug Screening and motor vehicle record (MVR) according to company policy.
Must be legally eligible to work in the US without current or future sponsorship.

The Implementation Operations Analyst will play an integral part in supporting Implementation Project Management (IPM) teams and leadership by employing a data-driven approach to improve operational performance. Specifically, this role will be instrumental in completing termination requests, standard renewal orders, account mergers/acquisitions/name changes, and ensuring quality control of departmental functions by generating consistent performance metrics. The Implementation Operations Analyst is responsible for building strategic partnerships, consulting with, and influencing multiple groups in order to deliver business insights and improve existing processes. Strong analytical and research skills are highly valued, and demonstrated commitment to growth in the role is expected.
RESPONSIBILITIES, other duties may be assigned.
Identify problems, research issues and recommend solutions in collaboration with the IPM team and leadership.
Maintain various databases and reports for key tracking measures in support of multiple groups across the organization.
Build strong cross-functional relationships to support operational processes.
Collaborate with IPM & CPD resources to provide detailed post-deliverable tracking, updates and resolution.
Partner with Facilities and Technology Operations teams to provide project closing packages for post-project QA and ongoing customer support.
Determine appropriate methods to review and analyze company policies and operational processes.
Quantify process inputs and outputs to identify operational improvement opportunities.
Promote a culture of continuous improvement by proactively gaining insights to develop an improvement “pipeline.”
Export, combine, groom and analyze datasets from business applications (e.g., customer service interactions, customer and employee surveys).
Collaborate across multiple teams to improve operational efficiency and quality end-to-end.
Recommend changes and update written policies and procedures.
Utilize project management principles & tools to be more effective, efficient, and adapt to changing environments
Work in a team environment supporting the entire organization to resolve issues between Sales, Product, Legal, Billing and Implementation departments.
Perform extensive research to identify and resolve data integrity issues.
Integrate customer account data with meticulous attention to detail.
Perform contract validation (Dates, Revenue, Subscriptions).
Craft quality, professionally written communications and templates.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Science (BS) degree or equivalent professional experience
Two or more years of IT, Project Management, Service Delivery or Customer Relationship Management experience.
Knowledge of Project Management principles.
Experience with data analysis tools.
Experience with (or willingness to learn) required business applications and databases including ServiceNow, ScienceLogic, Salesforce, et al.
Proficient with Microsoft Office suite.
US Citizenship for this position is required by law due to federal customer contracts
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Documented training or certification in ITIL v3/v4 Foundation, Agile/Scrum, Project/Program Management or related disciplines.
Basic understanding of critical data center environmental components, e.g. space, power, cooling and connectivity.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Ability to multi-task and is a self-motivated, goal-oriented individual.
Generates clear and concise internal and customer communications.
Exhibits excellent interpersonal skills with all levels of the organization.
Uses organizational skills to determine task prioritization.
Focuses on scope, tone, and quality of processes and their respective documentation, as well as associated goals, deadlines and priorities.
Performs necessary and timely follow-up, escalating appropriately if necessary.

A leader in technology and innovation, Southwire Company, LLC is one of North America’s largest wire and cable producers. Southwire and its subsidiaries manufacture building wire and cable, metal-clad cable, portable and electronic cord products, OEM wire products and engineered products. In addition, Southwire supplies assembled products, contractor equipment and hand tools. We are proud to offer competitive compensation, employee benefits, tuition reimbursement, and unlimited growth opportunities. Our nearly seven decades of progressive growth can be attributed to our determination to developing innovative systems and solutions, exercising environmental stewardship and enhancing the wellbeing of our communities. How will you power what’s possible?

Location: Carrollton Headquarters

Long Description

As a member of the Innovation and SAP team, the Director of Business Intelligence and Analytics will lead the implementation and enhancement of our next generation business intelligence and analytics platform. The director will lead a team of ~10 Southwire employees and another ~8 contractors in delivery and enhancements of business intelligence products. The Director will continue to grow the Southwire self-service analytics program. This leader will help drive key business transformational initiatives within Southwire while helping build and shape a data driven culture.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Serve as a close partner with the business to build analytics and reporting solutions to optimize our business
Develop, test, and maintain custom business analytics dashboards by leveraging state of the art software development practices preferably using an agile methodology.
Lead the deployment of next generation analytics platform which consists of Tableau, Snowflake and existing BW ETL toolset.
Participate in design and architecture discussions with business leaders, end users and IT team members
Lead cross-functional teams to help identify critical priorities and recommendations
Stay updated with business operations and business intelligence processes and technologies
Recommend improvements to provide optimum reporting solutions
As a servant leader, develop and grow a high-performing, highly collaborative IT analytics team
Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science along with 5-7 years of related experience, with at least 7+ years of management experience leading teams, MBA or master’s in business or technology related field (preferred)
7-10 years’ experience in implementing successful data integration and BI efforts preferably with SAP as ERP source system and Snowflake. Experience with SAP Business Warehouse a plus
Ideal candidate will have experience building and making good teams great. Additionally, looking for someone who can establish and build relationships with the business and other leaders in IT. Experience implementing self-service analytics model a huge plus.
Knowledge and understanding of SAP Business Warehouse, Snowflake, Tableau is critical. Familiarity with SAP Analytics Cloud not a requirement but would be a plus.
Experience working with Agile Scrum methodology a plus
Ability to plan, prioritize, delegate work and follow-up to ensure work completion
Experienced in drafting SOWs and managing vendor deliverables
Experience building and maintaining successful vendor relationships
Interact with Business Analysts, Developers, Architects and business leadership as it relates to requirements.
Effective oral and written communication skills
Great organizational skills, attention to detail and follow through
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to establish and maintain a SDLC process that rapidly delivers analytics solutions for our users
Experience helping drive an analytics and data driven culture.
Long Description

Remote work is possible for the right candidate. We would ask that candidate be willing to travel on-site one week per month to help build and maintain team comradery and business relationships.

Overview:
The Enterprise Systems – Lead ERP Procurement Product Owner role is the System Owner and Functional Lead of the Oracle ERP Supply Chain modules with responsibility for data flows, integrations, configuration and technical support for Chick-fil-A Supply, Bay Center Foods, and Offsite Thawing Pilot. This person is responsible for partnering with each Business to define, document and consult on functional and technical requirements to support daily Operations and enable future growth of each Business.
As wholly owned subsidiaries of Chick-fil-A, Inc., Chick-fil-A Supply and Bay Center Foods are food production and distribution services networks focused entirely on serving the unique needs and growing volume of Chick-fil-A restaurants.
The Chick-fil-A Supply and Bay Center Foods service networks are comprised of three components:
Distribution Center – State-of-the-art warehouses that house supply for Chick-fil-A restaurants
Production Distribution Center – Offsite facilities that prepare select ingredients and menu items for Chick-fil-A restaurants
Transportation – Growing fleet of delivery vehicles that supply Chick-fil-A restaurants
Responsibilities:
Define System Enhancements/Improvements based on Business Needs and requirements, along with technical capabilities
Partner with system’s stakeholders to define/validate new and existing integration touchpoints across the network
Identify and document system gaps for product backlog for future enhancements/capabilities
Provide Direct and Indirect Procurement expertise in all areas of the Distribution and Manufacturing businesses for operational guidance and best practices
Lead and execute the development of new and existing configurations as well as supporting documentation that enables Change Management and End User Training
Strong understanding of Master Data Management to enable Standards across all Entities and System Platforms
Lead and execute the development of new and existing configurations as well as supporting documentation that enables Change Management and End User Training
Lead and own the Business Relationship with Software Vendors that delivers excellent Customer Service and responsiveness to the Business
Provide 2nd Level Operational Support for all Entities for each Platform that includes advanced troubleshooting techniques and tools to minimize Business impacts
Develop business case documentation along with financial justification and ROI for all initiatives. Partner with IT leadership to establish project approach and timeline
Lead and execute the documenting of the current-state and future-state business process requirements including data flows, configurations, and reporting needs
Frontline support for new site implementations, major rollouts, etc. to ensure smooth and efficient adoption and stabilization
Lead and execute Testing Phases for Implementations to ensure systems address business stakeholder needs from users’ point of view
Manage simultaneous projects across all Entities to coordinate all aspects of implementation and delivery of tasks necessary for successful project execution
Lead and coordinate all software version upgrades with Business Stakeholders and Software Vendors to ensure successful migrations and minimal business interruptions

Business Requirements
Strong IT and Operational experience with Enterprise ERP Procurement, including Direct and Indirect, having great perspective on how users interact with the system
Deep understanding of chain of custody for critical value streams such as Lifecycle Management, Procurement processes, Inventory Control and Invoice Reconciliation processes
Deep understanding of data relationships to enable System-to-System performance
Working knowledge of Planning processes in a Manufacturing and Distribution Center
Strong experience in a Start-up or new Business Development environment

Customer Relations
Work closely with distribution centers, food production centers and business partners to ensure optimal alignment
Possess intimate knowledge of who the customers are and the ability to put others above himself/herself
Demonstrate the ability to value both relationships and results

Who We Are:

From Georgia. For Georgia. Since 1914 Yancey Bros. Co. has proudly served as the authorized Caterpillar equipment dealer for Georgia, providing our customers with the highest quality sales, parts and service. From Caterpillar heavy and compact construction equipment to on-highway trucks, we remain committed to learning more about our customers, offering equipment and support to keep up with their changing needs. This all starts with our greatest asset…our employees.

What You Will Be Doing:

The Sales and Pricing Analyst is responsible for providing quotes of Caterpillar and Allied products with expert knowledge in configuration, worktools, financial products, merchandising used alternatives and product support products.

In providing these quotes, sales reps are provided a resource in handling the complexities of configuration, price lists, and merchandising in order to provide better coverage within their respective territories.

“Sell the house” – all of YBC’s strengths and abilities are not always communicated through sales reps alone. This position will bring all parties into quoting by offering all of our services (new, used/rental, finance, and product support).

Primary Responsibilities:
Provide quotes to sales reps.
Maintain standard quotes in I-Quote to quickly communicate to field reps.
Ensure the accuracy of quotes to aid in the processing of approved equipment orders, improving the flow of work for Sales Coordinators and invoicing personnel.
Maintain DBS configurations for all product (except CCE).
Maintain quick reference sheet.
Research and locate services and pricing for 3rd party services / vendors as required.
Level 2 quotes: become an expert on CAT programs to consult region managers on best route (programs, SPAR, etc.)
Pricing trends: as needed, provide reporting on pricing trends for specific models, including competitive pricing, as well as bands for Cat pricing.
Semi-annually maintain standardized pricing in iQuote for all YBC’s add on services (attachments, CVA’s product support std. jobs, etc.).
Customer pricing analysis: tracking of price, discount, and GP’s customer industry segments.
Additional Responsibilities:
Participate in required safety program, and work in a safe manner.
Additional duties as assigned by manager.
Who We Are Looking For:

To be successful in this position you should have a strong interest in learning about sales, be willing to discuss with customers their account and needs for additional equipment and collaborate with Yancey Sales Reps to develop and deliver solutions for our customers. You should possess a strong sense of urgency and desire to provide superior customer service. The ability to take direction and work in a team environment is essential to this position as well.

Education/Experience:
Four year college degree from an accredited institution.
Must have 3 – 5 years industry experience.
Required Qualifications/Skills:
Fluency in systems knowledge: DBS, iQuote, COTI, Lotus Notes, Caterpillar websites, and Microsoft office products.
Well organized.
Attention to detail.
Sense of urgency.
Excellent verbal and written skills.
Good interpersonal skills.
Ability to strive in a stressful environment.
